story:
In this audio-visual project, we honor the mediums that aided us in our self-realization journey, in our healing, and in our exploration and expression,

What is our project?

"Curtain Dissolving - افتحوا الستائر" is the first audio-visual expression that blends Sound, Music, Film, and Energetic/Psychedelic healing.

"Curtain Dissolving" is created through four mediums:

- Music. The music was created intuitively, and with time it became a therapeutic adventure that allowed to move from one place to another, from one state of mind to another. This is why each soundtrack is fluctuant because it reflects the state when it was created. A state which seeks an answer, sometimes insanity, sometimes playfulness, sometimes to empower, to control, to liberate, to unite, but most importantly to honor the journey itself.

- Vocal. Vocal layer that translates direct experiences we as collectives are having, have had, or are even afraid to have. These direct experiences are what shapes each one of us, and our project aims to encourage everyone to take moments of the daily lives for just our essence to be experienced and explored. We believe such moments are of the most significant and most valuable, they bury deep healing powers that transcend the agitated wounded mind! No one can give it to you except yourself, except yourself opening up to experiencing and receiving it. Therefore, our vocal choice is an example of our own way of showing gratitude and asking the universe for guidance.

- Visuals. Our take on the visual aspect of the project is non staged, non planned, nonrepetitive. We wanted everything to be real in the sense that it is not really performed or acted out. A ritual that lasted half an hour for each element was done by the Chinese Artist Yi.

- Offerings. These offerings are something that the audience can buy from us as a way of support. The offerings consist of things that reflect the project and would aid you to connect to the elements, us, and yourself.

Who are we?

Yahya Mourad is the creator of this project which is in constant change in its own flow. Yahya Mourad is an explorer, a multidisciplined artist aiming to become a healer. The main focus is to attract those who are undergoing a similar journey with their unique ways of expressing it artistically and spiritually.

What is our mission?

Explore, Experience, Express. We believe this should be everyone's mission and slogan.

Today most of us are capable to give tons of excuses for not doing that. We want to show you that it is within everyone's reach. We want to draw you and be drawn to you to merge that exploration, those experiences, and these expressions. We believe that each needs to find his/her own way into translating their essence in the form they feel comfortable with, and it's rewarding because one can heal and get rid of negativity and traumas by doing so.

Our mission is to keep on crossing borders whether cultural or inherited or advertised or geographic.

"Curtain Dissolving" Journey:

During the lockdown, I (Yahya Mourad) was in Nepal as i was doing something called "Vipassana", which is a 12 days silent meditation of 100 hours where you are not allowed to have your mobile or any electronic device or even a paper and a pen.

The moment he finished and checked my mobile, everything was almost getting lockdown.

It soon turned out to be a magical blessing where it allowed me to meet the Chinese Artist Yi, and the Chinese Yogist Eagwon.

We connected, and we realized we both had things we needed to heal from. Somehow the project aligned us together to purge, to learn about ourselves through these elements. We suddenly found ourselves mutually evolving without speaking much. We rarely discussed the project.

The visual aspect was challenging cause each ritual lasted around half an hour nonstop, and i cannot stop what is happening to change lenses nor repeat what i missed, nor even suggest different movements. I needed to accept that whatever i was managing to film was what needed to make up the audio-visual process.

Yi was leading the rituals. Yi has been exploring consciousness through experiencing Shamanism in different traditions around the world for the last 10 years. Creating art become a bridge for her to connect with different realities, as well as a tool to reveal her soul journey to complete herself.

We chose the spot of each shooting, we selected the element, and in each, a ritual began which allowed the purging to follow. An expression of gratitude was given to each of these elements.

I cannot express how magical, how real each ritual was. But you have the chance to watch it being transformed artistically into this project.

Eagwon, the Yogist, was almost never able to express with his body. In one of the fire rituals, it was on the 8/8/2020, the lion's gate night, the night where the big explosion in my country Lebanon happened as well. He transformed into a powerful being who was expressing through his body in a way i have not expected at all. He was a new person.

Why Crowdfunding?

As an independent artist, I have always favored working freely while being guided by the timing of the universe. I am rarely pushing things to happen on the clock. I believe when something is ready, it will be ready.

This project is not like any other. Some divine artistic projects do not work on papers and distant planning and deadlines. Such projects unfold with the permission of divine timing. Because we are also connected to it. And such connection is fluid. It cannot be controlled. Just like our lives. If we are really present and aware, we must acknowledge that things simply happen when they need to happen.

I am here to seek your help through your funds to aid the project along with its empowering and liberating messages and rewards to come to life and help us go through the shifts in our consciousness and reality to connect more with ourselves and everything around us.

I believe crowdfunding is a wonderful way to produce a project. Art such as the kind I'm invested in needs to be given the freedom to explore itself without much constrictions and with more opportunities and freedom to aid it to keep on transcending.

So i hope this journey brings more people together and continues to do so!

The Struggle:

The creating process has been long and slow, we need to follow the weather of the monsoon season in Nepal, so many changes during the lockdown and its effect on our financial situation. We are passionate to create, to create with the natural flow of nature, which is completely different from our society's flow.

All our work as artists got affected by this lockdown and here in Nepal we have no sources of income nor have opportunities to work, so part of this project is to give us a push to become financially stronger to take the project further and open more opportunities to make more and be more engaged with you.

The Rewards (Offerings):

We have decided to create the rewards in a way that would connect you better with the concept of the Audio-Visual project. In the rewards section, you will find things related to healing, connection, filming, coloring, and gatherings.

We believe the audience should experience the music along with what lies deep within it. We want our audience to be as much involved as possible and to tag along with us in our magical journey!

What the money will be spent on:

Paying to all those who already are contributing and investing their time and energy to create this magical journey. They have done it without expecting anything in return, but in such times where most of us were living through our savings that are running out. It is essential that we make some money out of our project to continue down that path.

We will use the money for our growth and continuation. We will offer some of it to aid others who cross our path to share their own exploration and expression with us. We also need to finish the editing which is still unraveling, the soundtrack itself which will be fused with singing bowl frequency and sound design. 

Traveling to the next destination which is Morocco for the shooting of the next Audio-Visual project titled ''Toxic Shamanic''.

story:
2021 UPDATE: The campaign has ended, but if you missed the deadline, send us an email at RustyShippBand@gmail.com and let us know what item(s) you'd like to order, and we'll send you a way to purchase! 

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Rusty Shipp's BRAND NEW adventure to the bottom of the ocean!

**NOTE: All perks purchased by fans WILL be manufactured and delivered, regardless if the crowdfunding goal is hit. It may just take longer for everything.**

Come join us in the crew of Rusty Shipp as we voyage together through the making of our newest full-length, concept album of 10+ original songs!

THE CONCEPT

Not to spoil the storyline of the concept album yet, but it will be following a journey to the recesses of the ocean to find what is lurking there beyond man's discovery. Sea monsters? Atlantis? Drowned souls jailed in Davy Jones' Locker? What else could be down there at the bottom of our planet? It’s the Earth’s biggest mystery: The Dark Side of the Ocean. 

This is actually a full-length concept album that we started working on right after the release of our 'Mortal Ghost' album, but we shelved it and decided to release an EP instead, which is what became 'Liquid Exorcist.' But now we're back to finishing this full-length concept album with songs that we've been perfecting for years, in an attempt to make the ultimate Rusty Shipp masterpiece album! Just like with 'Liquid Exorcist,' the four of us will be recording with producer Stephen Leiweke again, and the legendary Hein Zaayman is currently working on the new album artwork! 

THE PERKS

ANYONE who contributes anything to this campaign will instantly get a live demo recording of a new song from the album, as well as private access to live streams and behind-the-scenes videos when we get into the studio (via a private Facebook Group).  These perks/merch items offered here are available for purchase ONLY through this Indiegogo campaign and will go away when the campaign expires. And similar to our last crowdfunding campaign, where our crowdfunders got 'Liquid Exorcist' SIX MONTHS before its public release, anyone who preorders this new album will get a copy a long time before it's released to the public, and so this will be the ONLY way you can listen to it for a long time!

**TOP 10 CONTRIBUTORS' NAMES WILL BE FEATURED IN CREDITS OF NEW ALBUM!!**

THE COST

When we did our last crowdfunding campaign 2 years ago we met our goal of $5k to record our EP, but now with doubling the number of songs we'll need to at least double the funding to cover it. But even though we met our goal of $5k last time, it took MUCH more than that to cover all the expenses needed to bring it to life (recording, mastering, artwork, manufacturing, distribution, advertising, music videos, etc), and so we actually had to pay just as much money out of pocket as what was raised last time. This year with our live shows (and normal merch sales) being wiped out by the pandemic, we don't have the money in our band account to put toward extra recording expenses like we did last time, so this time we really need the help of our friends and fans to make this album a reality. If you believe in us as a band and our music, as well as our mission to do our part in bringing harmony to the world through the medicine of music and messages of hope, please bring this album into existence by buying it in advance, along with some additional merch/perks!

**Cost of shipping, tax, and Indiegogo's fees are included in all the prices listed, except for international orders which will have extra shipping charges automatically added.**

THANK YOU SO MUCH TO EVERYONE WHO HELPS BRING THIS NEW ALBUM INTO EXISTENCE!  WE CANNOT DO IT WITHOUT YOUR HELP!!!

Here's to the greatest nautical rock album ever made!!!  :)

~The Crew of Rusty Shipp (Russ T., AJ, Eli, Speedy, and Joy)

story:
Dies ist das deutsche Video. 

Für die deutsche Beschreibung bitte auf UPDATES gehen

 

Hello New World People

Welcome to my Indiegogo crowdfunding page for my upcoming album and its release!
 

This is what moves me:

We live in a time of upheaval and change. The usual constants of our daily life change or disappear entirely. Familiar structures dissolve and fear and insecurity easily arise. As always, the question is: what do we do with it?

For me this is the time of remembering my true self and finding a connecting within me and beyond these structures. Music plays an important roule in my live - and not just during this time. There is something “magical” about music: it affects us beyond language barriers and (cultural) borders and therefore it has a connecting function.

My intention as a musician is to move people across cultural, religious and social boundaries. The songs of the album are just like us, the people of our planet: colourful and with various backrounds they combine different musical styles and genres.

I would like to contribute the gifts that I have and help making this world a little better.

 

Four reasons to support this campaign:
 

  1. Each of us has something to offer that brings some love and confidence to the world. For me it‘s music. I believe that positive music can contribute to a better world.
  2. Musicians have had a difficult time in the past few months. By sponsoring the project you enable me to pay the studio musicians and producers involved appropriately.
  3. As soon as there is some calm in the concert industry I will tour with the newest music of my album to make you dance, dream and come back to live again. Until then you can already book exclusive studio shows here and enjoy the new songs live via livestream.
  4. I will give the excess money to other local funding projects in order to support other musicians to get through this bumpy time.

 

About me:
 

Coming from a family of musicians I was classically trained in singing and violin for years. At an early age I began to play concerts with the chamber orchestra, the string quartet and as a solo violinist. Later I moved out of the classical environment and led the successful Frankfurt fusion punk rock band "Ernst Breit-Ballett".

During this time I also traveled many parts of Europe with my guitar to play at festivals, in restaurants, pubs and on the street. At this point it was particularly important to me to understand the biographies of the people who lived on the “edge” of society. Back in Frankfurt I finally studied jazz and popular music at the FMW.

I then took a break from performing live and moved to Sicily with my children. Being back in Germany I returned to the stages in 2011. Together with the jazz big band "Jazz For Fun", I played on a variety of stages and events.

In 2017 I finally took the decision to give my creativity free space and to start composing my own songs again and then record them in the home studio. This is how my debut album "Transit" came about. In the meantime I wrote many new songs, I won three Independend Music Awards and I‘m looking forward to produce the beautiful music of my next album.

I would like to call this music New World Music because it combines different genres and styles and thus has a unifying character in itself. What do I wish for? To unite people of different origins through music.

Alternative ways to support me:

  • Please share this campaign in the socials and all relevant portals and/or tell your friends about it
  • Follow me on Facebook and/or Instagram and leave a like
  • Sign up for my newsletter on my website to get all news and updates

story:
What We Are Raising Funds For

The forthcoming album of brand-new, original music for kids, from Parent’s Choice Gold winner Keith Munslow!Featuring soon-to-be classics like “Waiting For The Pizza”, “When I Smile” and “Snack!”, plus a whole bunch more songs that your family will love!

 

What We Need & What You Get

I'm so excited about my new album of music for kids and families, Exclamation Point! I'm in the midst of recording it right now, and want to invite you to be an early supporter of the project. The goal of this campaign is to offset the production costs, by pre-selling the album while it is still in production. I'm aiming to raise $4,000 (roughly half the total production expenses), These funds will help cover the cost of paying the hardworking musicians who lend their time and talent to make these songs really shine. Plus it will help cover studio/engineering fees, graphic design services, and duplication costs.

By pre-buying the new album, you will be among the first to hear it, and will be supporting a great team of independent artists! How cool is that? The price of the album is $20, I'd be psyched and  grateful if you picked up a copy. And if you are interested in contributing more to this project, your generosity is most welcome. Thanks so much!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Sharing on social media helps so much! The more people who see the campaign page the better our chances are of reaching our goal! 

Thank you so much for all your support

story:
Hi friends and new friends,

Those of you who know me, know I’ve been making my living as a singer in the music industry for years.  I am super grateful that I have been fortunate enough to do this!

It has always been my dream to record an album of my own songs and I have been working with my producer/co-writer 3x Grammy winner Shannon Sanders for a few years. Now we are making a full-fledged album (a big undertaking!) and I’d love your support. 

The money raised will be used for the extensive studio and production costs, musicians, mixing and mastering, CD duplication, and artwork.

I’ve got some awesome songs and if you feel so inclined you can pre-order the CD. I will also have merch available in the form of T-shirts and coffee mugs based on my first single which is called "Rise Again". We have a great perk from Peter Asher and I have some fun virtual shows available too!

Thanking you in advance for any help you can lend and all your support throughout the years.

Cara Lee

 

The sound of Cara Lee, according to her producer, 3x Grammy Winner Shannon Sanders, is a dynamic mix of

“Aretha meets Janis”.  Add some Tina Turner into the mix, and the result is a voice infused with the heart of the greats, yet still finding its own unique emotional space. With your help, Cara Lee will use that gift to complete a new album over the course of 2021.

Cara Lee has graced stages the world over, and sang alongside a list of legends that includes The Righteous Brothers’ Bill Medley and iconic producer Peter Asher (Cher, Diana Ross, Linda Ronstadt) who introduces her as “The great Cara Lee.”

No wonder. She has gotten inside the greatest songs of all time, and played the role of both Janis Joplin and Cher as a true actor, and interpreted them with a rare appreciation of their merits as singers and artists.

A few other career highlights: Cara has appeared on The Late Late Show with James Corden, performed at the Super Bowl 50 VIP event as well as other exclusive celebrity parties, appeared at the Fremont St. Experience and at other well-known Las Vegas casinos, performed her original music at the Los Angeles Pride Festival and regularly performs on 4 of the Time Life/Star Vista special themed music Cruises.

With the producer of the likes of India Arie, Jonny Lang, and John Legend, Mr. Shannon Sanders, in the role of both producer and co-writer, “Rise Again” collects a set of songs as dynamic as the woman that is creating them.

Showcasing the deep-water influences of the performers that inspired her, Cara Lee’s record brings her soulful vocals to bear on songs that only she could write, at just the time we most need them—and with a message that meets the moment. Her message is one of inner strength, resilience, perseverance, and empowerment, delivered in a way that is direct and deeply personal while sharing the universal themes and emotions that challenge—and lift—each and every one of us.

 

------------------------------------------>

 

Finally...

Before we get to our all-important expressions of gratitude to those whose support is the backbone of this campaign, just a note to, as Cara Lee says, "old friends and new." As you will see, we are not above offering a number of irresistible inducements to convert you to the cause. And of course, if you'd like to contribute to the campaign, without perks--beyond our true and sincere thanks-- you can simply click on the 'Back It' button.  You'll be able to enter the amount you'd like to contribute and choose your payment method.

At the very least we hope you enjoy taking a look and considering the idea of being a part of the dream!

It's a privilege to work in the world of music, and a greater one to represent a truly gifted artist like Cara Lee. We share a belief in the power of music to heal and inspire.

All the best,

Keith Putney, Artist Manager

 

Special thanks ...

to the following for their sage advice and talented contributions to this campaign: Shannon Sanders, Peter Asher, Jeff Alan Ross, Uhlone at Lonely Feathers Studio, Earl Bryant, Matthew Bennett, Karen LeBlanc, Laurie Beteau, Ann Potenza, Tricia Kelly, Lisa Margaroli, La Niece McKay, Dennis Pendlebury, Linda Pendlebury and Neil Pendlebury.

story:
About Still Forever

Still Forever was conceived in February 2016 by visual artist turned electronic music producer Amelia Griffiths (that’s me, hello!)

Following a formal education and lifelong practice in visual art and photography, I reignited a childhood interest in music after becoming interested in electronic music production through a new circle of friends. Originally, I just wanted to learn a few basics, to add a new dimension to my art installations, but soon, the sound became the focus and I wanted to know more and more.

I’m self taught, with help from a broad community of really amazing people, who have at times gone out of their way to assist my learning, whilst never treating me as anything less than a fellow musician. I appreciate and adore those folk beyond belief.

After a year or so of experimenting with sounds, software and hardware, a lot of trial and error, a huge learning curve, and a three track EP,  the idea of doing this crazy thing live became a more prominent topic, and I made my live debut opening Manchester’s Foundations Festival in late 2018, after which followed a regular live schedule across the country, sharing a bill with established artists such as Zanias, God Module, Sheep on Drugs and Deviant UK. 

 

What I Need & What You Get

I’m hoping you will help me to raise the money to fund the release of Synaesthetic, the third full album from Still Forever, and something which has become far more than just the music. Synaesthetic captures the evolution of sound which has naturally occurred through the combined experiences of self taught production, a background in visual art, and live performance, and by choosing to release it in book format ties together the multidimensional aspect of it as a complete body of work, whilst also offering supporters something tangible, visual, even (dare I hope) collectible. 

I’m looking to raise a minimum of £800 to release Synaesthetic. The money will be put towards the costs incurred as I approach the completion of the album production process; professional vocal recording session hire, mastering, and of course physical merch (book printing, t-shirts, etc) and promotion. 

If you have any questions at all, please do ask.

 

The Impact

As a new artist, I’d usually have spent the past year and a bit continuing to promote myself through live performances, and selling merch and music to put back into the costs of creating more. Circumstances have meant that all artists have had to find alternative ways to promote themselves and grow, but even for an established artist, it can be a challenge to sell online at anywhere near the volume you’d usually sell at events. I’m fortunate that as a solo artist, it’s been easier for me to rehearse and create in these times, and that my day job has been largely unaffected. On the flip side, though, it means that I’m covering the costs of production myself, without live events to properly promote physical sales which would help me to break even. 

I create and perform for the absolute love of it, and never expected to even come this far - I’ve got no illusions about ever making a living from doing this, and I’m comfortable with that. Simply breaking even means that I can put out not only this album, but work on the next, and the next. It means I can play more shows in different cities, and it means I can keep creating new work to share with you. You can make an enormous contribution by investing what you can in this album, or by sharing this page or the music and videos with your friends and family.

 

Risks & Challenges

The album is written, and it will be released in August. Raising funds towards the cost of putting it out simply means that I’m not edging into debt, and it means I can offer something truly special to supporters of my work. I’ve spent a long time working out a timeline, building in safety buffers to deadlines, and balancing budget plans. The suppliers I’ll be using are well regarded suppliers who I’ve worked with before. Every step has been carefully considered to help this project run smoothly to completion. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I completely understand that - particularly in these times - circumstances may mean that not everyone is able to invest. You can also make a huge impact by sharing this page, or my music, with your friends though. I'm grateful for all help given.

FACEBOOK       TWITTER     INSTAGRAM

story:
The Galen Kipar Project has another album fully prepared for you but needs your help to deliver it to your ears.  A collection of new material has morphed into the making of what we believe to be our best work yet.   The first four albums were created and released in 5 years.  This "Album to Be"  marinated for 2 years before we started the first round of recording this past winter of 2014.   Now that we've had time to listen, digest and access the music collectively, we are ready to finish what we started. 
 We have seen how the music industry trend of fundraising has worked for so many others and we hope you will support us and help bring this baby to life.  We are seeking $12,500 to help cover the final production cost, 5% of which we will be donating to ASAP, The Appalachian Sustainable Agricultural Project & MountainTrue, Helping keep the Western North Carolina Environment Pristine for Future Generations!


- The Galen Kipar Project -

Musicians and Instrumentation:

·      LYNDSAY PRUETT - Violin & Vocals (Futureman's Black Mozart Ensemble, Jon Stickley Trio).

·      AARON BALANCE - Dobro and Lap Steel Guitar (Dehlia Low, Tellico).

·      JEREMY YOUNG – Drums and Percussion.

·      BENJAMIN PORTWOOD – Upright Bass, Vocals.

·      JON MORROW – 8 String Novak Guitar.

·      CAMELlIA DELK – Viola, Vocals.

·      GALEN KIPAR – Acoustic Guitar, Vocals, Harmonica, Piano.

 

Guest Studio Musicians and Instrumentation:

·      TIM CARBONE – Violin (Railroad Earth).

·      DAVID GANS – Guitar, Vocals

·      HENRY WESTMORELAND – Trumpet, Trombone, Baritone Sax, Tenor Sax (Umphrey’s McGee, Empire Strikes Brass, Firecracker Jazz Band, Hank West and the Smokin Hots).

·      OTHER ASHEVILLE GUESTS T.B.A. 

- Budget - $ 12,500

Here's a projected budget we've prepared to give you an idea as to how we've planned to allocate the funds. (Budget is based on reaching our goal)

$6000 = Echo Mountain Recording Studio

Includes  /  5 Days of Final Touches, Mixdown & Mastering of Tracks.

$3000 = Band Travel, Time & Studio Musicians

Band Members Travel & Time during week long session.

Plus 2 Additional Internationally Recognized Recording Artists

$2000 =  1000ct. Album Production & Duplication

+/- $500 = 5% to Charity  / *Note 10% of each dollar over our goal

+/- $1000 = Fundraiser Site Fee's


The Impact

By taking part in this fundraising campaign you yourself are making a choice and helping to change how we make & share music.  You are putting faith in us, and with that comes a level of responsibility that is higher than our previous efforts. 

With that in mind, we give you our word that we will not settle for “good enough” - we are perfectionists with a sense of duty as musicians for attention to detail and to bring you the finest quality audio format available today.  The total amount of money we raise will be directly reflected in our final product. In other words the more funds we raise the better we can facilitate bringing you the highest quality product we can.  Thank you for taking the time to help & here's to making our best album yet!!!


    Other Ways You Can Help

    While every dollar counts even if it's only $10 that's ten steps closer to helping us bring our life's work into this world. Know If you don't feel you can afford it – there are other ways you can help out. Simply paying it forward by Spreading the word! Tell your family and friends and let them know what's going on. With all the social networking and ways we now connect with one another, know by posting links to this page you are reaching places we might never be able to reach.  Again Thank You All!!!

story:
Short Summary

Hi!  I'm Samantha Church, and I'm a singer/songwriter and street performer.  You may remember me from the Chicago subway, the market in Downtown Charleston, from the streets of Hollywood, or perhaps from my BandCamp page (click my name!).

Lets get down to it:  I'm a woman on a mission, and to complete the mission, I need a van.  Some of you may have read my blog. which gives a decent overview of how this mission began, and how I've ended up here, but to summarize:  

My mission: To continuously be creating new and better music.  To bring that music to people from all walks of life, regardless of their ability to pay.  To give people a reason to stop and listen to one another.  To achieve all of this in a self-sustaining, low impact manner.  To inspire others to do the same.

This brings us to THE VAN.  The van is a live space, a rehearsal space, an eventual  recording space, and the horse and buggy that's gonna tote this act around!  The van is the lynch pin of the mission.  

Life as a musician is unpredictable.   We can all agree that art betters a community, particularly when it is made available to everyone regardless of ability to pay, but it's harder to agree on how to fund it and sustain it.  I believe I've found a way to ensure I can devote my life to my mission: by reducing what I need to the bare minimum, by combining spaces, by merging my life and my art into ONE MAGICAL VAN!

Now all I need is the van!

What We Need & What You Get

Having already secured the majority of the funding I need, I'm now asking for an investment of $3,000 to really make this dream a reality.
And I say "investment" because that's what it is!  Not only are you making it possible for me to continue making music on a pay-what-you-will basis for those who can't afford to pay, but when you contribute, I contribute back directly to you!
For instance, depending on what you contribute you get:

Free downloads of my music!

Personalized youtube videos of me covering your favorite song with a personal shout out!

A song touting you or your business' GREATNESS written by yours truly! 

A free show at your house party or place of business!

And more!

UPDATE:  Here is a specific breakdown of how the money will be used:
I found a van that fits the bill.  It's the one pictured above.  It is used, but not endlessly old (it's a 95).  It's in working condition.  It has some miles on it (100,000), but not ALL of the miles on it.  It is driveable, it is liveable, it is what I need.  And it's $7,800.  I have secured $6,000 of that.  It is possible that I won't get this specific van if I don't act fast enough, but there are others comparable in that price range.
Why that price range?
Because below that, vans tend to be enormous fixer-uppers that ultimately cost more.  To get something newer or with less miles means a huge price jump.  This is the sweet spot.  The most bang for your buck.  And this is why I've settled on this price range.
But wait a second--If the van costs $7,800, and I have $6,000 already, why do I need $3,000?
To account for registration, insurance, AAA, gas, etc.  There are a lot of miscellaneous fees that come with buying a van.
What happens if you make more than $3,000?
Everything still goes into the van and making music.  Money will be put aside for repairs.  If I magically make a lot more than anticipated, then the eventual goal I had of  turning the van into a recording studio will come faster.  Beyond that, if the van is in perfect condition and there is money left over, the money will be put into paper goods and distribution--ALL money will go towards spreading my music, first with the van, and then beyond.  

The Impact

The impact of this venture is both big and small, lofty and personal to people.  Street performance, when done in service of the community, BETTERS the community--it increases tourism, it fosters an environment where people engage with one another face to face, it brings art to those who might not otherwise be exposed to it, it takes out the middle man between artists and audiences, and best of all, it adds something special to the day to day.  The van helps me to bring my music to more and varied people.  It allows for me to focus on putting out the best work possible, rather than sacrifice time that should be spent writing, rehearsing, performing to other matters.  It fosters a system that is self sustaining--the more I can travel, the more I can work, the more I can sustain traveling and working.  It makes for more contacts, which can help me to reach more people.  It's a relatively small investment up front that will enable me to create art for years to come.  You can go to my Facebook page and look under the user posts to read the personal impact my music has had on people.  But beyond the personal connections I've made and can make through music, this is a project that shows what is possible to people, how we can think outside the box to create a big impact on society.

Risks & Challenges

This is a project I've been working on for some time.  I tried to do it alone, and have come to realize that you cannot help the world around you without the support of the world around you.  And I've also learned a great deal in the process.  At it's heart, this is a simple project.  If I can travel, if I have a work space, if I have a living space, then I can do my best work possible for the greater good of all.  And combining these spaces, makes it simpler still.  Vandwelling isn't easy, but I've been researching for over a year.  Street performance is a tricky business, but it's one that I've been mastering for three years.  Contacts are needed, but I've been building up a base of people ready to lend a hand when the going gets tough.  With your help, I'm ready for the this big next step!

Other Ways You Can Help

Hey, man--I'm ALL about pay what you can!  It's my own personal business model, and nobody understands more than me that sometimes you just can't afford to give!

But you can still help by spreading the word, sharing my story and my music.  First thing's first--a vehicle is required.  But once I have that vehicle, contacts across the nation can only help my cause!  You never know who among your friends can help, and your emotional support goes a longer way than you know!

A free show at your house party or place of business!

And more!

UPDATE:  Here is a specific breakdown of how the money will be used:
I found a van that fits the bill.  It's the one pictured above.  It is used, but not endlessly old (it's a 95).  It's in working condition.  It has some miles on it (100,000), but not ALL of the miles on it.  It is driveable, it is liveable, it is what I need.  And it's $7,800.  I have secured $6,000 of that.  It is possible that I won't get this specific van if I don't act fast enough, but there are others comparable in that price range.
Why that price range?
Because below that, vans tend to be enormous fixer-uppers that ultimately cost more.  To get something newer or with less miles means a huge price jump.  This is the sweet spot.  The most bang for your buck.  And this is why I've settled on this price range.
But wait a second--If the van costs $7,800, and I have $6,000 already, why do I need $3,000?
To account for registration, insurance, AAA, gas, etc.  There are a lot of miscellaneous fees that come with buying a van.
What happens if you make more than $3,000?
Everything still goes into the van and making music.  Money will be put aside for repairs.  If I magically make a lot more than anticipated, then the eventual goal I had of  turning the van into a recording studio will come faster.  Beyond that, if the van is in perfect condition and there is money left over, the money will be put into paper goods and distribution--ALL money will go towards spreading my music, first with the van, and then beyond.     The Impact
The impact of this venture is both big and small, lofty and personal to people.  Street performance, when done in service of the community, BETTERS the community--it increases tourism, it fosters an environment where people engage with one another face to face, it brings art to those who might not otherwise be exposed to it, it takes out the middle man between artists and audiences, and best of all, it adds something special to the day to day.  The van helps me to bring my music to more and varied people.  It allows for me to focus on putting out the best work possible, rather than sacrifice time that should be spent writing, rehearsing, performing to other matters.  It fosters a system that is self sustaining--the more I can travel, the more I can work, the more I can sustain traveling and working.  It makes for more contacts, which can help me to reach more people.  It's a relatively small investment up front that will enable me to create art for years to come.  You can go to my Facebook page and look under the user posts to read the personal impact my music has had on people.  But beyond the personal connections I've made and can make through music, this is a project that shows what is possible to people, how we can think outside the box to create a big impact on society.   Risks & Challenges This is a project I've been working on for some time.  I tried to do it alone, and have come to realize that you cannot help the world around you without the support of the world around you.  And I've also learned a great deal in the process.  At it's heart, this is a simple project.  If I can travel, if I have a work space, if I have a living space, then I can do my best work possible for the greater good of all.  And combining these spaces, makes it simpler still.  Vandwelling isn't easy, but I've been researching for over a year.  Street performance is a tricky business, but it's one that I've been mastering for three years.  Contacts are needed, but I've been building up a base of people ready to lend a hand when the going gets tough.  With your help, I'm ready for the this big next step!
    Other Ways You Can Help Hey, man--I'm ALL about pay what you can!  It's my own personal business model, and nobody understands more than me that sometimes you just can't afford to give!
But you can still help by spreading the word, sharing my story and my music.  First thing's first--a vehicle is required.  But once I have that vehicle, contacts across the nation can only help my cause!  You never know who among your friends can help, and your emotional support goes a longer way than you know!

story:
Hi there:) Thanks for clicking onto my page!

I'm currently working on my very first EP album, and I can't even begin to tell you how excited I am to be able to share this with all you beautiful people! I have had these songs trapped in my head for years now, and it feels so good knowing that I am finally on my way to turning them into something real and tangible for other people to enjoy and experience.  This is my first step toward my dream, and it's finally starting to feel like it's within reach.  I can't really put into words how that feels, but it's the best feeling I can imagine:)  I hope if you decide to help fund my album, you'll get to experience that same feeling through my music.  That's my number one goal.

Here's The Deal

For my album, I'm asking all of you amazing people to help me fund the leftover costs that I can't cover myself.  Recording an album requires way more than I initially thought, so after finishing  a big chunk of the album, I realized I was going to need some help to be able to complete the project.  The money raised will be going towards my studio time so I can finally get these songs out of my head and into your hands! I have a lot of fun perks that I'll be offering for those who want to help me out: a signed physical copy of the album BEFORE it's released to the public, autographed posters, VIP tickets to the release party, and a ton of other fun shenanigans.

I can't stress enough that every penny counts! I know I'm asking for a big chunk of money here, but whatever we're able to raise will get me that much closer to finally being able to pursue my passion.

Risks & Challenges

This is my first time ever recording and putting out music.  While I've been playing shows and writing for a while now, this is all a totally new experience for me. And with new experiences come some major bumps in the road...and you better believe I've already managed to find a lot of those bumps... BUT, it's all part of the learning experience, right?!  This whole process is terrifying (in the best way possible) and risky, and you can never be sure what the outcome will be.  But if you love it enough, like I do, the risk is well worth whatever the reward may be. So, I'm giving this my best effort, and I'm already so happy with the way things are turning out.  I really believe in the music I'm making and I hope that you will too:)

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're like me and are a little short on cash, don't worry about it!! That's totally understandable. No judgement here!  There are so many ways you can help out and make a difference.  Even just using the IndieGoGo Share options and helping me spread the word about the campaign would be HUGE! I wish I could hug each and every one of you for even reading this far, let alone making a donation! For now, we shall cyber hug:)

I hope you've enjoyed this long, emotional, random rant that I've provided for you:) Thanks for your time, and thanks for believing in me! I promise to make this album count!

story:
Hi! We're Bomba Press and we make records in our spare time. We've operated quietly over the past five years but, with the help of the internet and the support of our friends and fans alike, we've grown a following in our city of Cebu, around the Philippines, and even across the globe for our roster of amazing artists. 


Why We Need You

There are perks to being a really indie label... We don't have to be mindful of so many eyes watching from higher-up's so we can go crazy with the music we put out to make sure you get to hear only the freshest tunes. Also, working out of our bedrooms guarantees our right to work without pants on. Finally, of course, without any big-time investors, we get to learn the value of a dime, though that means cutting corners as much as we can.

To give you a better picture, we usually do runs of 100 CDs or less for each batch of prints. Yes, that's right, a hundred CDs per run. Digital distribution considered, that number serves us fine for the moment but it's obviously not enough to get all that music to where it needs to be. So we'll be needing a little boost from you to help us get our feet on more solid ground.


What We Need and What You Get

As a token to the artists who've trusted us with their music and to our fans who've trusted us to put out great music, we're putting together a compilation in vinyl LP format containing the best singles in our catalog from our half-decade of existence.  

Unfortunately, though there's been a recent resurgence of the medium, production of vinyl records isn't as accessible or as affordable in our part of the world. We need at least $3,000 to meet our target production of 300 copies with all funding going into the production and shipping of the records as well as all related taxes and fees.

We love sharing our music to as far out as we can (which is mainly why we want this project to move forward), and we're excited to give out loads of free music to all our pledgers. Check out the sidebar for more details on the perks we're offering!

The Impact

Call us ambitious but we're hoping to help elevate our city's music scene via this project. Making this record will expand the listener-ship and collectible value (vinyl projects are quite rare in these parts) for the many deserving artists that we have worked with over the years.

In the long run, the proceeds from the sales of the record will be used to develop a sustainable process to producing better quality music and CD releases for our artists - many of whom have been creating and promoting music from scratch with very little funding for years and deserve an output they can really be proud of.


Details, details... 

First and foremost, where the heck is Cebu City? Cebu City is a second-tier city in the Philippines, located right smack in the middle of the archipelago-nation. "Vibrant" would be a nice thing to say about it, but we're honestly just a bunch of nice people out to have fun, hopefully drawing a little bit of positive attention to our town in the process. Here's a Wikipedia page for you.

What tracks are you planning on putting on the LP? We don't have a definite tracklist at the moment, but scroll further down this page for the profiles of a few of the bands that we'll definitely be featuring. Of course, suggestions are highly welcome - just browse through our Soundcloud for singles we've released so far.

I admit I'm really into vinyl just for the cover art. Concepts so far? 
We want to make the LP cover art as memorable as possible even with the limitations of what our supplier can do and we're very fortunate to have signed up Inodoro Graphic Design, a one-man studio who has done commercial work as far out as Japan and has been featured in an exhibit all the way in London, to create the art for this project. To the left, you will find an initial concept of the "motion" art that Inodoro has in mind.

For the record (pun intended), here are a few of the people you'll be helping out...

First off, a few of the bands that will be featured on the LP:

Honeydrop is a post-rock band with a whole lot of pop sensibilities. They launched their debut album "Prelude" in October of 2013 with some of the tracks making it as far as Massachusetts via online radio and media outlets. The second album from the band is now a work in progress, with a single set to release soon.

Albums: Prelude


Bombo Pluto Ova is without a doubt the most irreverent and, with five albums of various shapes and sizes in tow, the most prolific in the lineup - a noise band that has been making the same loud and offensive music to a cult following since the beginning of their decade of existence.

Albums: Phantom, Aorta Gun


Tiger Pussy is a punk rock group with a soft spot for classic riot and a strong following in punk communities across the country. Known for their infectious live energy, the band has been making the rounds in various cities in the country since launching their second album "People You Hate" in 2013.

Albums: People You Hate



Loop is an indie rock band from Iligan City, a hub to the south of Cebu in the Mindanao group of islands, currently making waves with their brand of Pinoy rock infused with their own local flavor. They are one of the few bands in the roster that are not currently based in Cebu, but definitely an act we will always look forward to seeing in town.

Albums: Flirting With The Universe

And of course...

.. the Cebu City music scene. A little bit shy at first and may incorrectly come off as "hard to please". But really, we just have our own unique way of showing you our appreciation, and trust me when I say good music is one thing we definitely appreciate!


Other Ways You Can Help

We definitely like to earn our keep and you can help us a lot by checking out our discography on our Bandcamp page and purchasing digital copies of the albums you like (you can check out the video gallery for samples of the artists' music). And please do help us get the word out and share this campaign to your friends and connections using the Indiegogo share tools or via word of mouth.

We'd love to connect with you on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram and we also have an official website, BombaPress.com, where you can get general information on what we do and the artists that we support. Hope to hear from you guys soon and thank you for supporting this project!

Help us get these bands (and more) on vinyl! Your pledge goes a long way to helping independent music!

story:
My dream

Hello friends, I'm Robert Mendoza, a passionate violinist, my dream for over 15 years has been to show the world my music.

Music is the most important thing in my life, and I think people like my music!
So I want to render thanks to my beloved fans making a new and amazing album for them.

I get thousands of messages every day of you asking me "when your next video?", "when your album?", "where can I buy your music?". . I love that, and I want to say how much I LOVE YOU!

Every time I upload a new video on my Youtube channel, I get the love of thousands of people around the world who tell me they love my talent and my way of playing the violin. I am convinced that all the love I receive daily is the signal that is
NOW OR NEVER!! is the time to realize my dream: to develop my career as a professional artist to world class! POSSIBLE OR NOT? what do you think? Honestly, I trust in each note I offer my fans and I know you appreciate it! (more than 1.800.000 views of my last video on Youtube!)

I would like to record my album for you and then work work work... and see us on a world tour around each and every one of your countries and give you the music of my album Live!

So I REALLY NEED YOUR HELP to make my dream come true to record my first album and a really amazing videoclip of his first single with all the best qualities. 
YOUR SUPPORT would make me very happy!!


The breakdown

Here's the breakdown on what I need and where it is going:

Producer: 6000€

Mastering: 2000€

Video Recorder:  €4000

Video Editor:  €4000

Extras/Actors: 2000€

Promo: 5000€

Costs: 1500€

TOTAL: 24500€


Why?

With your help, I can offer my product at the highest possible quality to my fans, they are waiting for, and... who knows if all this adventure that begins today, leading to a worldwide success? thanks you all!

Thanks for share it ;)

Maybe you can't help me with a financial contribution, but don't worry!
Share to your social networks and I will be very grateful, really!

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Jenni Auvenshine and I'm the founder of Sing n' Sprout.  As a Children's Ministry Director, I learned pretty quickly that preschoolers loved music and they loved to move.    If I put a Bible verse to music, it was easier for those young children to remember it throughout the week.  I knew that song was firmly planted in their hearts when they came back the next Sunday and could sing it by heart.

It was easier for me to write songs containing Bible truths and verses than it was for me to find them on itunes.  Soon, I recognized how easily songs were coming to me and how effective and fun our young children were having during the music and movement time in Sunday School. Therefore, one day, I had to ask God what He was up to.

He reminded me of the traditional music and movement class I took my daughter to when she was three-years-old.  Even thought the program was excellent, there were two things I believed it was missing:  1) Affordability--As a struggling young family, the price of this class really stretched our pocket book.   2) Faith-based--I loved the music we sang, however, the entire time, I wished we were singing about God, planting seeds of faith in my daughters heart.

Keeping these things in mind, the Lord spoke to me and said, "I want you to start a Christian music and movement program that ministers to the mind, body AND SPIRIT of the young child.  One that is affordable to take and easy for anyone to teach."  After hearing Him, I asked Him what the program would be called, and I quickly heard Him speak in my heart, "Sing n' Sprout: Growing with God through music."

One year later, out of obedience to God's call, I had the songs recorded and curriculum written.  Mercy Church, was kind enough to offer the very first Sing n' Sprout classes.  They filled up immediately and two mom's asked if I could train them to teach Sing n' Sprout in their community.  

That was three years ago, today, we have over 33 teachers in 10 states who have taught over 850 children and their caregivers in Sing n' Sprout classes held in churches, daycares, rec centers, living rooms and orphanages.  Internationally, Sing n' Sprout has been taught to young children in an American compound in Doha, Qatar as well as to over 40 orphans in Rwanda.

Most of our teachers are moms who desire 1) A kingdom purpose  2) Additional revenue that makes it easier for them to be a stay-at-home mom & 3) A product that is in desired and makes a difference in the lives of their community.

Sing n' Sprout has developed products and services to meet market demand.  We have the volunteer leadership team to support them.  It is now time to take Sing n' Sprout to the next level.  Your contribution will help us share the love of God through music and movement, planting seeds of faith in Jesus Christ, by connecting teachers with children and children with God.


What We Need & What You Get 

We need $75,000 to share the love of God with over 50,000 children. 

We want to reach, train, and support 500 new Sing n' Sprout teachers in the next two years.  That breaks down to investing $150 into each new teacher.  On average, our teachers teach 100 children over a two year period.  Simply and powerfully put, we estimate that $150 invested in each teacher is a kingdom investment in the hearts of over 50,000 children.

Your contribution will help us with the following:

  • Website--Update and upgrade!  My amazing step-dad, an honest-to-goodness rocket scientist, bought a book, "Coding for Dummies" when I asked him to build Sing n' Sprout's first website.  That website helped us "beta-test" our product nationwide this last year.  Now we need to make an appointment with the professionals to update and upgrade. Even though our teachers are independent, our website serves as our "headquarters".  This "one-stop-shop" will make it easy for families to find and register for classes and for teachers to receive training and support.
  • Advertise--Our key to solving the demand for classes is to raise up more teachers.  We need to get the word out to churches and moms about this opportunity.
  • Expand our curriculum--For the last 3 years we have been rotating 2 curriculums.  Because Sing n' Sprout is affordable and faith based, they keep signing up for class despite repeating the curriuculum.   But we cannot keep going on like this.  Our dream is to for a child to participate in a Sing n' Sprout class every semester from the time they are new born through five years of age.  This requires a variety of curricula  each designed with great intention to minister to the mind, body and spirit of the young child at every stage of their development.

PERKS!!!  We have have some AMAZING perks as a thank you for your donation.  Our best ones are saved for our biggest contribution levels... 
1) Our "Gold Level Gratitude" contributors will receive a 16x20 (full size) of "Singing Sparrows," an original work of art, painted by Mecca Rutherford.  This piece is specifically commissioned for this campaign.  Each print will come numbered and with a certificate of authenticity signed and dated by both Mecca and her printer. They are all printed on Elegance Velvet Paper (which is museum quality).     
2) "Platinum Level Perfection" contributors will have a chance to sing a new song! This is an opportunity to have your favorite Bible story or verse, the names of your children or grandchildren and write an original song for use in our curriculum and enjoyed by all of the Lil' Sprouts!  The will also receive the "Gold Level Gratitude" perks!
 
What if we don't get the campaign entirely funded?  We will put the funds we receive into new curriculum and any we have left over we will go to raise up new teachers!

The Impact: Planting Seeds of Faith in Jesus Christ

Each semester of Sing n’ Sprout is made up of a series of sessions, the objective of each being to help children grow with God through music. Every activity, every song, is designed to develop a child's mind, body and spirit.  Sing n' Sprout provides an opportunity for children to grow in their relationship with God--experiencing God working inside of them, outside of them, and all around them.

Sing n' Sprout is a relationship builder.  Our classes meet week-after-week, semester-after-semester, year-after-year, providing a time for teachers to bond with families, and families to bond together.  Most importantly, teacher, parent & children are all growing with God through music.


To Be Honest

Sing n' Sprout was created on a shoe-string budget.  We have a product that has been tested and is in demand.  To be honest, we could continue to grow the way we have been growing.  Slow and steady.  

Challenges:

1) Limited curriculums: The problem is we have only two curriculums that teachers continue to teach year after year.  We have an audience that WANTS more from us.  They want to have a new curriculum each semester. They want to bring their children to Sing n' Sprout as soon as they are born and keep coming back until they start Kindergarten.

2) Limited classes:  We also have an "in box" full of moms asking if they can sign up their child for classes.  The problem is, we need to raise up more teachers.  We want to do that by advertising on Facebook and annually going to the "MOPS (Mothers of Preschoolers) convention."

3) Limited communication:  Right now, teachers handle class registration independently.  What if we had a website that handled all class registration? Not only would it make the teachers life easier, it would bring in more revenue (keeping us in business), as well as provide us with a database of Sing n' Sprout families.  We will be able to provide information about upcoming classes as well as send them our "Sing n' Sprout at Home blog" which provides spiritual growth ideas through music and movement as a family.

We need your help in order to be more effective in ministering to these families! We have a product that works well!  Please help us take the next steps: expand our curriculum, streamline communication & add more classes!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you find that you just can't contribute, you can help in other ways:

  • Pray for us!
  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!
  • Sing n' Sprout can be taught in living rooms, rec centers and churches! If you would like to start teaching Sing n' Sprout, or know of someone who would, contact us through our website:  www.singnsprout.com
story_txt:
Short Summary Hi! My name is Jenni Auvenshine and I'm the founder of Sing n' Sprout.  As a Children's Ministry Director, I learned pretty quickly that preschoolers loved music and they loved to move.    If I put a Bible verse to music, it was easier for those young children to remember it throughout the week.  I knew that song was firmly planted in their hearts when they came back the next Sunday and could sing it by heart.
It was easier for me to write songs containing Bible truths and verses than it was for me to find them on itunes.  Soon, I recognized how easily songs were coming to me and how effective and fun our young children were having during the music and movement time in Sunday School. Therefore, one day, I had to ask God what He was up to.
He reminded me of the traditional music and movement class I took my daughter to when she was three-years-old.  Even thought the program was excellent, there were two things I believed it was missing:  1) Affordability--As a struggling young family, the price of this class really stretched our pocket book.   2) Faith-based--I loved the music we sang, however, the entire time, I wished we were singing about God, planting seeds of faith in my daughters heart.
Keeping these things in mind, the Lord spoke to me and said, "I want you to start a Christian music and movement program that ministers to the mind, body AND SPIRIT of the young child.  One that is affordable to take and easy for anyone to teach."  After hearing Him, I asked Him what the program would be called, and I quickly heard Him speak in my heart, "Sing n' Sprout: Growing with God through music."
One year later, out of obedience to God's call, I had the songs recorded and curriculum written.  Mercy Church, was kind enough to offer the very first Sing n' Sprout classes.  They filled up immediately and two mom's asked if I could train them to teach Sing n' Sprout in their community.  
That was three years ago, today, we have over 33 teachers in 10 states who have taught over 850 children and their caregivers in Sing n' Sprout classes held in churches, daycares, rec centers, living rooms and orphanages.  Internationally, Sing n' Sprout has been taught to young children in an American compound in Doha, Qatar as well as to over 40 orphans in Rwanda.
Most of our teachers are moms who desire 1) A kingdom purpose  2) Additional revenue that makes it easier for them to be a stay-at-home mom & 3) A product that is in desired and makes a difference in the lives of their community.
Sing n' Sprout has developed products and services to meet market demand.  We have the volunteer leadership team to support them.  It is now time to take Sing n' Sprout to the next level.  Your contribution will help us share the love of God through music and movement, planting seeds of faith in Jesus Christ, by connecting teachers with children and children with God.

What We Need & What You Get 
 We need $75,000 to share the love of God with over 50,000 children. 
We want to reach, train, and support 500 new Sing n' Sprout teachers in the next two years.  That breaks down to investing $150 into each new teacher.  On average, our teachers teach 100 children over a two year period.  Simply and powerfully put, we estimate that $150 invested in each teacher is a kingdom investment in the hearts of over 50,000 children.
Your contribution will help us with the following:

Website--Update and upgrade!  My amazing step-dad, an honest-to-goodness rocket scientist, bought a book, "Coding for Dummies" when I asked him to build Sing n' Sprout's first website.  That website helped us "beta-test" our product nationwide this last year.  Now we need to make an appointment with the professionals to update and upgrade. Even though our teachers are independent, our website serves as our "headquarters".  This "one-stop-shop" will make it easy for families to find and register for classes and for teachers to receive training and support.
Advertise--Our key to solving the demand for classes is to raise up more teachers.  We need to get the word out to churches and moms about this opportunity.
Expand our curriculum--For the last 3 years we have been rotating 2 curriculums.  Because Sing n' Sprout is affordable and faith based, they keep signing up for class despite repeating the curriuculum.   But we cannot keep going on like this.  Our dream is to for a child to participate in a Sing n' Sprout class every semester from the time they are new born through five years of age.  This requires a variety of curricula  each designed with great intention to minister to the mind, body and spirit of the young child at every stage of their development.



PERKS!!!  We have have some AMAZING perks as a thank you for your donation.  Our best ones are saved for our biggest contribution levels... 
1) Our "Gold Level Gratitude" contributors will receive a 16x20 (full size) of "Singing Sparrows," an original work of art, painted by Mecca Rutherford.  This piece is specifically commissioned for this campaign.  Each print will come numbered and with a certificate of authenticity signed and dated by both Mecca and her printer. They are all printed on Elegance Velvet Paper (which is museum quality).     
2) "Platinum Level Perfection" contributors will have a chance to sing a new song! This is an opportunity to have your favorite Bible story or verse, the names of your children or grandchildren and write an original song for use in our curriculum and enjoyed by all of the Lil' Sprouts!  The will also receive the "Gold Level Gratitude" perks!
 

What if we don't get the campaign entirely funded?  We will put the funds we receive into new curriculum and any we have left over we will go to raise up new teachers!
   The Impact: Planting Seeds of Faith in Jesus Christ Each semester of Sing n’ Sprout is made up of a series of sessions, the objective of each being to help children grow with God through music. Every activity, every song, is designed to develop a child's mind, body and spirit.  Sing n' Sprout provides an opportunity for children to grow in their relationship with God--experiencing God working inside of them, outside of them, and all around them.
Sing n' Sprout is a relationship builder.  Our classes meet week-after-week, semester-after-semester, year-after-year, providing a time for teachers to bond with families, and families to bond together.  Most importantly, teacher, parent & children are all growing with God through music.

Challenges:
1) Limited curriculums: The problem is we have only two curriculums that teachers continue to teach year after year.  We have an audience that WANTS more from us.  They want to have a new curriculum each semester. They want to bring their children to Sing n' Sprout as soon as they are born and keep coming back until they start Kindergarten.
2) Limited classes:  We also have an "in box" full of moms asking if they can sign up their child for classes.  The problem is, we need to raise up more teachers.  We want to do that by advertising on Facebook and annually going to the "MOPS (Mothers of Preschoolers) convention."
3) Limited communication:  Right now, teachers handle class registration independently.  What if we had a website that handled all class registration? Not only would it make the teachers life easier, it would bring in more revenue (keeping us in business), as well as provide us with a database of Sing n' Sprout families.  We will be able to provide information about upcoming classes as well as send them our "Sing n' Sprout at Home blog" which provides spiritual growth ideas through music and movement as a family.

Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word!
Sing n' Sprout can be taught in living rooms, rec centers and churches! If you would like to start teaching Sing n' Sprout, or know of someone who would, contact us through our website:  www.singnsprout.com

story:
Hi. My name is Peter Brunette, and I am singer/songwriter from Lakeport, New Hampshire. Since my childhood in the 1970s, I've written hundreds of songs, and the lyrics of the best ones, the ones that I was especially fond or proud of, I  have lovingly transcribed by hand into a nicely bound blank book. In 1980, when I first collected all my songs into the Songbook, I named the collection after one of the songs, “Crystal Images.” Over the years, I played some of these songs publicly, and a few became staples of my solo singer/songwriter repertoire. When I started out, I said that I was going to record an album someday, but life got busy, you know, marriage, child-rearing, careers, hustling to make ends meet—my music was never a significant source of income, a hobby really, and an expensive one at that—and that album never got recorded.

Today, at 57 years of age, I finally decided that it was time for my dream to become reality. With the loving encouragement of my family and closest friends and after countless suggestions and offers of help from my musician buddies, I am finally taking the Songbook into the studio to make an album. Studio recording is a new thing for me, and I knew that I needed to find a producer, someone with whom I could collaborate, someone with chops, the necessary technical knowledge and, more importantly, a similar attitude and outlook on life and music. And after looking all over New England, by the grace of God (and Facebook), I found him, almost right next door, in the person of Ryan Ordway. Ryan is a young man with an extensive resume as a songwriter, producer, recording artist and touring musician, and he has built a studio in Gilford, just over the hill from my home. Better yet, he is starting a Recording Cooperative, a studio run by and for musicians, and I would very much like to join.

By becoming a member of the Cooperative, I will be able to record my songs in partnership with some of the best musicians in the area, and continue to do so for years to come. It’s affordable, but well beyond my means, as I am living, as most folks I know are, paycheck to paycheck. The total cost of buying into the Recording Cooperative, recording, mixing, mastering, and manufacturing the album, including cover art and promotion, is estimated at $7,000….a minor expense for the big recording artists, but a small fortune for me…but I think I can scrimp and save and pull together about $2000, leaving me $5000 short. That’s where you come in. 

Through crowdfunding, I can take collaboration on this Project to a new level, and all of you can take part in producing the record. Not only will your donations make it possible, but as the project progresses, you can participate in various ways, by sharing the Indiegogo campaign with others, by attending events at the studio or performances in local venues, and by commenting on the rough tracks as we post them online. So please, help us make my lifelong dream a reality. With any pledge of $20 or more, you will receive a special First-Edition CD upon completion, and there are other premiums available for pledges in higher amounts. Please check it out, like my singer/songwriter page on Facebook, email me your ideas at pointlessforest@gmail.com, and check back here on Indiegogo to track the progress of the crowdfunding campaign.* Whether we raise the money or not, I am truly grateful that I have been given the chance to take my music to a new level.

*Even if you can't contribute financially, please help us by sharing this page with all your online friends.

Thanks,

Peter

story:
TIME'S RUNNING OUT!

We're reaching the end of our campaign and time is running out to claim some of the goodies we have set up for you. We want to thank all the people that have donated so far. Your generous contributions are greatly appreciated and have made a huge difference! 

We have the album recorded and mixed, but we still have the mastering process to go through which makes the music ready for radio, as well as duplication of the CDs for mass consumption. We want our record to sound the best is can for our listeners!

If you plan on getting the album when it comes out, go ahead and pre-order it here with us. It won't cost you any extra, unless you want to take this last chance to claim some of the cool perks we have lined up for our most supportive of fans. So if you can help us out, every little bit goes a long way. Thank you!

Sincerely,
Chris Kilcullen


Want to talk further, or have any questions? You can reach us at kilcullen.management@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

It has been a dream of my heart to be able to do this project for about 6 years. This EP will contain all original Worship songs that I have written, these songs come from my personal experience and tell a story of where I've been with the Lord.

Its my hope that this EP will speak to you and that you would be able to Experience that same love of The Father that I have. 

What you are giving towards 

Everything that is collected through this campaign will go towards:
   -Recording, Mixing, and Mastering the EP
   -Paying for the studio required for recording.
   -Paying the musicians involved in this project.
   -Paying for the cost of distributing the final product.

 Your Giving makes a Difference 

Without your contributions  this project will not be successful. So I ask you to partner with me to make this Dream a reality.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that not everyone will be able to contribute  financially so these are some ways you can help.

   -Share this campaign with your friends and family, via social media.

   -Prayer. I'm a firm believer that prayer works, so join with me in prayer that God will guide me through this project until it's completion.

story:
First Studio Album In Four Years!

Steve Riley and the Mamou Playboys' new album has been 2 years in the making, and they are finally ready to release their 14th studio album: "Voyageurs". Recorded in Staffland Studios by Chris Stafford, the new album features original compositions along with covers of obscure Cajun/Creole songs from legends such as Dewey Balfa, Boozoo Chavis, Dennis McGee and Isom Fontenot. 
"We have poured all of our heart, souls and entire budget into the recording of the project," says Riley. "We now need to press and release the album. We are working with publicity and marketing company Rock, Paper, Scissors on the national release." 
"Voyageurs" will be the first album to feature singer, songwriter and Balfa alum Kevin Wimmer on fiddle. Wimmer is one of the most dynamic and respected fiddlers in Cajun music. With this robust lineup, "Voyageurs" promises to be one of The Playboys' finest albums yet. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • As an independent band, this is the work of blood, sweat and tears of a band with a passion for keeping Cajun music alive! We need your help for National distribution, marketing and publicity.
  • Get the new album. Want more? We've got it! T-shirts, posters, mugs, workshops and private Skype lessons to name a few. 

The Impact

  • By successfully funding this album, through YOUR contribution, we will be able to market and promote the record, promoting our heritage and culture to the world!

Risks & Challenges

  • We are a completely independent band with no big labels backing us. If we don't reach our funding goal, we may not be able to successfully impact the release of our new album Voyageurs.
  • By your contribution, we will be able to fund our marketing and distribution of the album independent of a label.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • E-mail, call, text your friends and let them know that they can help!
  • Use the "Share" button on this page to share with your friends through social media.
  • Tell your rich uncle.

story:
Depuis 2010, des investissements majeurs de plus de 20 000 $ ont été réalisés en culture de la vigne, en essais, en vinification et en connaissance sur le terroir nord-côtier. Nos recherches ont été soutenues par ID Manicouagan en 2012 et 2013. En 2014, madame Gaelle Dubé, membre de l’Ordre des agronomes du Québec, bachelière en agronomie de l’Université Laval et d’un brevet de technicien supérieur agricole option viticulture et oenologie du Lycée François Pétrarque à Avignon en France, apporte son soutient technique pour supporter le travail de recherche et d’implantation du vignoble. Plus d’une quarantaine d’espèces ont été testées sur le terrain et d’autres encore sont en cour. Le champ d’échantillonnage compte plus de huit-cents vignes. Des milliers d’heures ont été réalisés dans la recherche pour trouver les bons cépages idéals pour notre climat. Une bonne maturité du raisin avec des taux potentiels d’alcool de 10 à 13 % alc/vol, d’une bonne acidité variant entre 3,2 et 3,6 de ph, de bonnes saveurs et une bonne résistance aux hivers faits que les premiers cultivars sont maintenant ciblée. D’autres résultats sont attendus, de cultivars différents, ce qui fera en sorte d’améliorer la qualité de nos produits d’année en année.Votre investissement servira directement au démarrage, au roulement et aux investissements dans la plantation du Domaine Côte du Nord. La première étape importante est l’achat des terrains. Par la suite, bâtir la pouponnière (serre), préparer les sols pour accueillir les nouvelles vignes (défrichage, nettoyage du sol, faussets, labours, amendement et chaux, la plantation, l’implantation, installation des poteaux, des lignes de support et former les pieds de vigne pour la fructification. Il faut attendre au minimum 3 ans avant une première récolte très modeste. Cette dernière est prévue pour l’automne 2017 et à plein rendement des plants en 2019-2020. Des vignes de raisin de table que l’on retrouve en épicerie [bleu, vert et rouge] seront la base du démarrage du vignoble. Celles découvertes pour la transformation de nos futurs vins seront introduites en partie cette année et l’an prochain. La première cuvée étant prévue pour 2019 [blanc et rosé].Cabernet Severnji, Madeleine Sylvaner, Pinot noir, Baltica.

Le terroir

La situation géographique de la municipalité de Ragueneau en fait un choix idéal. Longeant la rivière outardes, à l‘abri des vents du fleuve et des vents froids du nord, des sols biens drainés et nous offrant un micro climat adéquat. Même si notre territoire se veut difficile, il y a plusieurs avantages avec lesquels nous travaillons. Le développement de la phase I du projet est évalué à 150 M$ pour son implantation.

La finalité

D’ici 8 ou 10, nous aurons bâti un vignoble d’exception en Côte-Nord. Nous produirons du raisin de table d’excellente qualité, frais, fruité et juteux. Nous aurons des produits diversifiés. Nous aurons des vins 100 % terroir d’ici. Des vins blanc, rosé, rouge et passerillé offrant une qualité qui en feront la fierté des Nord-Côtiers. C’est produits serons disponible de Tadoussac, en passant par Sacré-Coeur, jusqu'à Blanc-Sablon. Il représentera le plus fidèlement notre attachement à notre terroir si vaste et diversifié.

Démarrer un tel projet profitera également à la Côte-Nord en stimulant « l’entrepreuneurship » et poussera assurément le développement dans le domaine agricole du petit fruit et éventuellement, de sa transformation ici, chez nous sur le territoire nord-côtier. Notre entreprise est soucieuse de l'environnement et croit en une agriculture diversifiée qui encourage l'économie locale et régionale.
