Des milliers d’heures ont été réalisés dans la recherche pour trouver les bons cépages idéals pour notre climat. Une bonne maturité du raisin avec des taux potentiels d’alcool de 10 à 13 % alc/vol, d’une bonne acidité variant entre 3,2 et 3,6 de ph, de bonnes saveurs et une bonne résistance aux hivers faits que les premiers cultivars sont maintenant ciblée. D’autres résultats sont attendus, de cultivars différents, ce qui fera en sorte d’améliorer la qualité de nos produits d’année en année.Votre investissement servira directement au démarrage, au roulement et aux investissements dans la plantation du Domaine Côte du Nord. La première étape importante est l’achat des terrains. Par la suite, bâtir la pouponnière (serre), préparer les sols pour accueillir les nouvelles vignes (défrichage, nettoyage du sol, faussets, labours, amendement et chaux, la plantation, l’implantation, installation des poteaux, des lignes de support et former les pieds de vigne pour la fructification. Il faut attendre au minimum 3 ans avant une première récolte très modeste. Cette dernière est prévue pour l’automne 2017 et à plein rendement des plants en 2019-2020. Des vignes de raisin de table que l’on retrouve en épicerie [bleu, vert et rouge] seront la base du démarrage du vignoble. Celles découvertes pour la transformation de nos futurs vins seront introduites en partie cette année et l’an prochain. La première cuvée étant prévue pour 2019 [blanc et rosé].Cabernet Severnji, Madeleine Sylvaner, Pinot noir, Baltica.Le terroirLa situation géographique de la municipalité de Ragueneau en fait un choix idéal. Longeant la rivière outardes, à l‘abri des vents du fleuve et des vents froids du nord, des sols biens drainés et nous offrant un micro climat adéquat. Même si notre territoire se veut difficile, il y a plusieurs avantages avec lesquels nous travaillons. Le développement de la phase I du projet est évalué à 150 M$ pour son implantation.La finalitéD’ici 8 ou 10, nous aurons bâti un vignoble d’exception en Côte-Nord. Nous produirons du raisin de table d’excellente qualité, frais, fruité et juteux. Nous aurons des produits diversifiés. Nous aurons des vins 100 % terroir d’ici. Des vins blanc, rosé, rouge et passerillé offrant une qualité qui en feront la fierté des Nord-Côtiers. C’est produits serons disponible de Tadoussac, en passant par Sacré-Coeur, jusqu'à Blanc-Sablon. Il représentera le plus fidèlement notre attachement à notre terroir si vaste et diversifié.Démarrer un tel projet profitera également à la Côte-Nord en stimulant « l’entrepreuneurship » et poussera assurément le développement dans le domaine agricole du petit fruit et éventuellement, de sa transformation ici, chez nous sur le territoire nord-côtier. Notre entreprise est soucieuse de l'environnement et croit en une agriculture diversifiée qui encourage l'économie locale et régionale.

story:
"With ordinary talent and extraordinary perseverance, all things are attainable." - Thomas Foxwell Buxton


Caleb is one of my heroes from the bible.  He accomplished the greatest feat of his life at an advanced age...an age when many others  give up or  think of retiring.  But like Caleb, I truly believe that age is no barrier to fulfilling goals as evidenced by some like Diana Nyad who at age 64, after five failed attempts over a 35 year span, fulfilled her lifelong dream of swimming from Cuba to Key West!!  Or Tom Watson just months shy of his 60th birthday almost winning the British Open beating all competitors, some almost 40 years younger, except one!  

For the past thirty years I have had a dream to be a professional tour golfer. At every opportunity I have practiced and played to improve my game. I  caddied on the North Florida tour and for Arnold Palmer's Bay-Hill tournament for a few years when we lived in the Orlando area. However, my family has always been a priority so much of my time was spent providing for them, putting my dream on "hold" for the most part. Time, family obligations and circumstances have not diminished my desire. With both my son and daughter recently completing college I sense now is the time to move forward "full steam" with this dream.  To "cross over and possess the land"!!

I have a good game but do not have a great “pedigree” like many other players. I am more like the “Rocky” Balboa of golf but will not give up until I see this God-given dream come to fruition! This has been the burning passion of my heart for the past thirty years!  I keep myself in excellent physical condition and practice even during the winter months. I truly believe that given the chance to practice full-time (which I am now doing), enter “mini-tour” events and with  "hands on" professional instruction, this dream will become a reality.

What is holding me back now is not time constraints but resources. I estimate it will take about $40,000 per year to cover living & travel expenses, entry fees for tournaments across the Southeast, practice rounds, range fees, equipment, plus lessons with a professional instructor when necessary.   I am beginning this quest by playing in mini-tour events in Central Florida starting in July.  As I succeed I will proceed/progress to other tournaments eventually entering Champions Tour Qualifers and Q-School.

This may seem like a daunting task but trust me, If I wasn't firmly convinced I could attain this goal I wouldn't risk sharing it with you. By financially partnering with me  it is my sincerest desire that it will be an inspiration to others to pursue their dreams; regardless of the obstacles or how long their dreams have been deferred! Any donation is greatly appreciated and no donation is too small!!

Thank you for giving my request your time and consideration. 
“Our greatest weakness lies in giving up. The most certain way to succeed is always to try just one more time."  - Thomas A. Edison

story:
Join our campaign and create a dynamic and exciting contemporary music & arts initiative in Kampot, Cambodia.

In brief: This campaign is to raise funds needed build and equip a dynamic community arts venue in Cambodia. KAMA (Kampot Arts & Music Association) is an initiative to promote and present contemporary art and music in Cambodia. To achieve our vision we aim to raise $10,000 to implement KAMA’s first annual music program and equip KAMA’s live music venue and schedule a minimum of 12 special concerts.

How and why KAMA?
KAMA is an initiative of The Cambodian Space Project founder Julien Poulson to foster, develop, mentor contemporary musicians and artists from disadvantaged and under-represented sectors of the arts community in Cambodia. KAMA is not simply asking for your donations to its cause but is offering great made-in-Cambodia products for sale here, by purchasing these ‘perks’ you directly support the opening of our first annual music program and KAMA venue. 

Full description:In December 2009, I formed the group The Cambodian Space Project with Khmer vocalist Srey Channthy. At first, our aim was simply to play a couple of shows at a friends bar, however, CSP soon became known as an exciting, cross-cultural music group leading an important cultural revival in Cambodia. Five years on, this small beginning has lead to some incredible opportunities, not least, exporting the new sounds of Cambodia to the world and championing our local musicians.

Along the way, CSP has regularly donated time and money to support causes we believe in, particularly supporting social arts programs; we’ve performed in jails, public libraries, HIV clinics, Human Rights events, at schools and charities and have often set-up our own free concerts in poor and disadvantaged villages. KAMA is a way for us to continue this work under-the-one-roof, where we can use our own professional expertise to creating, presenting and marketing new talent. 

"KAMA is my vision to give back to the community where I've had the good fortune to live and work in for a number of years while producing music and art work centred around the incredible journey of THE CAMBODIAN SPACE PROJECT. " 
- Julien Poulson (founder of CSP, Sticky Fingers Art Prints Cambodia)

Where and what is KAMA?

Located directly opposite the 2000 monument in downtown Kampot, we’ve set-up shop in fabulous (dilapidated) colonial era building. It’s a large place on the corner of a downtown block where the ground floor will become known as KAMA KAFE – operating as KAMA’s retail outlet with an art gallery and music shop that stocks locally made product. Upstairs includes more gallery space as our open arts studio KAMPOT KREATIF – a pubic access open studio that includes print making workshop, music rehearsal rooms, cinema and office space. 

Why do it?

Today, Cambodia has a far more impressive music and art scene than when CSP began 5 years ago. In a place where culture itself was decimated by a genocidal Khmer Rouge regime, Cambodia’s present day cultural revival is astonishing. However, Cambodia is still a country where most of the population lives in extreme poverty, and opportunities for education and/or meaningful employment are beyond the reach of most.  Music and arts can make a huge difference in such an environment. Many of our local musicians and artists we encounter have little opportunity to develop their practice, to professionalize and to connect with an audience and most do not even own their own instruments. Music and arts programs (like sports programs) are often the great leveller in disadvantaged communities where individuals have little education and less opportunity to find meaningful roles in society.

KAMA will focus on championing new arts as a form of expression for the people who hail from backgrounds of poverty and disadvantage. The opportunity to be involved in music and arts provides hope and happiness, transformation and empowerment and celebrates the creative potential of all people. We believe in a world where creativity, expression, and opportunity, is valued, accepted, respected and available to all. 

By creating “KAMA ” we aim to draw on our own experience (with The Cambodian Space Project) to build a contemporary music and arts space where individuals can meet and share their ideas and experience and ultimately create fresh and original new music. KAMA can nurture and mentor talent while working to create performance opportunities through matching musicians with the appropriate venues and professional pathways.

Instant KAMA!

To begin this journey, KAMA has secured a 10-year lease of an fabulous colonial building situated in the centre of Kampot, Cambodia. It is a venue where we will manage an annual program of music workshops, performances and exhibitions. At KAMA we open our doors to both local musicians as well as international guests in the belief that this exchange will provide a world-view for our local talent. It is also a great opportunity for our International guests to connect with and experience the incredible music and arts culture of Cambodia. Note: The costs in establishing KAMA, equipping and managing the total building space is self-financed and supported by our retail shop, however, the funding we seek is specifically to establish KAMA’s live music program and venue.

"I feel that the experience accumulated through 5 years of working with The Cambodian Space Project will be something that can be shared and used to build a great program at Cambodia’s first contemporary music centre – Music Arts Space Kampot. To make this work, we need to raise the money to equip, staff, and facilitate our vision – we need your help." 

Why is this campaign important to us & our community:
This is the beginning of something new and important. From our own experience of living and working in Cambodia, we recognise that most professional musicians are bonded to an employer or have little opportunity to branch out as independent artists. Often young musicians have little or no knowledge of the world outside Cambodia and have no awareness of the world of music beyond their own village. We believe that the model we have created for The Cambodian Space Project – a freedom to write and perform new music and to successfully connect with professional industry as well as an international audience – can work for the many talented local musicians we have encountered along the way. KAMA is an initiative by the CSP to focus on the next generation of talent in Cambodia. 

In October this year The Cambodian Space Project took residence in Kampot town to create a ‘rock opera’ titled “Hanuman Spaceman”.  To do this we brought together a mix of international and local artists, some already at professional level while others novices. Over a three-week period, “Hanuman Spaceman” took shape via a program of workshops, rehearsals and performances. The focus - experimenting with new music ideas, mixing Khmer traditional sounds with 60’s rock’n’roll and electro-hip-hop beats. Our work in the community resulted in new creative relationships as well as paid employment for a range of technicians, venue operators, musicians and arts workers.  By staging “Hanuman Spaceman” in a small community, we can demonstrate how an accessible community arts projects can lead to meaningful outcomes -  made locally but at the same time, appealing to an international audience.


Current work in development:

Sticky Fingers Art Prints Cambodia, Bokor Mountain Magic Band, CSP, Kampot Music festival, Kampot Writers Festival, Kampot Khmer Ensemble, 

We have a range of art and music initiatives in developing under the KAMA umbrella. This includes: Sticky Fingers print making workshop. At KAMA we will have the space to set-up a new studio to employ our local artisans as well as the potential to host international artists to share their skill and print their own editions. Our Sticky Fingers art prints are leading the way for creating pop art imagery on Cambodian themes, the work is exhibited and represented at galleries internationally and sells quickly. Sticky Fingers is a 'hands on' initiative and is part of our ethos - that music, visual arts, culture should be easily accessible to everyone. 



What We Need & What You Get
 To open our doors and get started we need to equip and staff our venue space. The aim of this campaign is to raise $10,000 USD to implement our first annual music program. This investment will quickly allow our program to become self-sufficient by returning income through the establishment of a retail shop, gallery space and a venue for public performances.

Here’s where money goes:

Instruments: $1500
$1500 to purchase an entire set of high-quality Khmer ensemble instruments for our rehearsal and performance program. These instruments include beautifully made Roneat (Xylophone), Khim, a setoff circular Gongs, 3 x Tros (one string violin), Chapei Dong Veng (long neck Lute), Khmer drums and percussion. Note: very few local musicians own their own instruments, this set of instruments will allow us to run a program of traditional music workshops and performances.  

Employment $2400
$2400 to employ a Cambodian staff member who will work full-time as The Music Space co-ordinator – facilitating access for teachers, mentors, students, volunteers and visitors. Staff and maintain our retail shop, security of the premises and some administration duties including website and social media updates.


Venue facilities $2100
 $2100 to pay for equipment for a good quality vocal pa – we have a high quality mixing desk (donated by CSP) but need to add PA speakers and monitors, a power amplifier, effects rack, microphones and stands. The equipment will be purchased in Cambodia and will provide a professional sound system for performers to use in our own venue as well as at other locations.   

Print media and artist promotion $1600
 Across our annual program we will design and print a series of limited edition screen prints for each and every artist presented by KAMA. The idea is to create highly collectible poster art for our artists and audience and to generate work and income for our print making studio. These images will be used to promote our artists online through social media. $1600 covers costs of materials, papers, inks, etc (not wages) for the printing of 1200 ltd editions.

Annual music program $2400
 KAMA will program a minimum of 12 concerts annually at a cost of $2400. We seek funding support for artist fees at $200per event. Additional artists' income will be made up from audience donations and/or sales or food, drink, merchandise. By securing an annual budget for staging music events it will mean we can afford to program unique and rarely seen performers who may not necessarily attract a large audience. Our music events will be well promoted and free-of-charge. 

This campaign is NOT just asking for donations.  We are raising funds by offering unique, hand made, limited editions available for purchase online through this Indie Go Go campaign.
100% of sales money goes to making KAMA happen:

The Cambodian Space Project vinyl, cds, t-shirts


Limited edition prints

performances

Where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal?

If we’re unsuccessful in meeting our funding target we will still be spendin every dollar raised to kickstart KAMA. If we reach a smaller target than expected then we will have to decrease the size of our first annual programme. However, we will still open and be in a better starting position with the funding we raise via this campaign. 

The Impact

Over the past five years the music and arts projects that I've been personally involved in in Cambodia have made a huge impact on the emerging arts scene. CSP vocalist Srey Channthy's rise from the rice fields of Prey Veng to the World's Stage is an incredible success story and is one that gives hope and influences other young artists in the local community. Through CSP we have created international networks and employment opportunities for many of the individuals we work with in Cambodia as well as bringing experienced arts professionals to Cambodia to work with us in our local community. KAMA is a way to 'umbrella' our work in community and to establish an arts centre with the kind of long-term-vision that will make a great impact and become renown for its work at home and abroad. 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is financing (it's ongoing) and ensuring our professional work remains viable and effective over the long-term. This year CSP celebrates it's 5th anniversary and with this longevity we will establish KAMA with a 10 year plan. To achieve our vision we will need to continue to fund raise for our not-for-profit programme as well as commercialise and raise income from art and music that we can produce to sustain operating costs at KAMA. In a crowded fundraising market, this is not an easy task and takes a full time commitment to managing. 

Good karma!
If you can’t contribute financially you can still be a huge help by sharing our campaign and getting the word out to your friends and community. 

Help by becoming a mentor, volunteer, friend of KAMA.

Got an old instrument you could send our way?  We’d love to receive material support such as instruments or equipment that we could use to grow our resources and provide to students and musicians – most don’t own their own instruments as they’re from poor families and extremely disadvantaged backgrounds.

Go an arts project you'd like to create in Cambodia? let's work together, we have a vision to host international artists-in-residence. By working at KAMA you can influence and add to the experience of our local artists. Please send your proposals to: thecambodianspaceproject@gmail.com

Please copy and paste the Indie Go Go share tools and let your friends know about KAMA's campaign online.

present day cultural revival is astonishing. However, Cambodia is still a
country where most of the population lives in extreme poverty, and
opportunities for education and/or meaningful employment are beyond the reach
of most.  Music and arts can make a huge difference in such an
environment. Many of our local musicians and artists we encounter have little
opportunity to develop their practice, to professionalize and to connect with
an audience and most do not even own their own instruments. Music and arts
programs (like sports programs) are often the great leveller in disadvantaged
communities where individuals have little education and less opportunity to
find meaningful roles in society. 
KAMA will focus on championing new
arts as a form of expression for the people who hail from backgrounds of
poverty and disadvantage. The opportunity to be involved in music and arts
provides hope and happiness, transformation and empowerment and celebrates the
creative potential of all people. We believe in a world where creativity,
expression, and opportunity, is valued, accepted, respected and available to
all. 

By creating “KAMA ” we aim to draw on our own experience (with The Cambodian
Space Project) to build a contemporary music and arts space where individuals
can meet and share their ideas and experience and ultimately create fresh and
original new music. KAMA can nurture and mentor talent while working to create
performance opportunities through matching musicians with the appropriate
venues and professional pathways. 

Instant KAMA!
To begin this journey, KAMA has
secured a 10-year lease of an fabulous colonial building situated in the centre
of Kampot, Cambodia. It is a venue where we will manage an annual program of
music workshops, performances and exhibitions. At KAMA we open our doors to
both local musicians as well as international guests in the belief that this
exchange will provide a world-view for our local talent. It is also a great
opportunity for our International guests to connect with and experience the
incredible music and arts culture of Cambodia. Note: The costs in establishing
KAMA, equipping and managing the total building space is self-financed and
supported by our retail shop, however, the funding we seek is specifically to
establish KAMA’s live music program and venue.
"I feel that the experience
accumulated through 5 years of working with The Cambodian Space Project will be
something that can be shared and used to build a great program at Cambodia’s
first contemporary music centre – Music Arts Space Kampot. To make this work,
we need to raise the money to equip, staff, and facilitate our vision – we need
your help." 
Why is this campaign important to us & our community:
This is the beginning of something new and important. From our own experience of
living and working in Cambodia, we recognise that most professional musicians
are bonded to an employer or have little opportunity to branch out as
independent artists. Often young musicians have little or no knowledge of the
world outside Cambodia and have no awareness of the world of music beyond their
own village. We believe that the model we have created for The Cambodian Space
Project – a freedom to write and perform new music and to successfully connect
with professional industry as well as an international audience – can work for
the many talented local musicians we have encountered along the way. KAMA is an
initiative by the CSP to focus on the next generation of talent in Cambodia. 
In October this year The
Cambodian Space Project took residence in Kampot town to create a ‘rock
opera’ titled “Hanuman Spaceman”.  To do
this we brought together a mix of international and local artists, some already
at professional level while others novices. Over a three-week period, “Hanuman
Spaceman” took shape via a program of workshops, rehearsals and performances.
The focus - experimenting with new music ideas, mixing Khmer traditional sounds
with 60’s rock’n’roll and electro-hip-hop beats. Our work in the community
resulted in new creative relationships as well as paid employment for a range
of technicians, venue operators, musicians and arts workers.  By staging
“Hanuman Spaceman” in a small community, we can demonstrate how an accessible
community arts projects can lead to meaningful outcomes -  made locally but at the same time, appealing
to an international audience.

Current work in development:
Sticky Fingers Art Prints Cambodia, Bokor Mountain Magic Band,
CSP, Kampot Music festival, Kampot Writers Festival, Kampot Khmer Ensemble,  We have a range of art and music initiatives in developing under the KAMA umbrella. This includes: Sticky Fingers print making workshop. At KAMA we will have
the space to set-up a new studio to employ our local artisans as well as the
potential to host international artists to share their skill and print their
own editions. Our Sticky Fingers art prints are leading the way for creating
pop art imagery on Cambodian themes, the work is exhibited and represented at
galleries internationally and sells quickly. Sticky Fingers is a 'hands on'
initiative and is part of our ethos - that music, visual arts, culture should
be easily accessible to everyone. What We Need & What You Get
To open our doors and get started we need to equip and
staff our venue space. The aim of this campaign is to raise $10,000 USD to
implement our first annual music program. This investment will quickly allow
our program to become self-sufficient by returning income through the
establishment of a retail shop, gallery space and a venue for public
performances.
Here’s
where money goes: 
Instruments: $1500

$1500 to purchase an
entire set of high-quality Khmer ensemble instruments for our rehearsal and
performance program. These instruments include beautifully made Roneat
(Xylophone), Khim, a setoff circular Gongs, 3 x Tros (one string violin),
Chapei Dong Veng (long neck Lute), Khmer drums and percussion. Note: very few
local musicians own their own instruments, this set of instruments will allow
us to run a program of traditional music workshops and performances.  Employment $2400

$2400
to employ a Cambodian staff member who will work full-time as The Music Space
co-ordinator – facilitating access for teachers, mentors, students, volunteers
and visitors. Staff and maintain our retail shop, security of the premises and
some administration duties including website and social media updates. 

Venue
facilities $2100
$2100
to pay for equipment for a good quality vocal pa – we have a high quality
mixing desk (donated by CSP) but need to add PA speakers and monitors, a power
amplifier, effects rack, microphones and stands. The equipment will be
purchased in Cambodia and will provide a professional sound system for
performers to use in our own venue as well as at other locations.   
Print media and artist promotion $1600
Across
our annual program we will design and print a series of limited edition screen
prints for each and every artist presented by KAMA. The idea is to create
highly collectible poster art for our artists and audience and to generate work
and income for our print making studio. These images will be used to promote
our artists online through social media. $1600 covers costs of materials,
papers, inks, etc (not wages) for the printing of 1200 ltd editions.Annual music program $2400
KAMA
will program a minimum of 12 concerts annually at a cost of $2400. We seek
funding support for artist fees at $200per event. Additional artists' income
will be made up from audience donations and/or sales or food, drink,
merchandise. By securing an annual budget for staging music events it will mean
we can afford to program unique and rarely seen performers who may not
necessarily attract a large audience. Our music events will be well promoted
and free-of-charge. 
This
campaign is NOT just asking for donations.  We are raising funds by offering unique, hand made, limited editions available for purchase online through this Indie Go Go campaign. 100% of sales money goes to making KAMA happen:The Cambodian Space Project vinyl, cds,
t-shirts

Limited edition prints
performances

Where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal?
If
we’re unsuccessful in meeting our funding target we will still be spendin every
dollar raised to kickstart KAMA. If we reach a smaller target than expected
then we will have to decrease the size of our first annual programme. However,
we will still open and be in a better starting position with the funding we
raise via this campaign. 
The ImpactOver the past five years the music and arts projects that I've been personally involved in in Cambodia have made a huge impact on the emerging arts scene. CSP vocalist Srey Channthy's rise from the rice fields of Prey Veng to the World's Stage is an incredible success story and is one that gives hope and influences other young artists in the local community. Through CSP we have created international networks and employment opportunities for many of the individuals we work with in Cambodia as well as bringing experienced arts professionals to Cambodia to work with us in our local community. KAMA is a way to 'umbrella' our work in community and to establish an arts centre with the kind of long-term-vision that will make a great impact and become renown for its work at home and abroad. Risks & ChallengesOur biggest challenge is financing (it's ongoing) and ensuring our professional work remains viable and effective over the long-term. This year CSP celebrates it's 5th anniversary and with this longevity we will establish KAMA with a 10 year plan. To achieve our vision we will need to continue to fund raise for our not-for-profit programme as well as commercialise and raise income from art and music that we can produce to sustain operating costs at KAMA. In a crowded fundraising market, this is not an easy task and takes a full time commitment to managing. Good karma!If you can’t contribute financially you can
still be a huge help by sharing our campaign and getting the word out to your
friends and community. 
Help by becoming a mentor, volunteer,
friend of KAMA. 

Got an old instrument you could send our
way?  We’d love to receive material
support such as instruments or equipment that we could use to grow our
resources and provide to students and musicians – most don’t own their own
instruments as they’re from poor families and extremely disadvantaged
backgrounds. 

Go an arts project you'd like to create in Cambodia? let's work together, we have a vision to host international artists-in-residence. By working at KAMA you can influence and add to the experience of our local artists. Please send your proposals to: thecambodianspaceproject@gmail.comPlease copy and paste the Indie Go Go share tools and let your friends know about KAMA's campaign online.

story:
My name is Donielle and I am a Christian/Gospel Artist and Worship Leader from Philadelphia who has waited a long time to release the music that was placed inside of me. My desire is to spread the gospel of Jesus through my music and testimony. 

My Story: 

I grew up in the Philadelphia Foster Care system. Before foster care I was a victim of child molestation, but that does not define me. I was blessed to be adopted into an amazing family and later I got to know my biological family as well. My wonderful adoptive mother died when I was 13 years old after I was in her care for most of my life. I was devastated and lost my way. I started writing in a journal to express my feelings which turned into poetry, and later into songs.  When I got to college I was diagnosed with depression but held on to the love of God through His son Jesus Christ. This is where my song "Find Me Where I am" came from. I used to wonder if God could even hear me. My music captures my story through a very unique sound. It is a story of how God has kept me, blessed me, and covered me through the years and how He is longing to do the same for everyone!

How You Can Help!

I am asking for you guys to partner with me so that I can encourage the world through my music! I have been working very hard writing songs, and I have been blessed to share my music at many venues including The TLA, and will soon share at The Dell East in Philadelphia. People are asking when they can buy the album and unfortunately, I haven't had one for them after all this time. I need you guys to make this happen!
I was in a music situation that, unfortunately did not work out. As a result, my music was never released. All the while songs like "Find Me Where I am" and "Do Something" were brewing inside of me.  I am now free and ready to share my music with the world, but I need your help!
Your contribution could finally make this happen and you can be a part of an even bigger movement to encourage and empower people who feel hopeless around the globe. They need words of inspiration and music that inspires. You can help me provide that! 

Extra Perk!

In addition to the perks listed, Every person that donates will get a pre-viewing/First Look of the full music video for my cover of Kim Walker-Smith's  "Spirit Break Out." You will be emailed a link and password  for the video within 48 hours after you donate. My special way of saying THANK YOU! 

Why $6,000?

  • I'm going to release a 5 song EP without a label. This means that I need to pay for studio time ($30+ per hour) , producers, musicians, mixing, mastering, marketing & advertising, graphic designing services,  and promotional materials. 
  • My vision and sound is quite unique and in order to capture what happens live, I'm going to hire real musicians in addition to a producer to preserve those live sounds. 
  • I already have some amazing musicians helping me with live shows, but will need to hire others specifically for studio recording. This will run me about $175 per musician per song. It can get pretty expensive

A Transparent Heart

  • Recording Cost: $3025 (studio time, assisting engineer, producer, studio musicians, mixing, mastering) 
  • Artwork and Packaging Design: $1000 ( including promotional materials) 
  • Printing/Shipping:  $375
  • Marketing and Advertising: $800
  • CD Duplication/Printing: $800
If I don't reach my entire goal, the funds will go towards recording and producing the album and artwork so that I can get the digital project to you guys! All is not lost. I will still work towards these goals as the funding comes in. 


What If We Surpass the Goal? Here's What I'll Do

$7,000 
I'll add 2 more songs to my EP. I have the songs/music. I just need the capital to record them.
$10,000 
In addition to the two extra songs, I'll be able to get my branding done professionally and have my brand and logo integrated into my website www.doniellemusic.com
 $12,000
I'll release a full album with 10 or more songs! Again, I have the music and and I am excited for your guys to hear it. 
$15,000
I'll have a full album and be able to record a professional music video for my single! I'll send the digital release even earlier than anticipated and you guys can vote on my single. Help me choose!

Risks & Challenges

The thought of doing things on my own can be disheartening. I literally have to start from scratch. There is the challenge of going it alone, but I am not alone. I have the Lord and I have help from you! In addition, I have many gifted musicians and producers that want to work with me and others that simply want to help me with this project any way that they can. I am also completely dedicated to seeing my vision for this project come to pass. NO ONE will work harder than me to make sure that it is done well and that it is effective. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out about this campaign! Please SHARE SHARE SHARE. Even if you cannot donate money, I ask that you donate the few minutes that it takes to tell someone else about my campaign on your social media networks! Use Indiegogo's share tools!

story:
"Every afternoon, as they were coming from school, the children used to go and play in the Giant's garden."      -      Oscar Wilde
With this line, one of the most beloved children's stories in all of literature begins.  As the story progresses, we are introduced to a variety of characters including Hail, Frost, the North Wind, Snow and Autumn in addition to a boy and the titular character - the Giant.  (click here to read to the full story)
My name is Steve Weiser, and I am the GM of the Erie Chamber Orchestra (ECO).  We are a professional orchestra based in Erie, PA with one very simple mission - free music for all.  For 36 years, the ECO has been presenting free concerts to the community, allowing thousands of people to experience classical music for the first time in their lives.  Within the past three seasons, with the appointment of new Music Director Matthew Kraemer, the ECO has experienced a rebirth of sorts with an intensified drive both artistically and musically.  
Just this past year, the ECO released its first ever CD, a collection of long-lost silent film music from composer J.S. Zamecnik, entitled the Sounds of the Silents.      Learn more about this project here! 

It was this project that led local Erie composer Stephen Colantti to approach the ECO in the hopes of recording his newly written opera The Selfish Giant.

With your help, we can make this dream a reality.  

From the composer, Stephen Colantti:

I first encountered the story myself as a small child.  Our family had an old 78rpm record with the great actor, Frederick March, narrating the story.  My sisters and I played it over and over again on our old record player.  Obviously, this story made quite an impression on me since I still remembered it quite fondly years later when I set out to write an opera.  Now that the opera has been completed, I believe with all of my heart that with the proper recording of this work, audiences from across the world will be able to experience this one-of-a-kind work and benefit from its powerful message.   
As you can see - the composer believes in his work.  As do we!
We have engaged the following artists to be a part of this project:
  • The Giant - the renowned, Grammy award-winning Mark S. Doss

  • Snow - Shannon Kessler Dooley

  • Frost - Olga Perez Flora

  • North Wind - James Bobick

  • Hail - Brent Weber

  • Autumn - Lisa Layman

  • Children's Chorus - members from the Cathedral of St. Paul Children's Choir and the Young Person's Choir of Erie

Expenses

As one can imagine, recoding an opera is no small task.  Our expenses include:

  • 22 Members of the ECO, 7 singers, a children's choir, equipment rental, sound engineer, album mastering, CD duplication, transportation costs, marketing, etc...
  • Total estimated expenses - $16,514
  • Our unique relationship within Gannon University allows us to use the recording space for free - a huge savings.  We are also able to handle all printing expenses internally.  There are essentially no overhead costs.

Impact

One single feature makes this project stand apart from countless others - this will be the first recording in history of this work.  Your support helps guarantee that this new opera is permanently added to the pantheon of music that has existed for thousands of years.  Rare is the opportunity to actually make a tangible difference such as this.  The final product will be available:

  • As a CD
  • On iTunes and the Amazon Music Store
  • On Spotify and iTunes Radio
Along with the album itself, a documentary will also be created.  We did a similar film from our first recording session last year, and as you can see, it turned out amazingly well.

Risks & Challenges

While any project such as this has certain built in risks, the ECO is an a unique position in the country in that we exist within a university.  Many of the unforeseen expenses are handled by the school, which allows us to ask for only the help that we need.  With one successful recording already under our belts, we are well aware of just how much work is involved with this type of a project.

Stephen Colantti, the opera's composer, believes in this project strongly enough that he is willing to help pay the difference between what you help us raise and our total expenses.  This transparency helps us to ensure that everything is done with cost-effectiveness in mind. 


From myself, our Music Director Matthew Kraemer, composer Stephen Colantti and everyone involved with this project, we thank you in advance for your support of this historical recording!

Best,

Steve Weiser

GM, Erie Chamber Orchestra

From myself, our Music Director Matthew Kraemer, composer Stephen Colantti and everyone involved with this project, we thank you in advance for your support of this historical recording!
Best,
Steve Weiser
GM, Erie Chamber Orchestra

story:
Short Summary

Los Angeles based composer/arranger/band leader Brian Eisenberg is the recipient of the ASCAP Herb Alpert Young Jazz Composer Award, the Downbeat Magazine Student Music Award, the ASCAP Plus Awards, the John Philip Sousa Award, and the Palomar Council Reflections Award.  His music is published with the UNC Jazz Press, Imagine Music, and Hamar Percussion Publications.

Brian directs the 17 piece Brian Eisenberg Jazz Orchestra, a contemporary big band comprised of some of the finest musicians in the world.  The group pushes the boundaries of jazz music through a combination of innovative writing and improvising while keeping a strong link to the past.  Brian's compositions and arrangements are brought to life by musicians who are artists in their own right, bringing their complementary dynamic that helps create the modern paradigm of jazz composition. 

What We Need & What You Get

In order to produce a world class recording, we need to hire the best musicians in Los Angeles for the album, who will be hand picked from one of the deepest wells of quality players in the world.  Many world famous world class musicians call Los Angeles home, and they are eager to perform this cutting edge & challenging music and create a special debut album.  Many have already participated in rehearsals and shows and are becoming very familiar with Brian's music. We also need to use the best recording engineers at the best studios in LA in order to ensure the lens through which these amazing performers will be presented is crystal clear. 

Perks range from the basic pre-order of the album as a download or signed CD, to owning your own custom arrangement by Brian that will be featured on a future album, with commission credit.

The Impact

Jazz is an American art form, and despite it's fall from the mainstream it is still alive and well, evolving and thriving as America's art music and classical music.  In particular, the large ensemble/big band/jazz orchestra has become a popular choice for jazz composers to realize their compositions as well as for improvisers to showcase their abilities.  This merging of composition and improvisation is the key element to modern jazz, with multiple creative voices being integrated.  In addition, drawing upon other styles of music to create a true musical fusion is an underlying theme and driving force in the evolution of modern jazz. 

The verdict is out, this music needs to be recorded:

“One of the most talented writers I’ve ever known”.  –Scott Kyle
“A very talented composer indeed.”  Keith Fiddmont
"[Brian's] writing is thrilling, the first original voice I've heard in a very long time."  -Alan Steinberger
“Really wonderful writing”.  –Josh Nelson
“Very Talented! Highest recommendation possible.”  -David Ward-Steinman

Risks & Challenges

As with any creative project, it is an uphill battle and requires ultimate dedication, foresight, intuition, and perseverance to bring to life.  Brian is an experienced bandleader having led a big band in San Diego during the early 2000s and now has the backing of the greatest jazz big band city in the world.  The big band scene in LA is thriving and so many great players are eager to play new and challenging music. The environment has never been better to support cutting edge jazz band music; the only real obstacle is money. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute at this time, please spread the word in any way you can.  Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools as well.
story_txt:
Short Summary Los Angeles based composer/arranger/band leader Brian 
Eisenberg is the recipient of the ASCAP Herb Alpert Young Jazz Composer 
Award, the Downbeat Magazine Student Music Award, the ASCAP Plus Awards,
 the John Philip Sousa Award, and the Palomar Council Reflections 
Award.  His music is published with the UNC Jazz Press, Imagine Music, 
and Hamar Percussion Publications.Brian directs the 17 piece
Brian Eisenberg Jazz Orchestra, a contemporary big band comprised of some of
the finest musicians in the world.  The
group pushes the boundaries of jazz music through a combination of innovative
writing and improvising while keeping a strong link to the past.  Brian's compositions and arrangements are
brought to life by musicians who are artists in their own right, bringing their
complementary dynamic that helps create the modern paradigm of jazz
composition.     What We Need & What You GetIn order to produce a world class recording, we need to hire the best musicians in Los Angeles for the album, who will be hand picked from one of the deepest wells of quality players in the world.  Many world famous world class musicians call Los Angeles home, and they are eager to perform this cutting edge & challenging music and create a special debut album.  Many have already participated in rehearsals and shows and are becoming very familiar with Brian's music. We also need to use the best recording engineers at the best studios in LA in order to ensure the lens through which these amazing performers will be presented is crystal clear.  Perks range from the basic pre-order of the album as a download or signed CD, to owning your own custom arrangement by Brian that will be featured on a future album, with commission credit.
  The ImpactJazz is an American art form, and despite it's fall from the mainstream it is still alive and well, evolving and thriving as America's art music and classical music.  In particular, the large ensemble/big band/jazz orchestra has become a popular choice for jazz composers to realize their compositions as well as for improvisers to showcase their abilities.  This merging of composition and improvisation is the key element to modern jazz, with multiple creative voices being integrated.  In addition, drawing upon other styles of music to create a true musical fusion is an underlying theme and driving force in the evolution of modern jazz.  The verdict is out, this music needs to be recorded:“One of the most talented
writers I’ve ever known”.  –Scott Kyle
“A very talented composer
indeed.”  Keith Fiddmont"[Brian's] writing is thrilling, the first original voice I've heard in a very long time."  -Alan Steinberger  “Really wonderful writing”.  –Josh Nelson    “Very Talented! Highest recommendation possible.”  -David Ward-Steinman
  Risks & ChallengesAs with any creative project, it is an uphill battle and requires ultimate dedication, foresight, intuition, and perseverance to bring to life.  Brian is an experienced bandleader having led a big band in San Diego during the early 2000s and now has the backing of the greatest jazz big band city in the world.  The big band scene in LA is thriving and so many great players are eager to play new and challenging music. The environment has never been better to support cutting edge jazz band music; the only real obstacle is money.  
  Other Ways You Can HelpIf you are unable to contribute at this time, please spread the word in any way you can.  Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools as well.

story:
GIRL OF DIAMOND MOUNTAIN is a mixed-media show about a grown woman who starts to remember and vocalize about traumatic incidents from her childhood. Though the experience holds a lot of darkness and pain, her opening up for the truth allows the light to take action, and bring healing and change into her body and soul.

Composer Carman Moore, a Juilliard School alumnus and Guggenheim Fellowship award winner with a recent symphonic performance at Carnegie Hall, wrote the piece with celebrated Danish singer/song writer Lotte Arnsbjerg. After five performances in New York City, and six across Denmark, we hope to take our  transformative  performance on the road across the U.S.A. 


Audience response to the piece has been enthusiastic and touching.  Survivors of childhood abuse have approached the performers after the show to describe their own experiences and how the music and dance of GIRL OF DIAMOND MOUNTAIN spoke to them. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 of funding to allow for travel expenses, performance expenses, and publicity in the concert locations of New York City; Austin, Texas; Wimberley, Texas; Berkeley, California; and Honolulu and Kona in Hawaii. 

In gratitude for your funding we offer Lotte and Carman's very popular CDs at the $50; autographed copies of the GIRL OF DIAMOND MOUNTAIN score with lyrics for those at $100; a newly-recorded CD of the entire GIRL... song cycle plus autographed score at $500; and for $1,000 Carman and Lotte offer to compose for you to your subject, as well as the CD, and autographed score.  Should our campaign fall a bit short of the $10,000 goal, the show will go on.

Regardless of your level of contribution, please help us get the word out to those who might join us in this very important crusade for great music and against child sexual abuse.  Everyone's help is appreciated!

Please help us by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hi, I’m Mark.

 I am a singer/songwriter based in Boston, MA, gearing up to release my first studio effort and I’m so excited! I’ve been waiting for years for the right time and circumstance to release my music to a broader audience, hence “casting my net” to create more opportunities to do what I love, what I feel I was put on this Earth to do—that is, sing my heart out, and reach people through music. I really truly believe there are people out there who will get something positive, powerful, and healing from these songs. That is why this project is so important to me, and hopefully to you. However, I need your help to make it happen.

  Recording this beautiful 5 song EP is expensive, and this is why I'm asking for your help. The money from this campaign goes to recording and mixing costs, paying studio musicians, mastering, and reproducing the physical CD copies. By donating to this campaign, not only will you support me in continuing on my path as a musician and reaching a broader audience, but you will also get some fantastic and meaningful perks! Anything from signed copies of the EP, to original artwork, a music lesson, a house concert, or a song penned by me for a special occasion. Be sure to check the gallery for artwork images. I hope that you will find these perks to be a very special thank you for your generosity, and I hope you love this EP as much as I do. Thank you, and please spread the word through email/social media sites, and word of mouth--let’s get this done!

story:
Soooo... what's this all about? 

Welp, from April 1st to May 1st (for a total of 720 hours) Chico's musicians are joining forces to break the current Guinness World Record for "Longest Multi-Artist Concert" which is 15 days & 12 hours. 

Yup. You heard that right. 

We're going to DOUBLE it—live music 24/7 for a whole freaking month. And it's gonna be filmed. The full-blown documentary will even be pitched to Netflix. Woot. 

Now why in the world (punny) would this not-so-small, talent-ridden college town want to attempt such a feat? 

Two reasons:

1. First and foremost, to brand Chico as the monumental music city it truly is (no joke... we're talking on par with Portland, Athens, and Seattle), and secondly...

2. To quote Mike Justice from local Chico band My Lanta: "[Attempting to break a Guinness World Record as a community] is literally the best thing to ever happen to this town."

Okay three:

3. To connect other local music communities across the country and establish a nation-wide collective (yup... a database of hot music scenes from California to New York... and Canada, eh?).

But here's the thing: We can't do this alone. 

Obviously. 

We need you. And want you. 

Only with your support will we be able to nationally showcase the plethora of artistry brewing in our vibrant town and others across the country. 

And we know you wanna have our back yo. Just like we've got yours. 

Yeah, you're gonna get some love.

Read on to find out how... 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $10,000 and we know exactly where every penny will be spent: 

  • The first $2,000 will fund our live online streaming videographer and website, production of branded t-shirts, fliers, and of course, a fatty tip jar for our 300+ acts.
  • The next $4,000 will fund our sound and media support crew, staff, massage therapist for the VIP area, and a bonus for our awesome volunteers, without which you wouldn't even be reading these words right now.
  • The final $4,000 will fund the production of CD's and DVD's, decor for the event, "unforeseen" expenses (we see 'em comin'!), and finally, a mini-payday for the o.g. staff.

And here it is. The love you're gonna get when you support this badass music movement. Look to the right for the gory details. For now, suffice it to say you can score:

  • Passes for the VIP lounge which includes that scheduled masseuse you read about above, lunches and dinners, couches, and so much more...
  • Photo ops for your and your peeps (or with your band of choice!) with our professional photographer on staff...
  • Packages of postcards or CD's and DVD's with t-shirts or hottie girly tanks...
  • And we can't forget our incredible "Girl's Night Out" package: 8 VIP passes, 8 Chico Chica Gear tanks, 1 bottle of vodka with mixers, a professional group photo in front of the Guinness World Record backdrop, and a cab home (too good to be true, we know)...

And look, if we don't make our whole financial goal, what funds we do raise will go straight to the streaming video and website, memorabilia, and a tip jar for the bands. 

But let's not miss all these other amazing opportunities, k? 

How This Will Change the World 

Imagine a world where local bands — hubs of musical communities — could easily connect through the mutual desire to spotlight the lesser known music scenes and provide them more opportunities to perform and be recognized for their genuine talent than ever before. 

THIS is what we hope to achieve in the long run. 

We believe that in today's tech world we can come up with creative ways to benefit ambitious, cooperative musicians across the country. 

This world record attempt is the our effort to set the stage for future attempts in a friendly competition with other amazing towns in the U.S. and Canada. 

Our recent grassroots endeavor to showcase the Chico music scene was a HUGE success—a rockumentary featuring nearly 100 local acts. Premiered at the Pageant Theater on March 1st demonstrated our ability to pull our community together and rally for a greater cause. 

Now we want YOU to be a part of this cause, too. 

Grab a perk and join us in this movement to rock the nation. 

Risks & Challenges

The previous attempts were small-scale in nature and the records for "Longest Multi-Artist Performance" were broken by handfuls of artists and bands. 

At the moment we have 200 acts signed up to perform, so the sheer volume of participants gives us an advantage in succeeding at breaking the record. 

If, however, we run into circumstances such as: 

  • Bands taking longer than five minutes between sets (we will have two stages to reduce the chance of this occurring), or 
  • If a Witness does not show up (we will have on-call Witnesses at the ready in case this happens), or
  • If we have less than 10 people in the audience at a time (again, our peeps are on-call, even at those odd hours)... 

... we will have to reset the clock. 

IF we have to reset the clock and it's within the first two weeks, we will still have enough time to break the record! 

Again, the previous record was 15 days and 12 hours, so we have SOME buffer room if necessary—but we're going to do everything in our power to make the buffer room totally unnecessary. 

Other Way You Can Support Us

Don't have a few bucks to toss our way? How about your awesome self? 

If you're a Chico local, we want you with us. 

"Witnesses"

We need TWO official Witnesses in the crowd at all times. Are you a business owner, teacher, doctor, lawyer, nurse, city council member, or otherwise professional person? We'd LOVE to have you be a Witness! Or are you a gung-ho music lover than REALLY wants to see this thing succeed? Consider being an official Witness throughout the month! 

To be a Witness means you must commit to a four-hour shift and be willing to take notes during your time there. You must not have any affiliation with the band or the event. And you must know we love you for even considering this. <3 

Also know that a person can be a Witness more than one time. We're gonna need a lot of support with this one, folks... a whole month of Witnesses. Interested? Sign up here: https://emilyrosecoaching.acuityscheduling.com/... 

"Warm Bodies"

We're going to need 10 bodies in the crowd at all times—literally ALL times of day and night. This means those odd hours... 4, 5, 6am... 

Are you a night owl? Come down to the Tackle Box and chill with us there!

Maybe you're a morning person and you don't have to be at work until the evening... Com down to the Tackle Box, listen to music, and have coffee and breakfast with our volunteers! (I know I wanna see you down there. ;)

Y'all we need A LOT of non-musical volunteer help to make this happen.

So please pitch in any way you can. 

  • SHARE this campaign
  • SPREAD the word far beyond Chico
  • JOIN our fb group http://bit.ly/ChicoBreaksTheRecord
  • FOLLOW us on Instagram and Twitter @iplayinchico

We so appreciate your support!!

story:
(SELECT ENGLISH SUBTITLES IN THE RIGHT BUTTOM OF THE VIDEO).

Our second album "Saint Rebel" was released January 12th. 2015 in the US.

Now we have a fantastic opportunity to do a some showcases for the business over there and show them why SAINT REBEL should be the next Volbeat in the US.

We hope that you will help us get there with a perk of your choice.

Why should I give a perk?

We don't expect you to give a perk for nothing in return! 

That's why we made a number of "normal" perks for you, but also a very special one for those who want to give a little extra and therefore get something extra in return.

With a perk for 500 Dollars we will come home to you.. in your living room and play a small concert for you, your friends and family. AND you get to choose the setlist with the band!   

We paid for both of our albums ourselfes, just as all of our tours. But we could really use your help getting to the US to do these showcases.  

Every bit of your perk to us will be spent on travelcosts. We are 5 people going from Copenhagen to Los Angeles on to Orlando and back home from New York.

Other ways you can help

Besides donating, you can also help us out by letting all your friends and family about this project. On the top of the page, right underneath the video, you'll find buttons to share the project link. You can even embed it to your own website or blog if you want. Every little bit of support helps!

About SAINT REBEL

SAINT REBEL is indeed a band growing bigger and bigger... 
Two very critically acclaimed albums the last 3 years, 2 GAFFA AWARDS nominations and many sold out shows.  

Saint Rebel's first single "Now You Know" from their new album "Saint Rebel", went straight #1 on the Danish iTunes rock chart top 100.

See musicvideo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I4BlHRp5OWs

The album "Saint Rebel" was nominated for "best hard rock release of 2014" at the big annual GAFFA AWARDS TV-show in Dec.2014. 

The new album was released January 12th in the US.

September 29th 2014 - sold out Danish release (centerstage):See video here: 

O

This release follows in the footsteps of the band's debut album "The Battle of Sinners and Saints" from 2012 An album which was Award nominated for the big Danish "Gaffa Prize 2012" in the category "Danish hard rock release of the year." The album also received airplay on radio stations throughout the world and peaked at #28 on the American iTunes metal chart Top 100th.


FAQs

When will the showcases take place? 
From april 6th-14th 2015 in CA and FL - USA.

When will my stuff ship? 
As soon as possible.

How can I pay? 
By Credit Card (Visa, Mastercard, Discover, and American Express).

Now added Apple pay (US ONLY)

Do I have to pay extra for international shipping?
No. All shipping costs are included in the perk prices.

I already ordered a perk, but want another one. Is that possible?
Yes, you can order as many perks as you want!


Thank you so much!

Jesper, Jonas, Martin and Jakob.

story:
My name is Kristian Braathen, band leader of PK3 Jazz Trio.  I have been performing music for 27 years and working as a full time musician since 1998.  

Ten years ago, I formed the jazz trio PK3 with the intent of performing and touring both here in Canada and beyond.  In addition to dozens of local performances and private events, PK3 is a regular performer at the Vancouver International Jazz Festival, the Pender Harbour Jazz Festival, and the Gibsons Jazz Festival.  While we have had great success performing over the past number of years, we do not yet have a CD recording.  Hence, here I am!  Every time we perform, we receive wonderful praise, and always many requests from people who wish to purchase our music to take home.  This CD will provide us opportunities to apply for festivals and organize tours further from home, as well as local and international radio play on many of the leading jazz stations.  

The musicians joining me on this album are; Miles Black- piano, Jodi Proznick- acoustic bass, and a special guest that I will announce later in the campaign.

I am looking to raise $8000 US (10,000 cdn) in preparation for the recording of this CD.  This amount will cover the following costs;

- studio time (two full days)

- recording engineer for the recording and mixing process

- fees for side musicians

- mastering 

- graphic design

- song rights

- printing and packaging

Those individuals who choose to help me fund this project will receive a copy of the finished CD for a donation of $25.  For a donation of $50, I will have all of the musicians sign the CD.  Of course, larger donations are always welcome!

I look forward to this new challenge, and hope that you can help me make it a reality.

Sincerely,

Kristian Braathen
story_txt:
My name is Kristian Braathen, band leader of PK3 Jazz Trio.  I have been performing music for 27 years and working as a full time musician since 1998.  
Ten years ago, I formed the jazz trio PK3 with the intent of performing and touring both here in Canada and beyond.  In addition to dozens of local performances and private events, PK3 is a regular performer at the Vancouver International Jazz Festival, the Pender Harbour Jazz Festival, and the Gibsons Jazz Festival.  While we have had great success performing over the past number of years, we do not yet have a CD recording.  Hence, here I am!  Every time we perform, we receive wonderful praise, and always many requests from people who wish to purchase our music to take home.  This CD will provide us opportunities to apply for festivals and organize tours further from home, as well as local and international radio play on many of the leading jazz stations.  
The musicians joining me on this album are; Miles Black- piano, Jodi Proznick- acoustic bass, and a special guest that I will announce later in the campaign.
I am looking to raise $8000 US (10,000 cdn) in preparation for the recording of this CD.  This amount will cover the following costs;
- studio time (two full days)
- recording engineer for the recording and mixing process
- fees for side musicians
- mastering 
- graphic design
- song rights
- printing and packaging
Those individuals who choose to help me fund this project will receive a copy of the finished CD for a donation of $25.  For a donation of $50, I will have all of the musicians sign the CD.  Of course, larger donations are always welcome!
I look forward to this new challenge, and hope that you can help me make it a reality.
Sincerely,
Kristian Braathen

story:
Short Summary

My Name is Pop Star Masumi. I am a Singer/Songwriter/Musician. My song “Girls Make The World Go ‘Round” is set to be played on National Radio.                                 To help this song have an impact, and become the Popular Success and Social Message I feel that it can be, I need your support, to go on a National Radio & T.V. Promotion Tour.   Public Relations, Radio Marketing and Promotion, are necessary components for every success.

This song, which is from my new Album, gets such strong positive feedback, I want to tour, meet the fans, and help build awareness about it. It has an uplifting, encouraging, wanna have fun, unifying message. 

“Girls Make The World Go ‘Round” on Internet radio, has tens of thousands of passionate responses from listeners, and is becoming an Anthem for empowered Women & Girls, and the people who love them, all over the world.  We get wonderful comments and encouragement from fans, not only in the U.S., but also countries in Europe, Asia, and the Middle East.  


Women and Girls today are making many outstanding contributions to the world and society. I feel and I know we are at the Moment Of Truth. What I need is You. . .    I hope you will rally with me to promote my Record, and Spread the word on your Social Networks. 

We have great Perks, incentives, for your support. Take a look at the PERK’S LIST. I’m confident you’ll find one that fits. Maybe a lifetime of tickets for shows that I headline?  


I know that together we can make this happen. Together we will be the difference. Your financial support is essential. Please join me on this incredible Journey. I’ll forever appreciate everything you do to help. Thank you, Thank you for your help and support. . . Let’s Meet  at the Grammys Next Year!


                                                                         

          






Accomplishing this National Promo Tour, (and first leg of a World Tour), as an independent Artist on an Independent Label would not be possible without Crowd Funding. That’s why we’re here on Indiegogo and that’s why 100% of the money raised by this campaign will go towards making this promo tour the best promo tour it can possibly be.

IndieGoGo Funding Type: Flexible  Funding                                                                   Timeline: 37days 03-24 thru 04-29-2015                                                                                The Goal  $74,690                                                                                                                              PR / Marketing & Promotion  $50,400.00                                                                                  Travel & Lodging & Perks             17,500.00                                                                                                                                                 ___________                                                                                                                                 $67,900.00                                                               IndieGoGo fees                                  6,790.00                                                                                                                            ____________                                                                                                                                         $74,690.00    


PERKS with T-Shirts. . . you can choose Cap or T-Shirt. (get both for an extra $17)

2 Color T-Shirt Print (American Apparel 2001/2102)

3 Color Embroidered Newsboy Cap (similar to the one worn by Pop Star Masumi)

3 Color Embroidered Ball Cap

story:
Short Summary

Ciao a tutti!
Siamo Federico, Fabrizio e Davide; tre anni fa abbiamo iniziato un'avventura.
Prima per gioco, poi sempre più sul serio, abbiamo creato una nuova web radio. Bandit Rock Radio è nata un pomeriggio, uno di quelli in cui non sapevamo bene cosa fare.
Come al solito ascoltavamo e discutevamo di musica.
Amiamo il rock ma qui in Italia, secondo la nostra opinione, di rock non ne viene trasmesso mai abbastanza... ci siamo detti, perchè non provare a fare anche noi qualcosa.
Così nasceva Bandit, nel marzo del 2013.

Abbiamo pubblicizzato e portato la trasmissione in giro, ma limitandoci a mantenerla nel giro degli amici... ora vogliamo provare a diventare grandi e abbiamo bisogno di una grossa mano per la nuova stagione.

Per chi non ci conoscesse, forse una presentazione è doverosa: siamo tre ragazzi di quarant'anni, con l'amore per la radio.
Già, la radio; proprio quel mezzo romantico, con quel sapore un po' vintage ma, come qualsiasi cosa che regala emozioni, vivissima tutt'oggi e quotidianamente vissuta da milioni di persone che, come voi, ascoltano musica e parole in macchina o in ufficio, nei negozi o direttamente in cuffia grazie al cellulare. 

Il nostro sogno si chiama Bandit Rock Radio. E' un progetto musicale, come dicevamo, nato dalla passione per la musica e dall'amore per il rock.
Ispirato all’esperienza dell’emittente svedese Bandit Rock, punta ad allargare gli orizzonti del panorama rock in Italia, proponendo un format radiofonico che porta gli studi della trasmissione direttamente nei locali, con djset trasmessi in streaming via web radio.

What We Need & What You Get

Vogliamo che il nostro progetto cresca e sia sempre più un punto di riferimento per chi ama il rock, il divertimento e le emozioni più pure.
Desideriamo che la forza della musica riesca a raggiungervi sempre, nella maniera più ottimale possibile, in ogni momento e sotto qualsiasi forma, regalandovi anche nuove sorprese.
Come ogni progetto radio, per essere riconosciuto e pienamente in regola, necessita della registrazione in SIAE e di altri atti burocratici minori.
Ovviamente questi contratti vanno rinnovati ogni anno.
Si presentano poi una serie di costi di gestione continui, che anche con la nostra passione infinita, non sono semplici da riuscire a contenere.

La cifra che vogliamo raggiungere è di 1500 euro, che comprende:
l'iscrizione per 1 anno alla SIAE, altri costi burocratici, un ampliamento della discografia di album in digitale ad uso di Bandit e alcuni minimi costi di gestione che una radio via web presuppone, come il dominio internet, lo spazio hosting, i costi di streaming etc. 

Vi chiediamo quindi, ove possibile, di aiutarci a sostenere queste cifre e a rinnovare il mondo della musica in Italia. Anche con un singolo euro. 
Un caffè per Bandit, potremmo dire. 

Risks & Challenges

Ah, ma se la campagna non raggiungesse la cifra prevista, che cosa succederebbe?

Nulla di preoccupante, anzi.
La cifra indicata è l'ammontare totale che serve per questo primo anno di registrazione, ma qualsiasi numero riusciremo a raggiungere grazie a voi, sarà utilizzato nel migliore dei modi per la vita di Bandit.
E per favorire la riuscita di questo progetto, lasceremo aperta la campagna di fundraising per un ulteriore periodo di tempo.

Other Ways You Can Help

Se non riuscite o non volete contribuire economicamente alla campagna, ma riusciste a supportarci condividendo, pubblicizzando e parlando in giro di questa nostra iniziativa, ve ne saremo infinitamente grati e vi ameremmo molto.

In più, cerchiamo dei locali dove poter portare in trasferta la nostra radio, facendo, come vi abbiamo raccontato, delle trasmissioni in diretta, via web streaming, direttamente dalla location esterna: quindi se conoscete qualche situazione del genere da proporci o conoscete qualcuno che ne sa, ci dareste una grossa mano.

         SPREAD THE LOVE  SPREAD THE WORD  LONG LIVE ROCK'N'ROLL

                                                              MUSIC IS LIFE

                                               BANDIT ROCK RADIO <3 YOU

story:
THE IMPERIAL ASSIGNMENT LAUNCH PARTY 

Just months ago, Monica-Crystal packed her car, said goodbye to Seattle/Portland and made her way down the west coast to L.A. in pursuit of her entertainment industry career goals! 

Over the next 60 days, your support will ensure that our mission to introduce Monica-Crystal's incredible live music and message, to an all-new audience will be a success! When this 

The Imperial Assignment Launch Party will be held in Santa Monica (M-C's hometown) on Saturday, December 5th on her birthday! 

Having lived her entire upbringing in both a military family and then in foster care, as an adult Monica-Crystal found herself constantly on the move. In returning to the beautiful City of Angels, Monica-Crystal looks forward to rocking her Gypsy soul and calling Santa Monica home!


THE MISSION CONTINUES 

In Seattle in the spring of 2012,  Monica-Crystal  founded The Gifted Stars of Venus Fund "Inspiring Young Women To Rediscover Their Light!"

70% of the funds earned from this event will go toward the cost of producing and promoting the event, while the other 30% will go toward establishing The Gifted Stars of Venus Fund as a 501c3 nonprofit organization in the state of California and to planning its first fundraiser event!

FROM THE IMPERIAL ASSIGNMENT LAUNCH PARTY TEAM AND MONICA-CRYSTAL, THANK YOU FOR YOUR GENEROSITY!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, My name is Abena Sakyi and I am an avid worshiper, who loves to worship and write new songs to our Father any chance I get, I love being in His presence. And, I am transitioning the worship experience I encounter every time into a LIVE WORSHIP DVD/CD RECORDING ON THE 30TH OF OCT 2015. This has been a dream of mine and every time I thought about it, it seemed and still seems so impossible due to all the things that’s involved in getting it done, but after a long journey of ups and downs, though nothing is perfect yet, I am trusting the Lord and taking this step of faith for him to walk me through this journey.

My assignment for this worship encounter on Oct 30th 2015, is to usher everyone  INTO HIS PRESENCE, and once we get before Him, my work is done and He the “LORD” will take over, depending on what the personal needs are.



What We Need & What You Get

We have raised $3,000 so far, and we still need your support to raise additional additional $5,000.

 Here is the breakdown and update.

Music Production of 8-10 songs for Live recording $8,000 - less ($3,000) raised to date = $5,000  $  5,000
Video Recording: DVD  -  someone is sponsoring this.  $  -
Sound Engineer for live recording - someone is sponsoring this.  $  -
Replicated DVD 2 Panel - Someone is sponsoring this  $  -
Replicated CD Digipacks 4 panel - Someone is sponsoring this  $  -
Art Work/ graphic design/CD&DVD Cover  -  someone is sponsoring this.  $  -
Pics/Photo-shoot  -  someone is sponsoring this.  $  -
Advertising  -  someone is sponsoring this.  $  -
Flyers/Posters -  someone is sponsoring this.  $  -
Total   $  5,000

The Impact

Lives will be changed, Half of the proceeds will also be donated to school of the blind in Ghana.  Akropong Akwapim.

The live experience in worship and listening to the CD, I believe will save a soul, will give hope and life back to someone who is suicidal, to someone who thinks, all is lost and there is no God, or this God does not care enough for me. The songs will uplift one, will build one up, will encourage us to continue to keep on keeping on and not give up on life, the songs will restore a broken heart and put a smile on a face or may even cause you to sing again. 


Risks & Challenges

My story has been a faith journey, and the Lord has proved himself faithful in every chapter of this story. There are risks and challenges (and often times spiritual warfare) anytime there is an assignment to fulfill. But I completely believe that the this project will be finished and ready to ship in February for the CD Album 2016. If we experience any kind of delays with the project, resources, shipping, fulfillment, etc. we will let all backers know immediately and will keep open communication.

Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from contributing, please help share with friends and Family.

And that's all there is to it.
