story:
My Story 

Hello my name is Shakoor Sanders and I am a professional hand percussionist from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.  For the past seven years I have been on the international jazz scene working with legends such as Grammy award winning artists Wallace Roney, Arturo O’Farrill, Dr. Billy Taylor, Doris Duke Award winner, Aruan Ortiz and Guggenheim Fellowship Award winner Etienne Charles.  From the Kimmel Center in Philadelphia, PA to the Centre Culturel des Portes de I’Essonne in France, my drums have taken me across countries and cultures where I have lived unforgettable experiences. The highlight of my career took place right at home when I had the honor and privilege of playing for President Barrack Obama in 2012 at the Philadelphia Convention Center in support of his second campaign. 

As I matured musically my appetite for a deeper connection to culture developed into something I could no longer keep from pursuing.  After studying with Sam Ruttenburg at the Settlement Music School Mary Louise Curtis Branch to enhance my classical technique, two questions arose in my head, “Where was the music that I was studying from?” and “How did it get to America?” 

Cuba has always held a supportive stance towards the preservation and promotion of African culture through their music.  I began encountering the Yoruba religion, also known as Santeria music at a Cuban dance class, and since then I have been in a lifelong love affair with the Bata drum.  The significance behind my traveling to Cuba stems not only from a desire to deepen my musical understanding, but to enrich my spirituality by drawing a closer connection between my own playing and the unique rhythms of Cuba. 


My Call

As far as this trip is concerned, Cuba has always held a special place in the Latin American psyche. It is regarded as an altar of resistance to imperialism, as well as a crib of resentful nostalgia for those that left. We have always been intrigued by this pollarding effect. Due to the complex history between Cuba and the United States, many would consider Cuba’s culture to be a mystery. The sole purpose of this trip is to study Afro-Cuban drumming and culture. This experience is centered around the African Diaspora and its influence on Cuban music. After this trip I will be equipped to spread my musical knowledge in an effort to preserve and promote the Afro-Cuban musical tradition, while also performing for main events

All campaign proceeds will go towards Shakoor Sanders costs including travel expenses and private lessons. 

Every donation of any size helps me to study in Cuba, and to enrich my community with this experience.

  • Donate 20 Dollars or more: 
    • You will receive a post card from the great Hotel Nacional de Cuba in Central Havana.
    • A personal thank you video from me in Cuba.
  • Donate 50 Dollars or more:
    • You will receive a post card from the great Hotel Nacional de Cuba in Central Havana.
    •  A personal thank you video from me in Cuba. 
    • A free ticket to a select performance this year, and a phone call upon my return thanking you for your donation.
  • Donate 100 Dollars or more:
    • You will receive a post card from the great Hotel Nacional de Cuba. 
    •  A free ticket to a select performance this year of your choice.  
    • A personal two hour interview with me to share photos of my developmental research trip from Havana and Matanzas over a glass of Cuban Coffee or a Mojito at the Alma de Cuba in Center City, Philadelphia.
Your Help 

Don’t think you can be part of  Following the Drum Journey ? Think again, because there are many ways to help him, even without donating. 

  • Share Following The Drum with your friends, family, and relatives via social media Facebook, Twitter, Instagram. Get the word out.
story_txt:
My Story 

Hello my name is Shakoor Sanders and I am a professional hand percussionist from Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.  For the past seven years I have been on the international jazz scene working with legends such as Grammy award winning artists Wallace Roney, Arturo O’Farrill, Dr. Billy Taylor, Doris Duke Award winner, Aruan Ortiz and Guggenheim Fellowship Award winner Etienne Charles.  From the Kimmel Center in Philadelphia, PA to the Centre Culturel des Portes de I’Essonne in France, my drums have taken me across countries and cultures where I have lived unforgettable experiences. The highlight of my career took place right at home when I had the honor and privilege of playing for President Barrack Obama in 2012 at the Philadelphia Convention Center in support of his second campaign. 



As I matured musically my appetite for a deeper connection to culture developed into something I could no longer keep from pursuing.  After studying with Sam Ruttenburg at the Settlement Music School Mary Louise Curtis Branch to enhance my classical technique, two questions arose in my head, “Where was the music that I was studying from?” and “How did it get to America?” 
Cuba has always held a supportive stance towards the preservation and promotion of African culture through their music.  I began encountering the Yoruba religion, also known as Santeria music at a Cuban dance class, and since then I have been in a lifelong love affair with the Bata drum.  The significance behind my traveling to Cuba stems not only from a desire to deepen my musical understanding, but to enrich my spirituality by drawing a closer connection between my own playing and the unique rhythms of Cuba. 




My Call


As far as this trip is concerned, Cuba has always held a special place in the Latin American psyche. It is regarded as an altar of resistance to imperialism, as well as a crib of resentful nostalgia for those that left. We have always been intrigued by this pollarding effect. Due to the complex history between Cuba and the United States, many would consider Cuba’s culture to be a mystery. The sole purpose of this trip is to study Afro-Cuban drumming and culture. This experience is centered around the African Diaspora and its influence on Cuban music. After this trip I will be equipped to spread my musical knowledge in an effort to preserve and promote the Afro-Cuban musical tradition, while also performing for main events

All campaign proceeds will go towards Shakoor Sanders costs including travel expenses and private lessons. 
Every donation of any size helps me to study in Cuba, and to enrich my community with this experience.


Donate 20 Dollars or more: 



You will receive a post card from the great Hotel Nacional de Cuba in Central Havana.
A personal thank you video from me in Cuba.

Donate 50 Dollars or more:

You will receive a post card from the great Hotel Nacional de Cuba in Central Havana.
 A personal thank you video from me in Cuba. 
A free ticket to a select performance this year, and a phone call upon my return thanking you for your donation.

Donate 100 Dollars or more:

You will receive a post card from the great Hotel Nacional de Cuba. 
 A free ticket to a select performance this year of your choice.  
A personal two hour interview with me to share photos of my developmental research trip from Havana and Matanzas over a glass of Cuban Coffee or a Mojito at the Alma de Cuba in Center City, Philadelphia.





Your Help 


Don’t think you can be part of  Following the Drum Journey ? Think again, because there are many ways to help him, even without donating. 



Share Following The Drum with your friends, family, and relatives via social media Facebook, Twitter, Instagram. Get the word out.

story:
Who I Am - A Guy Who Plays Guitar

    Hey there, my name is Bob Minner and I'm an acoustic guitarist. For 23 years I have played rhythm guitar for country music superstar Tim McGraw and I have also performed and recorded as a solo acoustic guitarist. I have recorded 4 albums with Tim McGraw - "Tim McGraw & The Dancehall Doctors", "Live Like You Were Dying", "Let It Go", and "Southern Voice". I also have one solo CD out - "There & Back & Back Again" which received critical praise from numerous music industry trade publications. I have performed throughout the United States, Canada, Australia, and Rome, Italy, as well as appearing on The Tonight Show with Jay Leno, The Late Show with David Letterman, The Grammy's, American Music Awards, CMA Awards, ACM Awards, as well as other TV shows. I have been featured in Flatpicking Guitar magazine numerous times and enjoyed a feature article in issue # 34 of the prestigious Fretboard Journal Magazine. I love playing guitar! I am married to my wife Ginger for 26 years, with two grown children, and we live in beautiful Mt. Juliet, TN with our dogs and cats.

Why This Campaign Is Important To Me

  I grew up in church, and one thing that was a constant was the old hymns. This is way before the modern "praise & worship" movement. Those old hymn melodies and lyrics are timeless. In fact, more often than not, when I am on tour on the bus or a hotel room, I always find myself playing these old hymns as a source of strength, relaxation, and taking me back to a simpler time in my life. And if you grew up in church or know someone who did, these songs will ring even truer with what I said.
  I meet thousands of fans a year on tour, and those that are familiar with my solo guitar work have been asking me for some time now to do a stripped down acoustic instrumental album of these timeless hymns. It seems these great hymns are important to a  lot of people, and I would love to honor their requests. And so here we are, about to begin a very important project to me, and one that's dear to my heart - Six String Sanctuary - The Acoustic Hymns Project.
   It will feature 13 timeless hymns performed on acoustic guitar, mandolin, tenor guitar, and resonator guitar. The song list (not in final order) is:
  • Holy, Holy, Holy
  • Blessed Assurance
  • It Is Well
  • What A friend We Have In Jesus
  • I Need Thee Every Hour
  • Power In The Blood
  • There Is A Fountain
  • Great Is Thy Faithfulness
  • Come Thou Font
  • On Christ The Solid Rock
  • 'Tis So Sweet
  • Nothing But The Blood of Jesus
  • Be Thou My Vision
    It is my desire to offer a final project of great acoustic guitar hymns played in a stripped-down manner that you can listen to as you read a morning devotional, reading scripture, praying, or just wanting music that is familiar and relaxing when you need some quiet reflective time in the morning with your coffee or after a hard day. I cannot stress how important this project is to me. It's really a big part of how I grew up. And I truly want to bless everyone who helps me reach my goal. So whether it's just for you, or a family member or friend that you think would love this project, I appreciate you taking time to stop by and visit, and any contribution is appreciated. It blesses me and I am sure this acoustic hymns project will be a blessing to you as well.

What We Need & What You Get
  So here's the details now. I am trying to raise a total of $10.000.00. This will cover recording expenses, mixing and mastering, packaging, S&H, promotion and all of the neat perks I have for everyone who particpates as my partner. No fluff, no profit, all of the funds raised in this effort go towards making this the best product it can be.
  As for perks, I have got some really cool ones I think you will dig. The T-shirts are a "limited edition design", and I think the personalized video perks (Thank you's and Happy Birthdays) will be a  real treat for those of you who choose them. There's also some Skype perks where we can chat one on one or you can take a guitar class from me. For those of you who play guitar, there's some perks with some goodies like pickups, pre ams, strings, and limited edition "Six String Sanctuary" capos from G7th Capo company. There's even a very nice guitar giveaway perk. And a couple house concert perks to boot, which I look forward to!
  As for the funding, I am confident we will hit our goal, but in the event we don't, we will still proceed with the CD project, using what we have and complete it regardless. Having said that, I truly hope you will feel moved to partner with me on this labor of love.


The Impact - Sharing and Passing It On

  This CD project is near and dear to my heart. First, it's all about how I grew up, as I am sure many of you did as well. But it's also about spreading quality, simplistic approach guitar playing to folks who want something that is easy to listen to. Whether you are familiar with the Hymns or not, I promise you'll enjoy this instrumental project.

  Having been in Nashville for 23 years and played on countless demos as well as four Tim McGraw records, I know what goes into making a great recording. I am looking forward to sharing this with you all, as well as you sharing it with your friends and family.


Other Ways You Can Help

  I have tried to set the perks at reasonable levels of contribution where you will find real value in partnering, but even if you don't decide to contribute, it would be appreciated if you would share a link to the campaign with your friends and family or Facebook. Share with your church family and pastor / worship leader as well. Every little bit helps on this journey. And be sure to check out the Indiegogo sharing tools on their page!

  And again, thanks to everyone for checking this little project out and taking it into consideration. I look forward to sharing this music with you, my partners.

Blessings!

story: Coming from the richer side of town, we still see struggle. Raised in a community where our classmates would drive to school in a Benz, while we would have to settle for public transportation. During those trials and tribulations we've learned to do enough for ourselves, at least in order to survive. But to follow our dreams, that required a stronger approach. Motivation has never been a problem and it won't start to be, but we could be doing a lot more with a little push from some funding. So PLEASE take the time to consider a donation. Everybody wants to chase their dream and hope in the process they might come across a few helping hands. Some of you ask me about my music everyday. These are the same people that can make it happen! #SupportYourLocalArtist

story: Euphoria is more than a band, it is family, a way of life, a musical tapestry of some of the best memories of our lives. During the band's 11 year tenure (1988-1999), Euphoria rocked audiences in the Carolinas with their covers of great radio rock songs, mixed with their own unique originals. There has been much interest in a reunion show, and it has been planned for many years. Now it is on the verge of reality, and we hope to make this an every two year event. In fact, the next one is already tentatively planned for Saint Patrick's Day Weekend 2017 (the band's true anniversary), then every two years thereafter! However, we need your help now! Your donations are needed to fund this reunion and help get things off the ground. One major obstacle with any event is up front funding. We need you, the Euphoria fan, the music lover, the people that followed and supported us for all of those years to help make this reunion a complete success. Your contributions will enable us to pay for t-shirts, CDs, production, musicians, advertising, and donate extra funds to charity. Musicians are traveling from as far as Oregon to perform at this event, so please donate now, and become a part of something very special! Unfortunately, the reunion cannot be funded unless our goal of $500.00 is met by 10/2/15. Please help us with your contribution and collect your reward of a t-shirt and/or a CD at the reunion on 10/30/15 AND 10/31/15 at Detours Nightclub 245 North King St, Hendersonville, North Carolina 28792. You may contact Christian Justus at: 828-277-8352 with any questions. And please do not forget to e-mail us your preferred t-shirt size, full name, and contact number to: euphoriareunion@gmail.com

story:
Welcome!

Music of Armenia is delighted to announce the launch of Yerevan Duduk Festival, an annual festival, which, for the first time, will take place in Yerevan in October 2015. 

Celebrating the beauty of this unique instrument, Yerevan Duduk Festival aims to preserve and promote the legacy of duduk and its music. Over 3 days, Yerevan Duduk Festival will bring together musicians of all backgrounds and levels of experience in an event solely dedicated to this utmost important instrument.

 

Young duduk players will have the chance to deepen their knowledge and experience of duduk and duduk playing by attending masterclasses as well as have the opportunity to attend a talk by a UNESCO representative to find out more about duduk’s history and the process of including duduk into UNESCO’s list of Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity.

During the festival, a ‘Lifetime Achievement Award’ will be given to Djivan Gasparyan for his contribution to the promotion of duduk as an Armenian instrument.

Yerevan Duduk Festival will further enhance the importance of duduk and provide a platform for local and international duduk players and the general public to learn more about the instrument and fully experience its rich and versatile music. 


The Social Impact

Yerevan Duduk Festival will become the official event, which further reinforces duduk’s significant role in the Armenian music world. Once again, we will have a chance to celebrate duduk and its contribution to the Armenian identity through its beautiful music. 


The festival is age and needs inclusive. The festival will give young Armenian musicians the opportunity to perform, participate, learn, contribute and exchange their knowledge.

This opportunity will give valuable experience to people with vision and ambition, and the life affirming effects of music and the arts will provide long lasting benefits.


Challenges

Lack of funds will mean that significant compromises will have to be made to the programming of the festival. 


How You Can Help

Music of Armenia has ambitious plans and we fully intend to deliver these by exploiting our own strengths and skills.

However, with your support, we will be able to create and deliver an engaging and interactive festival, which will offer high quality music by established and up-and-coming duduk players.

By supporting this wonderful festival, you will help us give birth to an utmost important cause, which will celebrate duduk's music and it's legacy.

To launch the festival and make it a true success, we require $13,770. We would like to ask you to kindly support us by contributing towards the budget to help us deliver the festival and cover its costs.


What You Get

  • A great feeling of knowing that you have contributed to something important.
  • Being a part of a historic event.
  • The chance to tell your grandchildren: I helped to make it happen.
  • Beautiful custom made T-shirts with Armenian musical designs. 
  • A chance to promote your company, brand, product or service for free, while supporting a significant cause. 
  • And last but not least - our immense gratitude to you for believing in us and giving duduk players the chance to celebrate their fine craft. 


Other Ways You Can Help

  • Apart from the set amounts, you can also choose to donate a different amount, just adjust the amount when making a contribution.
  • Help us spread the word about our fundraising campaign by sharing it with your contacts.
  • Like and share the festival's website and social media:  www.yerevandudukfestival.com | www.facebook.com/yerevandudukfestival

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name's Jamison. No one ever spells it or pronounces it right, so you can pretend it's whatever you want. Call me Bob if you want. Anyways, If you know anything about me, then you know I'm obviously passionate about music and want to pursue it like no other. I love writing, recording, performing and have been doing it for years now. So I felt it was time to step out of my comfort zone and actually crowd fund an EP, which I never imagined myself actually doing, but hey here we are.  

By donating, you will assist me in moving towards what I care to stay true to. You will be joining me as I take another step in the right direction of what I was meant to do. Music is what I love and it will always be that way. I get such a drive out of it. And what better way to do this than to share it with a bunch of people that want to support my goal?? I don't know, but that thought makes me happy! :D


What We Need & What You Get

We are halfway finished with the EP and need $1,000 to complete it. What you can expect from donating is to receive a free digital download of the EP a week before everyone else, and you ALSO get to see the Behind The Scenes video of us recording the EP in the studio! WHOA. NUTS. SO COOL, I KNOW! I can't wait, I'm already freaking out just typing this!


However, If we do not reach our end goal, we will still use whatever we make for the EP. It's all about the music, people.


The Impact

The importance of creating and putting this out into the world is because it's simply what we want to do: Make good music that people will appreciate and can jam out to in the car because it's THAT good. We want to pull up next to you at a stoplight and see you doing a full-body flail while blasting our new songs, because then we know we're doing our job.

By the way, I'm not using "full body flail" as an example to say I do that when I'm alone in my car or something.....uh..moving on..

Risks & Challenges

With every goal that is set to ones mind, comes challenges and risks. We're willing to step out of our comfort zones and actually start a fundraising campaign because we want to try something new - if you don't struggle then you're not growing. Consider this a risk/challenge for us. We're willing to try it though because we have a goal we want to reach.


Yes, we could fail at this, but we're going to give it a shot and do what we can anyway. After all, success is not determined by what someone cannot control. Things work out.


    Other Ways You Can Help

    Not everyone has money they can donate with, we understand! If you want to help in another way, simply share this indiegogo campaign on social media a couple times to let people know what's up, or use the Indiegogo share tools! That's always greatly appreciated. You'll get a sweet high-five perk if you do that. We'll make a cool hand shake too or something.

story:
Remember when jazz was king and a night out was something really special? For nearly a decade, Ellington's Jazz Bar & Restaurant provided that and more on a nightly basis, garnering 58 awards of excellence along the way! From the best live music and food to service and ambiance,Ellington's was unmatched and quickly became one of the most popular intimate jazz venues in the country. 

The annual New Year's Eve celebrations were legendary  and so popular that NPR did a  broadcast an hour-long, live remote of our show, in between their remotes from the Kennedy Center and Tipitina's in New Orleans!  

Praised by the New York Times, Dave Brubeck, David "Fathead " Newman (Band leader and sax player for the Ray Charles Band,) Mindi Abair and countless others, Ellington's was the place to be! Now is the time to restart our engines and get back on stage!

Ellington's was a big part of the community and the Go-To venue for a myriad  of local charities and their functions.  That remains in the Mission Statement and always will, along with Ellington's long-time commitment to the Jazz Foundation of America.

Let's reach this goal together, make more great memories and friends. Most importantly, let's keep the music alive! Jazz and Blues are such a rich and beautiful part of our nation's history . Thank you, good people, you're all very "cool cats!"

story:
Who I Am

To my local and global community, my name is Rubi and I am a Certified Massage Therapist here in Santa Cruz, CA and founder of Rising Root Wellness. Currently, Rising Root Wellness provides quality affordable massage care to marginalized residents and non-profit staff members who assist under-served communities of Santa Cruz County.

Why This Campaign?

I’m envisioning to expand my practice and multiple the accessibility of body healing services by building a tranquil mobile studio. The goal is to renovate a used school bus into a well-equipped  massage studio! The Rising Root Wellness bus will be a healing laboratory aiming to provide affordable onsite healthy touch to the under-served population of Santa Cruz County. Please donate today for your financial contribution will help manifest this project!

What I Need

Rising Root Wellness is envisioning to raise $25,000 to cover start-up costs. This amount will not only cover essential materials but also cover costs (i.e. insurance, registration, permits, fuel, etc)  for the first 6 months. Major expenses needed for this project are listed below:

  • Bus Cost: $5000-$6000
  • Maintenance + Repairs: $1500
  • Solar Panels: $1100
  • Composting Toilet: $1000
  • Sink, Stove, Fridge Combo: $700
  • Clean and grey water tanks: $400
  • Flooring: $400
  • Labor for installation: $2000
  • Vehicle Insurance + Permits: $500
  • Biodiesel Fuel (6 months): $650
  • Massage Chairs (2): $600
  • Thai Mats (2): $300
  • Perks Cost (printing, mounting, shipping): $625

What do you get?

You will get to be a part of a ground-breaking community driven to re-route and re-distribute the healing art of massage to a population that is systematically targeted and marginalized in our society. 

And physical tokens of appreciation include:

  • Original hand-painted portrait (by Rubi) of yourself or loved one
  • Mounted Prints of my series "Deities de los Muertos"

  • Handmade stickers and T-Shirts with Rising Root Logo

Any amount raised will go straight to securing a bus, buying essential materials and paying for labor installation. I will continue raising funds through raffles, selling shirts, artwork and of course through massage services.

What else can you do?

  • Post on Facebook and other social media
  • Send emails and post to networking list-serves
  • Talk to friends, in person, on the phone
  • Book a Bodywork session with Rubi @ http://risingrootwellness.fullslate.com/
  • Think of two friends or businesses who could make a big impact and write them a personal note or give them a call
  • Check back for updates

Thank you for contributing to a major vision that is dedicated to being the change!

story:
Our Campaign

Thank you for checking out this page to learn more about DEF Bananas and support our campaign.

DEF Bananas is the fresh and unorthodox group absent from Hip Hop.  We are an alternative rap trio geared towards bringing an unconventional flavor and a new genre into the mix not only for rap, but to the music industry as a whole. Though each of us differ in characteristics, we share one goal of pushing creativity whilst leaving their mark. DEF Bananas is composed of three distinct personalities: the charismatic Kam Dela Coopsta VII, the audacious GQ, and the laid back Lugo. 

Since coming together in 2009, we have been interviewed by CBS and performed at Hot 97's Mic Check Wednesdays at Drom Nightclub. We have also opened for major artists including: Jadakiss, Driicky Graham, Mike Zombie, Dizzy Wright, A$AP Ant, and SZA.

The purpose of this campaign is to fund our upcoming EP, as well as a music video for our popular single, 'Turn The Lights Down,' which has reached over 17,000 plays on Soundcloud. Creating a high-quality music video and body of work is no easy task. It is even more difficult for an artist to share content and gain noteworthy results. We have a videographer in mind, and intend to shoot the music video in May. The video release is scheduled for June. In order to amplify the success of our Turn The Lights Down single, we will need to hire a publicist to get more traction with the music video's release. 

There is a lot of work to be done, but we are up for the challenge. By contributing to this campaign, you are playing an integral role in helping DEF Bananas reach new fans, enhance the quality of our content, and make our dreams tangible. You have the power to help us become one step closer to being a household name.   

What We Need 

Our goal is to reach $5,000 in order to fund recording the EP and a music video. 

Recording the EP: $2000

  • Production: $600
  • Mastering the Songs: $1000
  • Printing CDs/Purchasing USBs: $400

Music Video: $1800

  • Location: $300
  • Equipment: $700
  • Directing/Editing: $600
  • Costumes/Props: $200

Marketing: $1200

  • Press: $800
  • Graphic Design (EP Artwork): $400

The Impact

DEF Bananas is a group of three passionate artists and we genuinely believe that their music can change the world. DEF Bananas take pride in differentiating themselves from the monotonous, often vulgar, music that you may find on the radio. With their new music, this group hopes to continue to bend the norms, while making a wide variety of music that people can relate to. DEF Bananas wants to be heard because they are strong-willed, energetic guys that wholeheartedly believe they can influence the next generation to use their time to positive difference in someone's life. 

We greatly appreciate you helping us reach this goal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love what we are doing, it would be awesome for you to share this campaign with anyone you think would be interested in supporting. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I’m Catherine Moon, I’m a singer/songwriter, bhakta, and leader of the musical group “Mystical Kirtan.”  Our goal is to transmit light and love through sound vibration.  Our vehicle is uplifting devotional music.

Mystical Kirtan is hosting this fundraiser for our first full length kirtan album, “The Bridge To Where You Are”

We’ve been receiving an overwhelmingly positive response to our music in the Northeast and decided it was time to record these original versions of ancient mantras so fans can bring the music home with them and so we can get this music out to a much wider audience.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $8,250 to create “The Bridge” and put this music out into the world

Studio Recording costs:    $2,350
Guest Musicians:    $1,850
Mixing & Mastering:    $1,500
Album Artwork Design:    $ 500
Reproduction:    $1,050
Professional music video  $1,000

 As you can see, your thoughtful contribution will be so helpful in bringing the project to fruition.  No contribution is too small.  Your help is immeasurable and we are immensely grateful. 

You can simply pre-order the CD or there are some sweet perks to explore,  including some precious acquisitions from Moon’s recent trip to India.

The Impact

Music is so powerful; it can be so evocative.  And we are of the opinion that there can never be too much uplifting music in this world.  Through our music we wish to dispel darkness, we wish to draw back the curtains and let the sunshine in. 

Through kirtan, devotional call and response chanting, we have discovered that music can be a vehicle which transports everyone who listens and participates to a state of bliss, a place of love and light, a place of healing.

Kirtan is a pathway that leads to union with the Divine.  Going deeply into the practice of chanting mantras is a bridge to connecting with our True Selves, our Higher Selves, our Sacred Selves…hence our album title “The Bridge To Where You Are.”

We’ve been delighted to discover that the music we’ve been creating has been a bridge, turning a lot of people on to kirtan who were unaware of this practice. Our approach to kirtan is unique, in part because the music itself is so accessible to western ears with its catchy danceable grooves, rock, jazz, blues, folk, and soul all shining through these songs crafted with love and devotion. 

By supporting this project, you are not only helping to get this album out there, you are making the practice of kirtan accessible to more people, you are participating in growing the Bhakti tribe, you are making the world a better place!

Risks & Challenges

This 11 song, full length album is nearly completed.  Most of the recording work is already done.   But we need your help to finish it.  With your help, this album can be released by this summer!  Without your help, it will take quite a bit longer.  We are so close!  We can see the light at the end of the tunnel growing brighter and brighter.  Please give us a little fuel so we can make it that last mile.  We promise the reward will be worth it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may not be able to contribute, even though you want to with all your heart, but that doesn't mean you can't help.  If you spread the word to anyone you think will love this music, that would be awesome!  Using the IndieGoGo share tools, especially the direct link to this page will be very helpful.

story:
About UU

http://www.undergroundunheard.com/site/

http://www.undergroundunheard.com/site/upcoming...

http://undergroundunheard.bandcamp.com/

https://www.facebook.com/undergroundunheard

https://instagram.com/uuhiphop/

https://twitter.com/UUHipHop

https://soundcloud.com/undergroundunheard

   Underground Unheard is a DIY non-profit record label based out of Western North Carolina founded by friends and fellow musicians Relik, and Bobby White almost 10 years ago. It was started with the idea that music should be from the heart and for the people.  UU members have worked and recorded with musicians such as Blueprint, DLX, Illogic, Vast Aire, Kool Keith, Sleep, Del the Funky Homosapien, Akil the MC, A-Plus, and many more.

   You might be wondering why there is no video attached to our fundraising campaign like most of the others.  Well, herein lies the purpose of the campaign.  We have gone 10 years producing great, organic music and art with little funds and even less time.  However, we have slowly gained enough support, artists, and fans that it seems time to push for more.  We take great pride in what we are able to do by cultivating strong relationships with like-minded people, treating people well, and coming together as a community to create art that makes people think, dance, and smile. 

   Our goal is to cultivate a significant online video presence on sites such as youtube to give our fans more of the content they love on a whole new platform. (By the way, we promise to turn off ALL ads on our youtube videos)

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the deal:

  • We need a DSLR Canon camera, a couple of lenses, extra batteries, extra sd cards, and a tripod, all together costing about $1,000.
  • All donations of $15 or more will be rewarded with special UU swag. Check out the "perks" section on this page to see what your donation will get you. 
  • If we reach our goal, we will give a special shout-out to all donors in a "special thanks" video. (If we don't reach the goal, we can't make the video.)
  • We will also try our best to add/follow ALL donors on their social media pages.
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, we will put the funds into an account and continue to save until we can afford the gear we need. 

The Impact

Just a couple reasons why you want to help us buy this gear:

  • We have so many great ideas just begging to come to fruition. Having a video camera will open a whole new world for us and our fans to enjoy more of the grassroots, DIY, yet professional-quality music and art we have been releasing for years.
  • We have plans to release new material several times a month, whether it be a new single, a music video, an interview, or an artist's video-profile. Having this camera will directly enable us to exponentially increase our output for everyone to enjoy. 

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks and challenges in life. That's what makes it interesting!

   One of our mantras at UU is "move forward." For 10 years we have built Underground Unheard with camaraderie, hard work, and the simple blessing of loving what we do.  We do not shy away from risk, we seek it, and we are not afraid of a challenge, we welcome it!

Other Ways You Can Help

We, as a group of young artists working day jobs for close to minimum wage, understand that sometimes, you just can't afford to do all the things you might want to do. Hence the fundraiser. Here are a couple things you can do to help OTHER THAN donating money:

  • Keep being you! :)
  • Come to a UU show
  • Share this Indiegogo campaign with your friends
  • Follow Underground Unheard on Twitter
  • Visit our websites: bandcamp page, soundcloud page ,and facebook page 

    • http://www.undergroundunheard.com/site/

    http://www.undergroundunheard.com/site/upcoming...

    http://undergroundunheard.bandcamp.com/

    https://www.facebook.com/undergroundunheard

    https://instagram.com/uuhiphop/

    https://twitter.com/UUHipHop

    https://soundcloud.com/undergroundunheard

Thank you so much for your time!

-Whokairs?

story:
We’ve got the band!
We’ve got the venue!
We’ve got the date!
Now all we need is YOU.

We've heard what you've been telling us for years, that the real magic of Mama’s Black Sheep is in the live show. So, we thought we would capture the passion and energy of a live performance both on film and audio.

We are super excited to embark on this journey with you, to create an all new multi-media experience as our next full-length release! In 2016 we’d like to bring the live concert experience right into your living room with a brand new DVD/CD 2-disc set featuring several new and previously unrecorded original songs, along with a few of our most requested cover tunes!

After discussing our venue options, we have decided to record this live concert at The Bevy in Birdtown in the Cleveland, OH Metro area. We have set the concert date for November 6th, 2015. This will be a full band show with Helen Hausmann on Violin, and Robin Elder on bass. We will be on tour that week with our dear friend singer-songwriter Christine Havrilla who will be co-billing the show. The Bevy is a beautiful and intimate space and there will only be 200 tickets available for this live concert recording event. We encourage all of our fans to come and be a part of the live audience!

Creating any new release is always an expensive and time consuming venture. Creating a video in addition to an audio CD is an extra expense. This is where we need your support. Please become a contributor today and help us turn our vision into reality!

CD is an extra expense. This is where we need your support. Please become a
contributor today and help us turn our vision into reality!

story:
Short Summary

We are Dongle.  We have been playing together for a few years and are now ready to record our debut CD.  Our objective is to write and perform great music that you can sing along to as well as relate to. We have all been musicians for several years and want to bring our style of music to YOU.  With your support, we will be able to fund the recording, producing and printing of our CD which will be titled "Sslips and Skids".


What We Need & What You Get

We need $1800 to fund the recording, producing, mastering and printing of our CD.  Everyone who donates receives some type of amazing perk.  From being mentioned on our social media to a signed guitar from our lead guitarist to even getting to sing backups on the CD.  If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still be applying 100% of these funds to the CD.


Risks & Challenges


With any creative project there are some risks and hurdles to overcome. With your support, one of the greatest hurdles will be behind us.  With that being said, we have already booked our studio time for the end of April which was a big risk to take.  Studio time in this market is hard to come by so we had to take a leap of faith.


Other Ways You Can Help


We understand that not everyone can contribute financially and we understand that for sure.  If you can contribute even a dollar it helps, but if not, you can help us by getting the word out about this campaign.  There are share tools here on the Indiegogo site that you can share this with your network of friends

story:
Hello one and all!

For as long as I can remember, I have been singing.  Whether it was on the family farm for the cows or or audiences world-wide, singing has been a huge part of my life.  Recently, I've been approached by a number of people asking if I have an album or recording.  Sadly, I had to say, "no, I do not."   My goal is to change that answer into a resounding, "yes, I sure do!"  
Those of you who don't know me will quickly come to realize why I want my first album to be of the musical theater variety. Those of you who do know me know that my first love is musical theater. I selected a number of musical theater songs for this album which I believe compliment my voice. I selected from Les Miserables, Phantom of the Opera, and a surprise opera aria.
But to hear the surprise, along with my other favorites, I need to raise $2,500. This will help cover the cost of recording, mastering, printing and paying for the rights of the material I chose for my album.
So there it is.  My dreams of a new album and an opportunity to reach new audiences. All I need now is a little help and support from you.  Every little bit counts and I hope you can be a part of this new adventure. Even if you don't have the funds to help my campaign, please share this page with your friends, family, and fellow music lovers.
Thank you so much!
Sincerely,
David Nevin

story:
OUR STORY

Charlie Overbey has been a staple in the Los Angeles music scene since the early 90’s.

At the tail end of the Sunset Strip’s heyday – and after his time with Big Bang Babies – Charlie drifted back to his punk rock roots and joined cowpunk band Custom Made Scare. They recorded their debut album with Side One Dummy Records, which came out immediately following a vacation in federal prison. Charlie later played with Deadbolt and then formed Charlie And The Valentine Killers, who toured with the likes of David Alan Coe, and The Supersuckers.

After sobering up, Charlie wrote what would become the Broken Arrows first EP –The California Kid. The self-produced record was mixed by Grammy Award-winner Ted Hutt (Old Crow Medicine Show, Gaslight Anthem, Chuck Ragan, Dropkick Murphys and more), and Paul Kilmister (who happens to be the son of Lemmy.) Heavy hitters such as Zander Schloss, Steve Soto, Colleen Duffy, Jonah Smith, Jake Margolis and Ted Russell Kamp also contributed to the recording of the album.

Once the EP was in the can, Charlie carefully constructed a band of music veterans and longtime friends that he had always wanted to play with. This Band of Brothers includes guitarist Jimmy James of The Hangmen, lead man Dave James of The Superbees, pedal steel player Jordan Shapiro of The Supersuckers, bassist Joe Ginsberg of Chuck Ragan, and a new arrival to Cali from Rhode Island, drummer Charlie Nicienski. Bassist Terry Love and pedal steel player Steeler J.C August have also stepped in to help out with the touring and sometimes conflicting schedules. 

THE PROJECT 

The band is currently on tour and will soon roll straight into pre-production with producer Ted Hutt for the full-length LP recording.  That's where YOU come in – Charlie's written several songs and he and the boys are ready to record. They want to give you - fans, friends, and family- a chance to be a part of the project. 

HOW YOU CAN GET INVOLVED

There are some amazing perks to to incentivize you to contribute. You are making this album possible, and you deserve to be rewarded! 

If you can't donate, please help spread the word and share this campaign. Tell your friends through Facebook, Twitter, and email.

Please follow us on social media, and look for frequent updates throught the campaign: 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/charlieoverbeyandthebrokenarrows
Twitter: @charlieoverbey https://twitter.com/charlieoverbey
Instagram: @charlieoverbey https://instagram.com/charlieoverbey
www. charlieoverbey.com

THANK YOU!
Without your help this would simply not be possible!

story:
What we do . . . 

The Atken Armenian Foundation's mission is to provide quality music education to music talents we find through our choir programs in the regions of Armenia.

Why you should help . . .

  • The AAF is one of the most cost-efficient aid programs in Armenia today 
  • All  your donated funds go directly towards the projects with no overhead
  • Using infrastructure left behind by the Soviet era, we are changing communities and providing music training to top talents in the regions of Armenia
  • You will have made a contribution to the advancement of Armenian talent in the regions of Armenia; talents that will tomorrow represent our nation
  • You will change lives and the future of music in Armenia 
  • We guarantee the quality of education thanks to the expertise of board members who are internationaly respected musicians
  • No hype, just quality results and integrity


Get more detailed information on us by following this link:

 http://freepdfhosting.com/02b9e361fa.pdf


Will you stand together with us and local partners, for the children, the young professionals, and the dedicated pedagogues of Armenia?




For Canadian's: All donations above 20$ will receive a tax receipt. Just make sure we have your correct name and address!

story:
We are Rise Up Georgia:  

We are youth, people of color, LGBTQ folks and other marginalized communities fighting on the front-lines of crisis in Georgia. 

Our goal is to build power in the South by mobilizing people around the issues that impact their lives. We live at the intersection of culture and politics, by combining grassroots organizing, voting, and civic engagement, with art, music, and creative direct action. We believe that our state is stronger when all of us have the right to dignity at home, at the workplace, and in our communities.

Rise Up started as a small idea with BIG ambitions.

October marks one year since our launch, and to celebrate we want to transform our office space into a cultural and political hub for social justice organizing and leadership development, called Rise Up Studio. That’s why we need you.


What is Rise Up Studio?

On the surface Rise Up Studio is an open space where we can bring the community together, to learn, educate, and host cultural events.

At it's heart, Rise Up Studio is much more. 

We believe that our space can spark a broader movement for social justice in Atlanta, therefore changing the political landscape for our city and our state. As a cultural and political movement center located in Southwest Atlanta, Rise Up Studio lies in the center of two cities-- one that is rich in history and a deeply rooted devotion to justice for all, and another that is increasingly becoming inaccessible to all but the wealthiest amongst us. Being able to create a space for folks to come together and build resistance is crucial to maintaining the culture that makes Atlanta what it is.

Rise Up Studio will include:

  • A safe space to come together to strategize, hold meetings, and plan
  • We want to run deep and engaging trainings, workshops and community skill shares that enable a new bench of leaders to Rise Up in ATL. 
  • We fundamentally believe in RADICAL PLAY! Rise Up Studio is the perfect space to host movement and community programming and art shows. 
  • A studio launch party: Nothing will kick-off our space then a party! We will celebrate a year of being an established organization with a party that will highlight local artists and activists we've worked with over the last year


What We Need:

To make Rise Up Studios sustainable and fully functional we need support with: 

  • $25,000 for Space: being able to have space that we make our own takes a lot. This will help us pay the bills, and put some work into building Rise Up Studio.

  • $5,000 for Supplies: art and creative direct actions drive much of our work, and allow for a new generation of leaders to get plugged into social justice work. This will cover the cost of supplies, from paint and canvasses, to tripods and flags.

  • $5,000 for Leadership Development Programming: trainings, workshops and community events: To offset the cost of public programming for us for two years.


When You Donate, You Get Perks!:

We love giving our supporters some perks! Check out the fantastic perks below: 



Other Ways You Can Help

From giving $20-$500 we could use your help. Don't worry though there is a level of involvement for everyone at Rise Up Studio, here are other ways you can get involved: 

1. Tell your friends, family and neighbors, a personal ask always gets more people involved!  

2. Tweet this: Join @RiseUpGeorgia and build a political movement hub in ATL #RiseUpStudio http://igg.me/at/riseupstudio

3. Or this: Support @RiseUpGeorgia dream of building a cultural and political movement center http://igg.me/at/riseupstudio #RiseUpStudio

4. Share this page on Twitter and Facebook with the indiegogo share tool. 


Contact Us: 

If you want to get more involved with Rise Up*, sign up as a member and find out what we are up to please visit www.riseupga.org or email info@riseupga.org. 
*Rise Up Georgia is a registered 501(c)4 non-profit organization.

story:
Hello, Opera and Music Lovers of Boston!

Welcome to the indiegogo page for Opera Brittenica's Third Season! Opera Brittenica is undergoing some impressive changes, that we would like to share with you. 

Firstly, we would like to announce that while our residency in Cambridge at St. Peter's Episcopal Church remains, we are thrilled to be simultaneusly in residency with the First Parish of Dorchester. As Opera Brittenica believes that opera should not be socio-economically divided, we are so excited to bring these high-level performances to the drastically underserved neighborhood of Dorchester, in a gorgeous venue such as First Parish. As such, every production that we will produce will be able to be seen in both Cambridge or Dorchester! We so look forward to expanding our reach, and hope to create new music lovers from the partnership!

Secondly, we have decided that while our focus will be primarily unchanged in our presentation of the works of Benjamin Britten, we would be remiss if we did not acknowledge the influence that Britten had on subsequent composers and setters of the english language. To that end, we are expanding our scope to include all composers who composed works in english as the original language from 1913 forward. 

Subsequent seasons could see works by Adamo, Weill, Picker, Bolcom, even Sondheim and Bernstein, or workshopped new works by emerging composers!

In beginning this trend, we would like to announce the first production of 2015-2016 is a very famous work of one of Britten's Brooklyn roommates, Gian Carlo Menotti's Amahl and the Night Visitors. 

This story follows the three wisemen who are on their way to pay their respects to the newborn baby Jesus, who stop at a small house where a poor mother and her aflicted son live. The production is about an hour long, and was the first televised opera. The production will be staged at both St. Peter's Episcopal Church in Cambridge (December 11, 2015), as well as First Parish of Dorchester. (December 12, 2015)

Secondly, in February, we are thrilled to welcome back incredible NYC based harpist, Kathryn Sloat, to Boston, to play the solo harp music of Britten's, as well as some folksong settings and "A Birthday Hansel." - February 5-6, 2016

And Lastly, in April, we are AT LONG LAST planning a performance of two of Britten's most well-loved vocal orchestral works featuring some of Boston's finest musicians playing "Les Illuminations," and "Serenade for Tenor, Horn, and Strings." This will be a rare opportunity to hear these pieces done as chamber music in an intimate setting!


As you can see, with the productions slated of:

Gian Carlo Menotti's "Amahl and the Night Visitors" - December 11-12, 2015
Britten Plays the Harp (Featuring Kate Sloat, Harp) - February 5-6, 2016
Les Illuminations & Serenade for Tenor Horn and Strings - April 8-9, 2016

this is poised to be yet another terrifically ambitious year for Opera Brittenica! 



In the 2013-2014 year, we were incredibly fortunate to have had many patrons support us financially, and many extraordinarily talented artists donate their time and talent, as a contribution and investment in the belief of the mission and direction of OB; all of which is necessary to present works of this scale to the public. 

However, as we value the education and experience of our artists, we are hoping to not rely on the generosity of these performers, and intend to compensate them for their tireless effort in making OB a formidable entity in the Boston music scene. 

We are extremely happy to announce that as of 2014-15, all of our artists who participated in the creation of Opera Brittenica's productions were monetarily compensated for their participation! 


Unfortunately, it doesn't stop here! We need YOU, and other generous souls like you, to help us to prove that Opera isn't dead, and that artists are valuable cultural assets! Producing an opera requires much more funding than you would expect, not to mention providing compensation for the talented artists who dedicate their lives and time to these projects. Here is a small list of fundraising issues that we, and every other company face:

  • Rights & Rentals: Because Benjamin Britten passed away in the 1970s, his material is not yet in the public domain, unlike that of Puccini or Handel. As such, we must request permission from the publishing company.  This includes rental for orchestral parts and principal scores. Depending on seating and ticket prices, this could range from $1,000-$5,000 per production.
  • Percussion Rental: As Britten was considerably adventurous in his orchestration for percussion, many of his compositions call for the use of unusual or a vast amount of instruments. Most percussionists do not own their own large equipment, thus requiring the rental of such equipment, often costing upwards of $500-$1,000 depending on the repertoire.
  • Venue: Fortunately, Opera Brittenica has a reputation for producing edgy and still quality works, in unusual locations, so most concerts are housed churches and museums in the Boston area, however, we will need to donate some percentage of revenue to the church, as well as the rental of any theatre that is used for staged work. 
  • Production/Marketing: We would love to be able to market to a wider audience, but this costs money as well. The printing of programs, posters, flyers, website hosting, business cards, etc. are expenses that may vary widely from production to production. Looking at the past few years' figures, we have come to expect somewhere in the range of $1,000-$1,500 for the season's publicity in printing and publicity. 

However, while this seems like an impossibility and a huge sum of money that we are asking for, ALL CONTRIBUTIONS TO THIS CAMPAIGN ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE! As it is, Opera Brittenica is fiscally sponsored under Fractured Atlas, an umbrella organization that accepts donations and distributes them to the projects that are being donated to. Donations of any size are accepted, and only a letter of donation is requested if over $1,000 will be given. 

In addition, we are currently seeking dedicated members of the avant-garde opera-loving community to join in the creation of the board of directors for Opera Brittenica. If this interests you, please contact Joshua Collier to discuss details. 

                                        

We do, however, completely understand if you are not in a financial position to support us with a monetary donation, but there are myriad other ways that you can help Opera Brittenica in it's everyday activities! Below are some other ways that you can support us!

*Artist Housing - As we are determined to bring the best performance possible to our community, and as talented as our locals are, occasionally, it is necessary that we have a performer come from out of town. This artist would need a place to stay for the performance rehearsals, and performances, and could transition from being an incredible artist, to a life-long friend! Please contact us if you have a bedroom/bathroom within the Boston Metro area (T accessible) that you would be willing to donate to OB!

*Ushers - We always need ushers to help with the box office, and showing guests to their seats! Not only do you act as an ambassador for OB, but you would receive a free opportunity to see the show!

*Marketing assistance - We are fortunate to have the amount of followers that we have, but alas, we cannot know everyone in Boston (Try as we might!) Any opportunity for you to spread the word to your circle of friends and families is more than welcome.

*Sets, Costumes, Props - While we have designers and artists that create the visual elements of the performed works, occasionally we are in search of a specific couch, or lumber, or decorative art work. If seeing your belongings on stage interests you, please get in touch for when Prop lists and set plots are sent out, and maybe that setee that you have in your basement will be able to have a plaque that stated that "Famous Performer" sat here in OB's Production of...

You see, while cold hard cash definitely helps, it's not everything! We welcome any assistance that you can give. If you have any other suggestion, please feel free to call us at any time!   

                                        

Thank you so much, Boston, for your support of our musical/theatrical/operatic vision. We look forward to continuing to produce the high calibre productions as you have come to know from OB, and thank you in advance for doing all that you can to keep this incredible art alive in our beautiful city! 

Sincerely, 

Joshua Collier, Artistic Director, Opera Brittenica

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Photos Courtesy of Christopher Weigel

"The Turn of the Screw" - Tamara Ryan, Tami Papagiannopolous, Garry McLinn

Artists of Opera Brittenica 2013-2015:

Jonathan Price,Amal El-Shrafi, Aliana de la Guardia, Sophie Michaux, Erika Mitchell, RaShaun Campbell, Gyasi Barber, Zachary Ballard, Colin Levin, Adrian Rosales, Emily Thorner, Katelyn Parker Bray, Alexandra Dietrich, Stephanie Benkert, Caitlin Hadeler, Kathryn Noonan, Erin Merceruio Nelson, Elena Jarlson, Amanda Sindel-Keswick, Patrick Dailey, Adrian Jones, Ryan Casperson, Anthony Garza, Robert Honeysucker, Marcos Vigil, Ian Pomerantz, Joshua Collier, Michael Merullo, Roland Mills, Jonathan Oakes, Nathan Rodriguez, Ben Henry-Moreland, Asha Grace Carroll - Donald Teeters, Geoffrey Pope, Tyler Turner, Erin Huelskamp, Giselle Ty, Anita Shriver, Kristen Connolly, Elizabeth Stone, Christopher Bocchiaro, Juliana Beecher,Isabella Lamadriz, Tami Papagiannopoulos, Rebecca Teeters, Allison Provaire, Tamara Ryan, Katie O'Reilly, Garry McLinn, Deanna Tisdale, Stephanie Kreutz, Roxanna Myhrum, Marnen Laibow Koser, Kristen Connoly, Andrew Sheranian, Bryan Pollock OB4TET: Olga Patramanskaya, Luke Krafka, Ryan Shannon, Drew Ricciardi,

As such, every production that we will produce will be able to be seen in both Cambridge or Dorchester! We so look forward to expanding our reach, and hope to create new music lovers from the partnership!Secondly, we have decided that while our focus will be primarily unchanged in our presentation of the works of Benjamin Britten, we would be remiss if we did not acknowledge the influence that Britten had on subsequent composers and setters of the english language. To that end, we are expanding our scope to include all composers who composed works in english as the original language from 1913 forward. Subsequent seasons could see works by Adamo, Weill, Picker, Bolcom, even Sondheim and Bernstein, or workshopped new works by emerging composers!In beginning this trend, we would like to announce the first production of 2015-2016 is a very famous work of one of Britten's Brooklyn roommates, Gian Carlo Menotti's Amahl and the Night Visitors. 

This story follows the three wisemen who are on their way to pay their respects to the newborn baby Jesus, who stop at a small house where a poor mother and her aflicted son live. The production is about an hour long, and was the first televised opera. The production will be staged at both St. Peter's Episcopal Church in Cambridge (December 11, 2015), as well as First Parish of Dorchester. (December 12, 2015)


Secondly, in February, we are thrilled to welcome back incredible NYC based harpist, Kathryn Sloat, to Boston, to play the solo harp music of Britten's, as well as some folksong settings and "A Birthday Hansel." - February 5-6, 2016
And Lastly, in April, we are AT LONG LAST planning a performance of two of Britten's most well-loved vocal orchestral works featuring some of Boston's finest musicians playing "Les Illuminations," and "Serenade for Tenor, Horn, and Strings." This will be a rare opportunity to hear these pieces done as chamber music in an intimate setting!
As you can see, with the productions slated of:Gian Carlo Menotti's "Amahl and the Night Visitors" - December 11-12, 2015


Britten Plays the Harp (Featuring Kate Sloat, Harp) - February 5-6, 2016
Les Illuminations & Serenade for Tenor Horn and Strings - April 8-9, 2016

this is poised to be yet another terrifically ambitious year for Opera Brittenica! 

In the 2013-2014 year, we were incredibly fortunate to have had many patrons support us financially, and many extraordinarily talented artists donate their time and talent, as a contribution and investment in the belief of the mission and direction of OB; all of which is necessary to present works of this scale to the public. 
However, as we value the education and experience of our artists, we are hoping to not rely on the generosity of these performers, and intend to compensate them for their tireless effort in making OB a formidable entity in the Boston music scene. 
We are extremely happy to announce that as of 2014-15, all of our artists who participated in the creation of Opera Brittenica's productions were monetarily compensated for their participation! 
Unfortunately, it doesn't stop here! We need YOU, and other generous souls like you, to help us to prove that Opera isn't dead, and that artists are valuable cultural assets! Producing an opera requires much more funding than you would expect, not to mention providing compensation for the talented artists who dedicate their lives and time to these projects. Here is a small list of fundraising issues that we, and every other company face:


Rights & Rentals: Because Benjamin Britten passed away in the 1970s, his material is not yet in the public domain, unlike that of Puccini or Handel. As such, we must request permission from the publishing company.  This includes rental for orchestral parts and principal scores. Depending on seating and ticket prices, this could range from $1,000-$5,000 per production.


Percussion Rental: As Britten was considerably adventurous in his orchestration for percussion, many of his compositions call for the use of unusual or a vast amount of instruments. Most percussionists do not own their own large equipment, thus requiring the rental of such equipment, often costing upwards of $500-$1,000 depending on the repertoire.

Venue: Fortunately, Opera Brittenica has a reputation for producing edgy and still quality works, in unusual locations, so most concerts are housed churches and museums in the Boston area, however, we will need to donate some percentage of revenue to the church, as well as the rental of any theatre that is used for staged work. 

Production/Marketing: We would love to be able to market to a wider audience, but this costs money as well. The printing of programs, posters, flyers, website hosting, business cards, etc. are expenses that may vary widely from production to production. Looking at the past few years' figures, we have come to expect somewhere in the range of $1,000-$1,500 for the season's publicity in printing and publicity. 

However, while this seems like an impossibility and a huge sum of money that we are asking for, ALL CONTRIBUTIONS TO THIS CAMPAIGN ARE TAX DEDUCTIBLE! As it is, Opera Brittenica is fiscally sponsored under Fractured Atlas, an umbrella organization that accepts donations and distributes them to the projects that are being donated to. Donations of any size are accepted, and only a letter of donation is requested if over $1,000 will be given. In addition, we are currently seeking dedicated members of the avant-garde opera-loving community to join in the creation of the board of directors for Opera Brittenica. If this interests you, please contact Joshua Collier to discuss details.                                         
We do, however, completely understand if you are not in a financial position to support us with a monetary donation, but there are myriad other ways that you can help Opera Brittenica in it's everyday activities! Below are some other ways that you can support us!
*Artist Housing - As we are determined to bring the best performance possible to our community, and as talented as our locals are, occasionally, it is necessary that we have a performer come from out of town. This artist would need a place to stay for the performance rehearsals, and performances, and could transition from being an incredible artist, to a life-long friend! Please contact us if you have a bedroom/bathroom within the Boston Metro area (T accessible) that you would be willing to donate to OB!
*Ushers - We always need ushers to help with the box office, and showing guests to their seats! Not only do you act as an ambassador for OB, but you would receive a free opportunity to see the show!
*Marketing assistance - We are fortunate to have the amount of followers that we have, but alas, we cannot know everyone in Boston (Try as we might!) Any opportunity for you to spread the word to your circle of friends and families is more than welcome.
*Sets, Costumes, Props - While we have designers and artists that create the visual elements of the performed works, occasionally we are in search of a specific couch, or lumber, or decorative art work. If seeing your belongings on stage interests you, please get in touch for when Prop lists and set plots are sent out, and maybe that setee that you have in your basement will be able to have a plaque that stated that "Famous Performer" sat here in OB's Production of...
You see, while cold hard cash definitely helps, it's not everything! We welcome any assistance that you can give. If you have any other suggestion, please feel free to call us at any time!                                           
Thank you so much, Boston, for your support of our musical/theatrical/operatic vision. We look forward to continuing to produce the high calibre productions as you have come to know from OB, and thank you in advance for doing all that you can to keep this incredible art alive in our beautiful city! 
Sincerely, 
Joshua Collier, Artistic Director, Opera Brittenica
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Photos Courtesy of Christopher Weigel"The Turn of the Screw" - Tamara Ryan, Tami Papagiannopolous, Garry McLinnArtists of Opera Brittenica 2013-2015:
Jonathan Price,Amal El-Shrafi, Aliana de la Guardia, Sophie Michaux, Erika Mitchell, RaShaun Campbell, Gyasi Barber, Zachary Ballard, Colin Levin, Adrian Rosales, Emily Thorner, Katelyn Parker Bray, Alexandra Dietrich, Stephanie Benkert, Caitlin Hadeler, Kathryn Noonan, Erin Merceruio Nelson, Elena Jarlson, Amanda Sindel-Keswick, Patrick Dailey, Adrian Jones, Ryan Casperson, Anthony Garza, Robert Honeysucker, Marcos Vigil, Ian Pomerantz, Joshua Collier, Michael Merullo, Roland Mills, Jonathan Oakes, Nathan Rodriguez, Ben Henry-Moreland, Asha Grace Carroll - Donald Teeters, Geoffrey Pope, Tyler Turner, Erin Huelskamp, Giselle Ty, Anita Shriver, Kristen Connolly, Elizabeth Stone, Christopher Bocchiaro, Juliana Beecher,Isabella Lamadriz, Tami Papagiannopoulos, Rebecca Teeters, Allison Provaire, Tamara Ryan, Katie O'Reilly, Garry McLinn, Deanna Tisdale, Stephanie Kreutz, Roxanna Myhrum, Marnen Laibow Koser, Kristen Connoly, Andrew Sheranian, Bryan Pollock OB4TET: Olga Patramanskaya, Luke Krafka, Ryan Shannon, Drew Ricciardi,

story:
Project Summary


Hello and welcome!

My name is Beth Marie Anderson and I am a multi award nominated Singer/Songwriter from British Columbia!  I come from a small town on the West Coast of Canada and am so excited to share my project and vision with you today!  

  • Biography 

    Beth has had several of her songs recorded by artists all over North America, including Grand Ole Opry Performer Sherry Lynn, and has had song holds with major label artists including LeAnn Rimes, Sarah Evans, Pam Tillis and others.  Beth has recorded two albums in Nashville and was nominated for multiple awards in B.C including “Song of The Year” at the Vancouver Island Music Awards and in the U.S, “Female Vocalist Of The Year” at the 2nd Annual Barebones Music Awards. Beth has shared the stage with Canadian Superstars such as Carolyn Dawn Johnson, Johnny Reid, Michelle Wright, Patricia Conroy, Trooper, Jessie Farrell, and hit songwriter Roger Cook.  Beth was selected as the only Canadian Emerging Artist at Nashville’s 2013 CMA Fan Fair in June, and has performed at many prestigious venues including the legendary Bluebird Café.  In 2014 Beth was selected as a Finalist in the ‘NewSong International Songwriting Competition’, beating out thousands of Artists all around the world for 1 of the 10 spots.  This year Beth is excited to have the lead Radio Single of Canadian Artist Alessia Cohle, was picked as an Artist for the 2015 CMA Fan Fair in Nashville again this June,  Beth's songs being placed on Music Compilations, and a Christmas Album and tour in the works for this winter.  

  • My Campaign 
    I have been working on this new EP for a while, and I am so excited that we are almost done!!  I have recorded 5 songs for this project, each of them with their own story behind them.  My first Album was all about Journey and finding my way, my second Album was very much about my growth in songwriting and being a little sassy, and this third Album is a little more about Love.  

    Recording Music is a dream come true - being able to share with you all my heart through song is such a blessing, thank you for being so supportive!  Here is a bit of information on the songs we are recording:

    - Be Brave -
    This song was written about depression, bullying, anxiety, anything that makes you feel like you can't make it through the day or that you aren't good enough.  This song is me saying be brave! be courageous! be strong! YOU can do this.  Ironically about 1 year after writing this, Sarah Bareilles came out with her song 'Brave' but I decided I loved this song too much to keep it on a shelf.  

    - Bad At Goodbye -
    I wrote this song with one of my good friends, Bill DiLuigi!  We all hate saying goodbye - if it's for a day, a week, a month or forever - That idea turned into a song all about that feeling of longing or missing your other half when they go and how 'hello' is so much easier. 

    - Why Me -
    This is one of my favourite stripped down songs I do! This song is all about not being able to believe how lucky you are to be with the one you love. Sometimes I find myself asking, Why did you pick me?  :) 

    - Let Me Be -
    This song is about wanting to be "the one" for someone who maybe hasn't seen you in a romantic way.  At the time I wrote this, I was helping a guy friend get over his relationship and piece his heart back together while silently wishing he would see that I could be the one he was looking for.

    - Go Slow -
    This is one of my favourite songs to sing live.  It's about getting lost inside a single moment and not being able to tear yourself away from someone and saying 'goodnight' a million times because you honestly can't stand to see them go.  If they have to go, you'd rather them Go Slow :)
  • You make ALL the difference!
    As an independent artist, I fund my career myself by working a job or two as well as writing, performing and teaching.  I have recorded all the music for these tracks and now I need to finish recording overdubs, we have to mix, master, create art work, manufacture and distribute the album.  With your help I can finish this project and be able to share my music, while giving you unique perks/rewards for helping to make this vision a reality!

What I Need & What You Get

  • I have already spent $5,000 on renting the Studio, paying the Session Players, Engineer, Producer, and other speciality musicians to create these 5 tracks and I couldn't be more excited about how they are sounding! 

    I am asking for $3,128 to help complete this project.  The total I need is really $4,528, but am planning on paying for the rest myself the best I can.  Here is a Breakdown of what I need, and where the money is going! 

  •  $2,500 For Mixing and Mastering all 5 songs
  • $500 To create and complete Art Work and CD Design 
  • $1,000 To manufacture, ship, and distribute the Album 
  • $200 To pay for studio time to finish vocal tracking
  • $200 To pay for fiddle and guitar overdubs
  • $128 To pay for the %.04 percentage Indiegogo takes if my Campaign is Successful

    PERKS!!
  • Some of my smaller perks include a thank you email, a signed copy of the new EP, or a few of the following perks combined:  a signed copy of the new EP, a T-Shirt, earrings, signed copies of my previous two albums, a skype or phone call, and more.

  • If you have a little more to spend, I have put together awesome packages that include most of the above merchandise, and your name in the liner notes, a few singing lessons via skype, a memory book of behind the scene pictures, lyrics, quotes and more (only 5 ever made), a 30 minute skype chat, hand written lyrics and much more
  •  Write a song with me via skype (3-4 hours) and I will demo it, hand written lyrics on a journal I pick out for you, send you lots of BMA Swag including the new EP signed, your name on the liner notes, and more.
  •  My largest perk is I will drive/fly to you, we'll write a song in person and make a demo, then I will cook you dinner and we can chat about whatever you want to know or learn about the music industry or me! After you can invite your friends over for an intimate house concert and I will play a 60-90 minute show for you and tell stories that are behind the songs I've written. 
  • If I don't make my goal, I will still use the funds towards this project, however I may have to cut out the extra instruments, have to pay the indiegogo fee out of pocket, manufacture less albums and possibly pick up a 2nd job depending on how much money I am short. 

The Impact

  • Your contribution is essential to help this project move forward.  Without raising this money, these 5 songs will remain unfinished and never get put out into the world.  A few months ago I came to the realization that without doing crowd fundraising or finding sponsors/backers for my music, I wouldn't be able to record music anymore.  YOU are so appreciated. 
  • I am so excited about this project, because I get to have the chance to connect with you and be involved together in creating something amazing.  I am really excited about possibly writing songs together, chatting on skype, flying to see you, and just being able to connect on a larger level than just online!  
  • 'Be Brave' I plan on using for school visits to inspire kids, and have already been approached by multiple charities to use it as their theme song! (And that was just the iphone version!)  'Go Slow' and 'Why Me' I was told were hit songs by a multi grammy winning hit writer.  By contributing to my project you are not only helping me finish these songs, but also allowing me the opportunity to not be so in debt that I can pitch these songs to people and hope that an established Artist will record it! 

  • I have successfully recorded and released two albums independently - funded by myself, local investors, a small indiegogo campaign and silent investors.  I am very confident that you will enjoy your perks, the EP, but most of all that you will be proud to have invested in me and my career.     
  • I plan on using any revenue gained from the sales of this EP over the summer and fall to help fund my Christmas Album, set to start recording mid September 2015.

Risks & Challenges

  • Some of the challenges I face are; after getting back to Canada Mid-July, I have to finish the artwork, approve the mixes, and pay my music expenses/bills from coming home from Nashville.  
  • I had to quit my job to be able to come to CMA Fan Fair and be an Artist Exhibitor (meet & greets) so a challenge will be paying for these expenses to finish the EP while trying to raise money to pay my own "life" bills.
  • I am the daughter of an accountant, and I am a planner.  I always find a way to raise money and pay all my bills because I think outside the box
  • I plan on doing house concerts, selling my earrings, teaching, doing a garage sale, finding more local investors, and possibly getting a job or two.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't help or your pocket book is short - no worries - I understand and am there with you on a monthly basis.  Sharing this campaign and spreading the word is an AMAZING contribution to my project.  I appreciate you.
  • Feel free to share the link, or use the Indiegogo share tools! 
  • Feel free to contact me if you have any questions.

story:
Dear Friends, I have had the privilege of being invited to participate in Carifesta XII, 2015 which is being hosted by Haiti!
This is a Caribbean and Latin American based festival which showcases different cultures through visual arts, cuisine, folklore and music. This event is all about the arts. This year, as I am the only representative for The Spice Isle of the West Indies, PURE Grenada, I sincerely ask for your support as I embark on this new venture in which I will showcase Grenada's Diversity in music on this  large Caribbean platform. My goal is to distinctively showcase the flavors of the spice Island through my music. The Lotus Blossoms :  www.soundcloud/radnation - I live the truth of the universe. I am a passionate artist, free thinker, lover, writer, friend, musical pioneer & older sister. I truly believe the best is yet to come and wait, with bated breath, to see what it may hold.  https://instagram.com/imtamz_/
 I will be grateful for all the contributions I can get.  I need YOUR help! to make this happen. Thank you for your consideration.
 https://m.facebook.com/carifesta
