story:
THE STREET
Egyptian Music for freedom  - Support Radio Midan Season 2
“Calling for equity, dignity, justice, and freedom ... everywhere!”
“Always standing up for justice”

After we made Twenty-two song during 2014
We'll produce ten new songs to be together - The street album

The Street
Welcome and thank you for visiting our Indiegogo campaign page! Radio Midan has been on the leading front of producing inspirational classical and modern Arabic music, filled with fascinating revolutionary beats.
The first  album of #RadioMidan “Al-share’a – The STREET” is brought to you by the talented makers of the Egyptian revolution classics.
We are very excited about “The Street” which brings to your headphones ten new Arabic songs, compiled with an upbeat spirit of calling people around the world; to stand up for justice, dignity, and freedom and to work together against all forms of injustice.

Dear Friends
This campaign is very important to us; as it will help us continue being the voice of the youth in Egypt and all arab countries, as well as, all the free men and women around the globe. We offer a unique blend of Eastern tunes, Arabic music, and modern beats that respect the cultural, social, and ethical common foundations.
We hope that our music helps build bridges between individuals and groups around the world, and offer high-quality inspiration to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.

Your support means a lot to us. Your generous contributions allow us as musical artists to collaborate with audio and video production specialists; in order to create musical and visual masterpieces.

Homa Meen - Our last song Abril 2015

About this Campaign
Our target in this campaign is to raise $55,000; this should cover the production costs of the album, including the audio, video, and graphic design requirements; for the development of a professional and entertaining album.
The lyrics And the musical melodies of the ten songs have already been written and contracts with the singers have been signed.
The album will contain ten songs, with lyrical styles suit different segments of the audience .

Radio Midan Team
Connect with us through our different pages on:
Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/radiomidan
Youtube : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6ss9CreDZWY&amp...
Twitter : https://twitter.com/radiomidan
And visit our official webpage :
www.radiomidan.com
And our webpage For talent competitions :
http://radiomidan.com/vote

Radio Midan has been on the leading front of producing inspirational classical and modern Arabic music, filled with fascinating revolutionary beats.The first  album of #RadioMidan “Al-share’a – The STREET” is brought to you by the talented makers of the Egyptian revolution classics.We are very excited about “The Street” which brings to your headphones ten new Arabic songs, compiled with an upbeat spirit of calling people around the world; to stand up for justice, dignity, and freedom and to work together against all forms of injustice.Dear FriendsThis campaign is very important to us; as it will help us continue being the voice of the youth in Egypt and all arab countries, as well as, all the free men and women around the globe. We offer a unique blend of Eastern tunes, Arabic music, and modern beats that respect the cultural, social, and ethical common foundations. We hope that our music helps build bridges between individuals and groups around the world, and offer high-quality inspiration to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.Your support means a lot to us. Your generous contributions allow us as musical artists to collaborate with audio and video production specialists; in order to create musical and visual masterpieces.Homa Meen - Our last song Abril 2015About this CampaignOur target in this campaign is to raise $55,000; this should cover the production costs of the album, including the audio, video, and graphic design requirements; for the development of a professional and entertaining album.The lyrics And the musical melodies of the ten songs have already been written and contracts with the singers have been signed.The album will contain ten songs, with lyrical styles suit different segments of the audience .Radio Midan TeamConnect with us through our different pages on:Facebook : https://www.facebook.com/radiomidanYoutube : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6ss9CreDZWY&amp...Twitter : https://twitter.com/radiomidan And visit our official webpage :www.radiomidan.comAnd our webpage For talent competitions : http://radiomidan.com/vote

story:
What is Lubith?

Lubith is an application that helps you to create and customise WordPress themes for your website without the need to write a single line of code. Everything is done from a visual, drag and drop interface. 

www.lubith.com

Lubith came to life because of my desire to optimise my work as a web developer. I wanted to find a faster way to create layouts for web sites. I had a browse for solutions on the internet but the instruments I found were not good enough. On these grounds I decided to spend some time in creating Lubith’s first version.

From the beginning we wanted to make this tool available for everyone, 99% of our users are using the application for free.


Why do we need your help?

Few years ago, we've launched a first version of Lubith. Our users got very enthusiastic about it but soon they started to ask for more features. We've read our users' feedback and started to work on a new version.

In order to include all the new features required by our users we've realised that we have to completely rewrite the application in order to build a more complex and reliable one. We've created a new architecture and started to work on it. But being a team of two people, we found ourselves facing a huge work volume. After some time, we started to face financial difficulties. We've realised that we are not able to complete such a huge task just by ourselves. 

I love this project with all my heart and I'm dedicated to it. I will be eternally grateful for your support. Your help is vital for us now, we can not complete this work without you.


How the new Lubith will be?

We are planning to make a very flexible tool in which you can create almost any type of theme in order to overcome the limitations of the current version. New advanced tools will be available but we'll keep it simple.

Add, remove and customise any element - A full featured HTML and CSS visual editor

The first Lubith release has some limitations. You have the possibility to customise theme elements but on a given layout. We want to overcome this and add the possibility to create any layout, to add and remove any element. Elements will be selectable and customisable. Advanced users will be able to edit or build the HTML structure from scratch and a CSS tool will be available.

Support for mobile device.

The generated themes will be optimised for mobile devices and hight-density retina displays.

Redesigned menus

A redesigned and retractable menu with new tools.

Create custom pages

When you work on a theme, you want a general layout for your site but also some custom pages that look different from the rest. We will add also this feature so you will be able to create as many custom pages you like for a theme.

A Theme Gallery with a lot of ready made themes that can be customised.

This is a a very important part of the project and a big missing of the current version. We want to build a theme gallery where anyone (subject to moderation) can add themes. Our goal is to create a big Themes Gallery of editable themes. 

White Label

We'll make this option available only if at least 1 person chooses the "White Label" perk. This feature is useful for Wordpress Multisite (WPMU) where you can use Lubith as an embedded theme editor. It will be white label (without Lubith logo), installed as a Wordpress plugin. 

Some other features and tools

  • An embedded image editor.
  • Ready made images for backgrounds, buttons etc.
  • Generate plain HTML templates, that can be used in other projects, not necessary with Wordpress. 
  • Multiple background images
  • Animations
  • Gradient tool


What you get?

Your reward for supporting this project is:

  • A Pro Membership
  • For the fist time we offer a life membership *only for some perks.
  • A big affiliate percent (90% from any sale) *only for some perks.
  • Lubith will be available to thousands of people, for free.
  • Thousands of new, customisable, Wordpress themes.
  • Your name (and a link) in a "Thank You" page on our site. 

Lubith is mainly a free tool. It's important to understand that the free version is not a teaser but a fully functional application. We would say that you get 95% of Lubith for free and 100% as a Pro Member.

Our Pro Members are amazing people who want to support the project and professionals needing all the features of Lubith. A Pro Member wil get:

  • The possibility to work on unlimited themes in the same time.
  • More fonts.
  • Access to special tools.
  • The generated theme has more features.
  • Full access to the Theme Gallery. 


Risks

I can assure you that there is no risk with this project. You can see what we already did until now. We know very well what we have to. There are no "grey" areas of the project, everything is well planned. The only thing we need is more work power and we'll get this thanks to your support. 


Other Ways You Can Help 

Please spread the world about this campaign and about Lubith.

story:
An American Original - America's original music performed by America's premier ragtime orchestra

The River Raisin Ragtime Revue (R4) has been celebrating America's rich musical heritage since its inception in 2002.  We've shared exciting ragtime, blues and early jazz music in intimate venues and for crowds of 10,000 -- in churches, concert halls and large outdoor festivals.  Our mission is to educate and entertain audiences by performing, preserving and restoring America's original style of music.

We need your help to record our 5th CD, "An American Original." This will be a live recording, made from a concert at the Huron Hills North Church in Ann Arbor.  The concert recording takes place Friday, July 10th at 8PM. If you're in the area, come join us and be on the recording!

The recording will document a variety of excellent ragtime era music, including classic rags of Scott Joplin; marches and two steps; ragtime novelty pieces; Tin Pan Alley rags; and even some early jazz and blues tunes.  Some of the other composers represented include Eubie Blake, Fred Stone (Detroit bandleader), Jelly Roll Morton, James Reese Europe, W. C. Handy, Joe Jordan and May Aufderheide.       

R4 has a terrific orchestra assembled to give this music the interpretation it deserves.  Our previous four CDs have received national and international praise and we believe this will be our best CD to date.

We need to raise $3000 to cover the costs of the ,recording, engineering, and manufacturing of the CD. We've already raised the significant funds to cover the rehearsals and concert expenses. We know you'll help put us over the top and make this project possible. In exchange for your assistance, we're giving you some options for incentives. You can choose from a copy of the new CD (or our prior CDs), some cool R4 swag, or receive mention in the liner notes depending on the level of your support. Your contribution may be tax deductible, as R4 is a 501c3 nonprofit organization.

We'll be working with Brookwood Studios, which has 3 Grammy Awards to their credit. Brookwood has recorded our last two CDs and we are confident we will receive an excellent and professional finished product.
So, there you have it.  Please contribute if you can and help spread the word among your music-loving friends.  We can't wait to share this great American music!

story:
Hi everyone!

     You may be thinking, "Wait, have I seen this campaign before?" Well, yes, sorta. The reason I'm running this continuation is that with the last go around, we came up short with full funding for the goal of $8000. Now that we are more than halfway through recording the album, I am reaching out to you, asking for your help to fund the other $3700 we were originally trying for. This will be going toward hiring the best people we can to mix and master "Glow", as well as to hire a pr firm for professional promotion of the album. 

     I'm so proud of what this record is becoming and I think you are really going to fall in love with it. It has such a variety of music from moving ballads, all the way to edgy and passionate alternative songs. I don't want to simply put it on itunes and call it a day. It really needs to be heard. Much more than any of my prior albums, this one needs to be heard. The song "Looking Down", written to raise money to fight against cancer, needs to be out there raising money to help those with the disease, as well as their families. I hope you'll take a moment to consider a pledge and I thank you so very much for any contribution you can make.

-------------------------------------------------

If you have previously pledged: 

If you have previously pledged during the first campaign, your perks will be delivered as planned, when the album is finished. If you feel moved to pledge again, and it doesn't put you in a tight spot, it would mean so much to us and you are more than welcome to. If you would rather simply pledge a random amount and not claim a perk, that option is also available.

Thank you all. 

Sincerely,

Matt 

Music: www.MattLandeMusic.com or  www.reverbnation.com/MattLande

story:
Hello everyone, I am E.T.  I am based out of Chattanooga, TN.  While mostly spending my musical career as an acoustic solo artist, I am also a veteran of Chattanooga bands Baybee Invincible (bass), Ion Prophecy (vox) and most recently The Unsatisfied (bass).

After decades of recording demos, I am excited to announce that I FINALLY plan to record something official which I can release to the public.  I will be recording at Tiny Buzz studio right here in Chattanooga.

Perks will range from digital copies of the recording, signed physical copies, to a personal house concert.  All funds will be used towards recording, mixing, pressing and releasing the EP. In the case I don't reach my goal amount here I will STILL make the recording... only , it will take longer to release. In the case I exceed my goal I will split the extra between buying merch (and sending some as BONUS perks to those already getting a perk) and a The FENDER MUSIC FOUNDATION, a very worthy cause. Check out FMF here https://donatenow.networkforgood.org/fendermusicfoundation  and feel free to donate directly to FMF too.

"The time has come again, full circle,  when songs have started working their way out of my head and most importantly, my soul.  I recently lost my best friend in this world, my mother. It tore me apart.  It crashed my entire world.  Somehow, perhaps out of necessity and survival of my sanity, I came out of the writer's block that has dogged me for years... and into a place where I can again put what I am feeling into music and lyrics.  I haven't written songs like this in many years and I'm ready to finally make a record. THANK YOU for being a part of it!" -E.T.

story:
The goal of our We’re Gonna Make It Right Alliance’s travelling fair is to make more and more people aware that pure, delicious food actually exists and can be acquired fairly easily, or even grown at home, and we will have the people – right there – to demonstrate and instruct on how to do it from scratch.  The food will be tastier, fresher (of course!), more nutritious and a lot cheaper.

We will be doing similar demonstration and instruction on improving air and water quality, and organizing to get it done on an ever-larger basis.

There will be organic, non-GMO, gourmet food to eat all along the way, as well as demonstrations on how to make it.

This part will go on all day, followed by the concert of which you already know.  And as I said, this is where your help is really needed.

We need to establish at least a skeleton headquarters, and install some staff.  This will require about $140,000.  It would be a whole lot more if our founders, Rhonda LaRoy and Robert Hawkins, were not donating as much of their time as they can afford.

Recording will eat up another $60,000, with equipment adding another $50,000.  Travel and lodging, for the first month and a half, will run about $100K.  By that time, the tour should be self-sustaining.

That leaves only $150,000 for promotion.  Without it, who’s to know we’re showing up?  And why?  And who we are?

Where are we going?  Everywhere.  From Seattle to Boston to Miami to San Diego, and points in between.  At this point, we plan to start in the west, and work our way, crisscross and up and down.  We intend this tour to be unending until we actually have food that is good for humans to consume everywhere, clean, usable water on land and at sea, and air that will sustain humans, animals and plants.

Look forward to it.

story:
Our Story

Groove 8 are a jazz funk musical collective based in Charlotte, North Carolina. Since 2005 the band has performed over 1000 shows all over the US. G8 has recorded four projects since that time with the last being CURIOUS POSES (2012). It is time for us to give our fans old and future some new, raw, funky, original material.

We are seeking your help to fund our next project (untitled) which will feature six new funky tracks. We are excited to finally get back into the studio and give our fans new material to listen to. We feel we have some great rewards for those of you who will be a part of this INDIE GO GO campaign.

We are using this format to give everyone an opportunity to be a part of the our recording process. All of the funds will go towards recording the new album. This includes: recording, mixing, mastering, and the duplication of physical CDs. We will also release the new album via download from various media spots on the web. If you contribute you will get great perks from having your name highlighted on our official website to a private concert. There are perks for every contribution level. If you cannot financially assist us here, there are other ways. Spread the word for us through your own social media, when you talk to friends let them know we are on Indi Go Go. Your level of participation is up to you! We love you no matter what!

We thank you for visiting the page and appreciate you more than you know. You will not be disappointed!

Visit us at groove8.com for more information on the band including our upcoming concerts.

Follow us on twitter and Facebook:

facebook.com/groove8

twitter.com/groove8

story:
My name is RJ. I made a lot of music for Homestuck. Some of it didn't get used.

Over 500 songs worth of stuff, actually, as you can see here. That's crazy? You could literally get all of these, as well as 14 more albums of music. Hundreds, maybe thousands of songs, and a lot of them are newer stuff. Now I make way better songs. And I want to actually build those together into proper releases and have people hear them! Might be cool. Let's do it?

Turns out stuff costs money and my stuff is all old and trash and broken. My music PC has been in a worsening state for ages now, to the point that making music on it means a latency bad enough that I can't hear my songs at anything but half speed until I export them, and exporting often takes a crazy long time. 

All of this is based on this thing getting funded to full marks, so bear with me if I only get, like, two hundred bucks.

Ideally, a full half of the budget stated above is going to a new computer: That $2500 may sound extreme, but I'm aiming for an incredibly high-end machine that will allow me to make my really, really nuts bananas huge project files breathe and allow for recording. And, you know, that way it won't break down and I won't have to do another crowdfunding campaign to raise money to buy another computer so that's probably a good thing?

$350 is going towards top-of-the-line mixing headphones. I both can't afford good monitors and can't use them, since I'm in a close-knit urban area and have a ton of roommates and blaring loud music is basically pretty rude at best. 

I'm setting aside $1000 to pay for physical merchandise like tee shirts and the like. This doesn't include physical copies of albums on vinyl or cd or whatever because that is a stretch goal okay don't judge me

and $The Rest is going towards paying guest stars and remixers, because I want to actually be a human being and not a jerk. Plenty are close friends of mine who'd gladly do it for free, but I want to be able to reimburse them if I can. If the album gets funded to the actual, you know, fund...mark...thing, then I'll be able to increase this meager sum, which is awesome for everyone involved in the album's production.

MUSIC

OBVIOUSLY. Lots of it! Albums include but are totally not limited to:

You'd Have Loved These Songs in High School
Formerly a project called "12 Songs in 12 Days" which was exactly what it sounds like, intended to help me detach and not get hung up on overproduction. Those twelve days started May 2014 and the album is now...almost done? A vocal pop throwback to 2007 blog culture and the music I wished I could have made when I was much much very less good at making music. Self indulgent and made with love.

Chicago, IN

My first full rap album. No, really, that's actually...something I do

Stuckhome Syndrome

Yes, I know, I've been talking this project up forever. It's three albums, really: 

-one is a collection of all of the nonspecific music I made for Homestuck over the years  that never got used. 

-one is my ill-fated attempt at a Dave Strider album

-one is a 20-track complete overhaul of the best tracks from my Homestuck discography, redone by me now in 2016. 

Overall, it's a way for me to close the book on a huge chapter of my music career and move on with my life, ok,

Tunes for Moms and Dads and Kids and Teens

An album of songs for kids. Really! Check out a demo of one of the cuts here.

Someone Else's Album

A vocal pop album where the instrumental bed is entirely created by manipulating samples from songs by a good friend of mine. You can hear examples in the video at the top of this page, actually! All the incidental music in it is from this.

AND, YOU KNOW, MORE

I don't want to bog you down with everything but there is a lot of music in the works and it's gonna get released over the next two and a half years and change or so. You can get most or all of it!

TEE SHIRT?

Why yes, friend. Actually, several tee shirts. With a fancy little hook:



A new design will be revealed each time the previous one sells 42 units! Check back soon to see the next one.

OTHER??? ??

As this Indiegogo campaign develops, more cool junk for you will be revealed. STAY TUNED TO THE UPDATES AND MY TWITTER I GUESS, IF YOU, WANT

So the $5000 covers the above, right? But what about the miracle crazy scenario that I get more money than that? I have plans.

If I get $7,500 I'll be able to do a CD release. Which is awesome! I'll be the toast of every soccer mom's disc changer. I've got a cool CD package planned, involving an extensive art booklet (way beyond what's planned for the digital release), cool disc art, and secret bonus tracks thanks to messing with the 1980s digital magic of Redbook Audio. 

If I get $15,000 I'll be able to do a vinyl release. Vinyl is a lot more expensive to produce than CD and requires special additional mixing and mastering, plus needs consideration for length due to the nature of how records, you know, work. But anything can happen with the money to do it. This would include a ton of cool stuff, including a fancy gatefold cover, 180 gram vinyl, and MAYBE EVEN multiple editions like a picture disc version or a 180g 4-disc black vinyl audiophile edition for the Purest Sound There Can Be, Ever.

If I get MORE THAN $15,000 I'll ??????????????: That seems like a lot of money to rake in for such a tiny dude as me. But if it happens, I've got ideas. Lots of ideas. And you'll all be in the know on 'em.



RISK.

I could die. Then the music wouldn't get made. That's about it; I'm finishing these over the next few years and even if it seems like a lot of music (I mean, it is) a lot of it is already done, so it shouldn't be the huge problem it might sound like. It'll get made anyway; consider this getting funded its guarantee you'll hear it.


<3
story_txt:
My name is RJ. I made a lot of music for Homestuck. Some of it didn't get used. Over 500 songs worth of stuff, actually, as you can see here. That's crazy? You could literally get all of these, as well as 14 more albums of music. Hundreds, maybe thousands of songs, and a lot of them are newer stuff. Now I make way better songs. And I want to actually build those together into proper releases and have people hear them! Might be cool. Let's do it?Turns out stuff costs money and my stuff is all old and trash and broken. My music PC has been in a worsening state for ages now, to the point that making music on it means a latency bad enough that I can't hear my songs at anything but half speed until I export them, and exporting often takes a crazy long time. All of this is based on this thing getting funded to full marks, so bear with me if I only get, like, two hundred bucks.Ideally, a full half of the budget stated above is going to a new computer: That $2500 may sound extreme, but I'm aiming for an incredibly high-end machine that will allow me to make my really, really nuts bananas huge project files breathe and allow for recording. And, you know, that way it won't break down and I won't have to do another crowdfunding campaign to raise money to buy another computer so that's probably a good thing?$350 is going towards top-of-the-line mixing headphones. I both can't afford good monitors and can't use them, since I'm in a close-knit urban area and have a ton of roommates and blaring loud music is basically pretty rude at best. I'm setting aside $1000 to pay for physical merchandise like tee shirts and the like. This doesn't include physical copies of albums on vinyl or cd or whatever because that is a stretch goal okay don't judge meand $The Rest is going towards paying guest stars and remixers, because I want to actually be a human being and not a jerk. Plenty are close friends of mine who'd gladly do it for free, but I want to be able to reimburse them if I can. If the album gets funded to the actual, you know, fund...mark...thing, then I'll be able to increase this meager sum, which is awesome for everyone involved in the album's production.

You'd Have Loved These Songs in High School

story:
"When Are You Going to Boost Your Signal ?"

You love discovering new music, hearing unsigned and local artists, and being able to stay in touch with what is going on around town. You've also said you'd listen even more if you could get our FM signal better in the growing Lexington/Irmo and Northeast Columbia suburbs.

Why WXRY?

WXRY has been independent public radio in SC's capital city for ten years. From day one, we've brought you music that you couldn't hear anywhere else. But we've always been more than music. We've been a catalyst behind the scenes. We've been the engine that made community involvement and discovering one's city cool again. We were the the first to return to SC's Main Street. We were the first to revive championing local and regional music and local and regional musicians. We've broadcast mayoral and city council debates, countless parades and a number of community gatherings.

Surrounding the City with Non-Profit Radio

Working with our affiliate groups, the Friends of Independent Public Radio, we have received two new FM licenses to boost our signal where 99.3 does not come in well:

  • 98.1 in Northeast Columbia, covering Lugoff, Elgin, Blythewood, and Sandhills/Northeast Columbia.
  • 99.1 in Northwest Columbia, covering Irmo, Chapin, Ballentine, Lexington and Red Bank.


What Do You Need to Make It Happen and How Soon?

Each of these transmitters will be located away from the Barringer Building studios. We will have to rent space on an existing tower and pay for professional climbers to hang our antennas, as well as buy weatherproof shelters to house the transmitters and associated equipment including data links to the Barringer Building. All told, we estimate the costs at $55,000. Through Midlands Gives, we have raised $6,500. With a successful campaign, these signals will be on the air by the end of the summer or sooner!

The Time is Now. It's Now or Never.

 The permits to put 98.1 in Northeast and 99.1 in Irmo on the air expire this summer. Once they expire, that is it.

With your help, we can beat that deadline and be on the air quick!

Sponsor a Piece of Equipment

If your budget permits, you can sponsor a signal or buy a specific piece of equipment. Like a parent of triplets, we need three of almost everything. We have specific items and specific ways we'd love to thank you over to the right. Want to see what some of the equipment looks like, check them out in our gallery.

Buy a Watt

If buying a piece of equipment is beyond your budget, you can still help by buying a "watt" of radio power. We've got 40, 60, 120 and 240 watt levels so for less than a night out or 20 dollars a month, you can buy into your favorite station's future.

Other Ways You Can Help

When it comes to financial support of our station, we appreciate that everyone has different means. That's why we say "more if you can, less if you can't."  Some of us aren't in a position at the moment to contribute. You can still help:

  • Tweet, share and tell! Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the hashtags #boostit or #signalbooster or both!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Know somebody that might be able to help? Send them here!

Thank you!

WXRY is a 501(c)(3) non-profit registered with the state of South Carolina.
EIN: 20-0998798 Charity No. C15028

story:
Short Summary

Help Me to Inspire Hope Through Music

The focus for my live recording is HOPE!  Our mission is to reach out to people to share the message of Jesus Christ through anointed music. Will you partner with us to help us complete the "HOPE" CD/DVD? Together we can give hope to  hopeless hearts and inspire people to live better lives.

Every song written on this new project will inspire and uplift!

HOPE that will cause each listener to believe that when they refuse to quit, they win! By trusting in God and believing; they will have better days ahead. He will cause them to triumph in every area of life! 

WE ARE IN THE FINAL STAGES OF THE PROJECT!!!

What We Need and What You Get

We are now in the process of completing the "HOPE" CD and DVD that was recorded live in August 2014 at Eagle Mountain International Church in Fort Worth, TX. This was ONE AMAZING night of praise and worship. The glory and presence of the Lord filled the church. With your help, this powerful live CD and DVD recording can reach into the lives of millions of people.

Our goal is $15K in 21 days.  The pledges that we receive will be used for expenses to finish the project. For example: overdubs, mixing, mastering, editing, printing and marketing and  other requirements that go into bringing an album to market.

With your love gift of just $25 or more you will receive the "HOPE" live recording combo set (CD & DVD). Check out the sample video above.

Thank you for your love. Thank you for your prayers. Thank you for your support.        I know that we can meet and even exceed our goal. 

The plan is SIMPLE.

I partner with you. You partner with me. 

TOGETHER WE BRING HOPE TO PEOPLE ALL OVER THIS WORLD!

 Help me get the word out by sharing this campaign information with your family, friends, coworkers, neighbors, everyone.

 Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

Hey y'all. If you don't know me by now, my name is Saara Maria. I was born in Finland but basically grew up mostly in Baltimore, MD.  I'm come from a family of musicians, so music pretty much runs in my blood...

Most of you know, I've been performing and writing for a while now, but this is my first original album! I'm grateful for the time I've had to contemplate and put this idea together. The studio time was the ultimate and the sound is so exciting that I absolutely cannot wait to show it to you!!! The only problem is there are still a few more things that need to be squared away before I can do that... That's where you come in!

What I Need & What You Get

So here's the deal. I need to raise another $3,000 to get the rest of this project rolling. The money will go towards artwork, mastering, printing and marketing this project.

The perks include hand-made artwork and jewelry by yours truly, free t-shirts and CD's and even a private concert at your home depending on how much you'd like to donate!

The Impact

The message that I'm bringing to the world is one of freedom and ease. I really hope to have an influence with my sound. I want to get people motivated to follow their dreams and always stay true to what their heart tells them everyday.

The reality is, when I've got this CD in my hands, I can come back to you, and we can pick up where we left off, sharing that same love and dream again...

Other Ways You Can Help

So, just like me, most of you are starving artists... But it doesn't mean that you can't put in your share. I mean literally. Just share this link and you never know who will check it out! Just the fact that youre taking the time to check it out means the world to me. Thank you for all your time and for sharing the belief in the dreams of smooth sailing! I hope you love the new songs...

Much Love and Gratitude -

SAARA MARIA

story:
Short Summary

Upcoming Reggae PoP Artist Trudy Hinds has released her debut Album Magnumstyle AVAILABLE ON Itunes, Amazonmp3, Spotify, Rhapsody, Googleplay and Emusic much anticipated by her growing fan base with this album/mix tape fans get the raw and refined nature of dancehall reggae,and pop music merge as one.

  • growing up in a talented family which meant that trudy was always surrounded by different forms of music
  • fusion music the development of this unique style is the result of a lifetime musical influence.
  • Very important as it will be the globalization of Reggae through POP music my dream realized.



What We Need & What You Get

 Details:

  • on receiving the funds necessary i will start the production of black dynasty the album, which will include at least 5 hrs each day at the hr/$40 in studio production
  • for the first 200 supporters i will send out an autographed photo Calendar and personalized audio Cd for the new project Black dynasty.
  • if i do not acquire the full pledge amount i will not do the black dynasty tour and only produce the album which i have a distribution firm that has helped me launch my previous album

The Impact

Along my journey so far it has been difficult to find a breakthrough the music industry so it would be amazing if we can show others that with the vast world wide web it is now easier to accomplish this dream as an independent and i know we can usher this in together.
    
  • my first project Magnumstyle that i got funded on a low budget by selling my album/mixtape for $5 on the streets,i found a few benefactors to support me  financially and i got some pics taken.
  • i recorded with anyone, underground studios, low income studios, i performed at different locations Fortlauderdale and Miami to get the music out, my passion, and got that album/mixtape distributed through Song Cast that i love so much , available for independent artists like me.

Risks & Challenges

 Over pricing of studio time might arise always flexible and negotiable influx of producers who share the same dream ,seeking out the right resources an ongoing task that will provide the professional sound that i want to achieve for this album.I can assure you that this will not stop me from moving forward with Black Dynasty Album and Tour. I have already reached out to some New Comers and Veterans who i have been networking with in the industry that i know i am able to lean on there shoulders when risks and challenges arise.

  • i qualify because i have been grinding for 7 years the love of music keeps me going, using my know how, learning from others and watching some of the best in the music industry.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • i love you my supporters so help me spread the word and tell everyone about Reggae Pop Singer Trudy Hinds .
  •  Use the Indiegogo share tools!

The Black Dynasty Tour.

Trudy Hinds

story:
About the AJF:

The Allentown JazzFest is a multi-day jazz music festival based in downtown Allentown, PA. This inaugural year will include some of the biggest names in music including Jojo Mayer & Nerve, Nicole Henry, Al Chez & The Brothers of Funk, and The Oz Noy Trio, along with many others. For a full schedule, please see www.allenjownjazzfest.org.

The presenters of the JazzFest, Performing Arts Live!, is led by Bryan Tuk, Executive Director and CEO. Bryan is a jazz drummer himself, and his passion for jazz music, as well as his intimate knowledge of the arts stemming from his legal career with an emphasis in Arts and Entertainment, has ensured a very exciting first year for the festival.

With the help of supporters like you, we will be able to bring Bryan’s ideas and planning to fruition. It is a common misconception that ticket sales recoup the cost of presenting a festival such as JazzFest, but they make up just a small portion. Your contribution, no matter at which level, will make a difference. A very big difference.

What We Need:

Cash, Moolah, Scratch, Smackers, Loot… Money! Yes, you already knew that. But exactly how much?

$25,000

But we'd gladly accept more to help make the Allentown JazzFest even better!

What You Get:

And, if you contribute at the $50-level or above, exclusive gifts such as our official festival poster created by renowned Allentown artist, Ann Elizabeth Schlegel, a hat with our awesome logo, and tickets to one or more of the events planned.

At all levels you get our sincere thanks for your support, and the satisfaction of knowing you have become a part of the Allentown JazzFest, helping  to bring awesome musical talent to Allentown, and furthering the love and appreciation of jazz in all its forms.

Other Ways You Can Help:

Spread the word! Come see a show! And bring a friend!

Also, remember that you can use the Indiegogo Share Tools to help spread the word about this campaign.

Thank you for your support, and hopefully we’ll see you at one of our events!

bring Bryan’s ideas and planning to fruition. It is a common misconception that
ticket sales recoup the cost of presenting a festival such as JazzFest, but
they make up just a small portion. Your contribution, no matter at which level,
will make a difference. A very big difference.
What We Need:
Cash, Moolah, Scratch, Smackers, Loot… Money! Yes, you
already knew that. But exactly how much?$25,000But we'd gladly accept more to help make the Allentown JazzFest even better! 
What You Get:
And, if you contribute at the $50-level or above,
exclusive gifts such as our official festival poster created by renowned
Allentown artist, Ann Elizabeth Schlegel, a hat with our awesome logo, and
tickets to one or more of the events planned.At all levels you get our sincere thanks for your support, and the satisfaction of knowing you have become a part of the Allentown JazzFest, helping  to bring awesome musical talent to Allentown, and furthering the love
and appreciation of jazz in all its forms. 
Other Ways You Can
Help:
Spread the word! Come see a show! And bring a friend!
Also, remember that you can use the Indiegogo Share Tools to
help spread the word about this campaign.
Thank you for your support, and hopefully we’ll see you at
one of our events!

story:
In Short...

Villa Musica is San Diego's Community Music Center! Founded in 2005 as a non-profit, Villa Musica provides quality music education to all San Diegans regardless of their background or ability to pay.

In celebration of our 10th Year Anniversary... (yes we said 10 years) we are making a CD and putting on a BIG concert! Here's where the crowd funding comes in. CD's and concerts cost money... and because of our dedication to subsidizing the under-served in our community (we don't want this expense to take away from the scholarships we offer, the free programs we offer in schools in Logan Heights and City Heights) we need YOUR HELP to make this project a goer.

With your help our concert will be free to the public AND provide a spotlight and some important publicity for what we do.

What We Need & What You Get

Here's the low-down on our expenses for this project:

  • We are recording at Studio West in Rancho Bernardo. Each performance group/individual will have NEVER had this opportunity before. Cost: $2,250
  • CD Manufacture and reproduction $2,500
  • Performance at Scripps Auditorium (formerly NSI Auditorium) Cost: $1,650
  • "Just in Case" budget: $100

For your support there are various levels of "swag" we are offering. Check out the PERKS page for details.

If you can't give this time...

If cash is tight and you are unable to contribute to this project, please  support Villa Musica in some other way:

  • Let people know about this project in some other way, FB, twitter, sing about it, or use some of Indiegogo's sharing tools!
  • Volunteer at Villa Musica - we have a BUNCH of opportunities for this!
  • Sign up for our E-Newsletter

story:
Hello Everyone,

As some of you may know, I have just finished my Masters in Flute Performance and am desperate to finally buy a professional flute to help me attain the performance career I have always dreamed of. However, with university debt still looming, it seems impossible.

Why do I need this flute now and why will it cost so much?

I am now beginning to take orchestral auditions and am competing for a tenured position in an orchestra. I will also be entering more competitions this year, both at the national and (hopefully) international level. At this stage, every little detail matters and can make a huge difference to my playing and my success. I just don't think my Yamaha can get me there! The right professional flute will give me a larger sound, a wider colour range and greater mechanical ease. It will enhance what I can already do and will give me the opportunity to do even more. Professional flutes also provide stronger mechanisms which reduce wear and tear and I want to have this flute for many many years! The more complicated materials and craftsmanship required to make these flutes naturally result in much higher prices, with flutes up to $70,000.

I plan to buy Brannen Brother's sterling silver Brögger flute and head joint. After taxes, the exchange rate and duties/custom fees, the purchase will total to $20,000 CAD, I hope, by some miracle, to make the purchase by September 2015 so that I can start practicing on my new instrument as soon as possible.

I obviously don't expect to raise the full amount, but as my mum has always told me "you'll never know, unless you try"! 

If you or anyone you know can find it in their heart to help me with this, absolutely any contribution you can make (US $ CAD $ or GBP £) will help and your support will mean SO much.

Please feel free to check out my videos and a list of recent accomplishments. You're more than welcome to contact me for more information.



Thank you for your time and consideration,

Laura


Education:

-  MMus, The University of Ottawa

-  BMus Ed with honours, The University of Western Ontario

-  Studied with Camille Churchfield 2013-2015

-  Fiona Wilkinson 2012-2013, 2009-2011

-  Stephen Tam, 2011-2012

- Michelle Coon, 2008-2009

-  Lessons and Master classes with Matieu Dufour, Michel Bellavance, Denis Bluteau, Carolyn Christie and Marie-André Bernard 

Awards/Honours:

- Winner of the Canadian Flute Convention Competition, 2015

-  Crabtree Foundation Award Winner (2nd place) at the NACO Bursary Competition, 2015

-  Kingston Symphony Orchestra Principal Flute Audition Finalist, 2015

-  Guelph Symphony Orchestra “Under 23” Concerto Competition Winner, 2013

-  UWO Nicholas Fiore Memorial Award for the Most Promising Flute Player, 2013

-  UWO Concerto Competition Finalist, 2012

-  London Music Scholarship Foundation Award Finalist, 2011

-  Canadian Federation of University Women Performing Arts Scholarship, 2009

-  Oakville Young Artist Competition Winner, 2009

story:
UPDATE:   We have found a studio and there will be no fees!  So we will end our campaign!  I will be refunding your contributions. Thank you for your interest in our cause! <3
UPDATE:  
WOOT! Thanks friends, for the donations!
As you may know, I have been following this story thinking about ways to help Ryan follow his dreams of playing the piano for the world.  A friend pointed out that to do this, he first needs a piano. So we started to crowdfund to get him one. Not even a day later, he got one from the woman who took the video (that went viral). 
So ... we decided to keep the campaign going to get him into the studio to record a song or two to host on iTunes so that Ryan can reach his dream and share his music with the world!  nd make himself some money, too.
And ... that's where we are at. I have a couple of things cooking so stay tuned! 100% of whatever is sourced will go towards this goal. So please, if you have $5 or $10 in spare change, come and make music with us!
~

Before Ryan Arcand performs his song called New Beginnings, he dedicates the piece "to the homeless that have passed on.” 

Ryan was living on the streets of Edmonton himself until recently, when passerby Roslyn Polard recorded a video of him playing a public piano last October.

He now has a home with Niginan Housing in the city AND a brand new Yamaha piano.

Executive director Carola Cunningham wished for a keyboard with a headset for Ryan so that he could play at night in his room "to help with his healing" and Roslyn made it happen .

We think that's AWESOME, don't you? This goes to show the power of social media.  We'd like to keep it going by funding a recording session for Ryan so that he can benefit from wider distribution of his music!

Please give what you can - and help spread the word!  

Read more of this incredible story here: http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/edmonton/ryan-arc...

Watch the video that inspired us here (Video credit Roslyn Polard - All Rights): https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aTsMTIofG2Q

Another Culture First Project. http://www.culturefirst.ca

story:
--------------------------------------------------------------------

THIS JUST IN:

We have partnered with the best Ecuador has to offer: PACARI CHOCOLATES is now the official sponsor of this campaign.
That means that every-single-collaborator who buys a CD gets a delicious Ecuadorian chocolate bar to enjoy while they listen to the music.  
And every collaborator who participates with perks of $100 or more, gets a Single Origin Gift Box, comprising 4 bars of the best chocolate on Earth (79 awards and counting, only from 2012 to date!).


Check it out: http://www.pacari.com/collections/all/products/single-origin-collection
And now you can't think of anything else, right?  Sorry about that... neither can we.

--------------------------------------------------------------------

Who

Born and raised in Quito-Ecuador, Carlos Mena is one of the rising stars in the New York City music scene. 

Carlos' career highlights includes performances with notable musical artists and shows, to name a few: with Arturo Sandoval, Antonio Hart, Don Omar, Willie Colón, Pedrito Martinez,  Michael Mossman, Gene Jackson, John Ellis, Mayito Rivera (former singer for Los Van Van), John Davis, Andrew Atkinson, Cliff Korman, Jeb Patton and Sergio Sacoto.

For the past few months, Carlos has been working on his first solo album, which will feature world-class players and encompass a myriad of genres, including jazz, hip hop, Latin rhythms and a string quartet.  

And, through this IndieGogo campaign, YOU can be a part of this one-of-a-kind experience!!

What

We want to make a ground-breaking album, that will allow everyone to enjoy Carlos' music in its various forms, the same way thousands of New Yorkers have been enjoying it for the past ten years, in venues as diverse as Terraza 7 in Queens, to the legendary Apollo Theater in Harlem.

The funds raised with this campaign will help cover some of the costs associated with making such an album, including (but not limited to):

  • Studio time: professional studios are expensive for a reason... they sound amazing!!!  
    And we need to be in there for a while: when you're shooting for that performance that'll move you every time you listen to it, it takes about 4-5 hours to record a single track, and at least the same amount of time to mix it.
  • Production team: because all that gear refuses to operate by itself!  Plus, they've been working with Carlos for months before recording, helping him define anything from repertoire, design, sonic criteria, and this very campaign. 
  • The most amazing musicians in the world: because you're worth it!  And so is the music... This album will feature an all-star lineup of the best musicians in New York City.  
    Some of them, you've already seen in the videos we've released so far: "Cissy Strut" features Brian Charette (Downbeat Magazine's Critics Poll Rising Star 2014) and Antonio Sanchez ( who's played with... everyone, including Pat Metheny, Wayne Shorter, Herbie Hancock, John Scofield... oh, and he also conceived and performed the original music for Birdman).


    "Trip to Wendy's" featured Leo Genovese (Esperanza Spalding, Joe Lovano, Jack DeJohnette) and Jojo Mayer (Screaming Headless Torsos, Dizzie Gillespie, John Zorn, Steve Coleman).

  • The object previously known as record: in this case, we'll release the material in three different formats.  CDs, for those for you who still love the experience of tearing off the plastic wrapping, smelling the ink off the booklet, and putting that shinny thing on your finger before it reaches the machine that will actually play it.  USB Cards, because we're really hip, and so are you.  These will feature the music in both mp3 and hi-res audio, PDF versions of the booklet and other graphic material, pictures, both videos mentioned above, and behind-the-scenes footage.  And you can transfer those files to your computer and keep using the card as a portable flash drive!  And of course, the album will also be available through most online retailers such as Amazon and iTunes.

How

See that column on the right?  That's a list of options we've put together for you to become involved with this project.  

From getting the album in any format before anyone else, to autographed sheet music, to being in the studio with these great musicians and witness the magic as it's being created.

But there are other ways for you to be part of this:

  • Feeling generous? You can choose to collaborate any amount without receiving a perk in return.
  • Wanna get out of the house?  Great!  Check out Carlos' gig schedule on his website (www.carlosbassmena.com) or Facebook page (www.facebook.com/carlosbassmena) and stop by any of his gigs.  You're in for a treat!
  • Wanna help from home, right now? We know you have your Facebook page open in another tab... we just do.  And some of you will also have Twitter, Instagram... hey, who knows... a couple of you might even be using Google+!
    Please, share this campaign with your friends... maybe they'll see something in it for them.  They'll thank you for it... and so will we.

Why

Chances are, if you've gotten this far down, we don't need to explain this any further.  But, just in case: we'd love you to become part of this project!

Supporting projects by independent artists helps them to keep making the music you enjoy so much, and to have that music evolve through longer creative processes, inspiring collaborators, better sound, and wider reach.

Carlos has already demonstrated the kind of work he can put out, and he's got a ton of new music he wants to share with you.  And, in case the music itself doesn't provide enough reasons for you to become involved, we've come up with some pretty creative perks to you excited about participating!

When

The album will be recorded in early November, 2015.  And we intend to release it a month later... just in time to make it to your Christmas basket!

Those of you who pick one of the perks on the right will get them during the first two weeks of December.

We,

the people who wrote this, would like to thank those of you who read the whole thing.  If nothing else, you should know you just made us very happy!

story:
We are Tunnel Vision

Last year Tunnel Vision did a did a mini East Coast tour sidelining with surfboard shaper Matt Biolos, and Mike Reola of the Lost crew.  The boys are currently doing  this Indie GoGo Campaign to raise funds for their Self-Titled  Album Debut & Summer Tour. The band already has a long list of dates and venues booked see below.

Tunnel Vision is quickly becoming Southern California’s  favorite new Surf, Reggae, Ska band. The band is comprised of five San Clemente musicians who grew up with instruments in their hands and skateboards and surfboards under their feet. Tunnel Vision originally formed as a three-piece band, with Hayden Hanson as the lead singer and guitarist, Jacob Hernandez on bass, and Tanner Payan on drums and additional vocals. The three have been long time friends, who grew up in South San Clemente’s Trestles neighborhood surfing waves and riding concrete bowls.

Growing up in SoCal, the band was heavily influenced by the Punk Rock, Reggae and Ska Music of  bands like Sublime, Slightly Stoopid, NoFX, Rancid and Mad Caddies. The boys have all worked in the surf industry for years, starting out in retail for Rip Curl and moving on to manufacturing surfboards for Lost Enterprises.

Tunnel Vision recently increased the band from a three-piece to a five-piece by adding Doug Alani and Matt Risley. Matt Risely  & Doug both met the guys through their connections with Lost’s retail store Catalyst. Matt comes down from his mountain cabin with his wolf in tow and plays keyboards with the band.  While Doug brings saxophone to the sound of Tunnel Vision.

The boys recently connected with Miles, Kyle & Dela of Slightly Stoopid.  Slightly Stoopid took the boys under their wing and let them record the rest of their album at the Slightly Stoopid Studios in San Diego. The boys were also picked up by Whiskey Barrel Records through the help of their Manager Anthony Levato. The Self titled album is rolling out in July 2015.

You can hear some of Tunnel Vision’s music now on the website under The Music Tab.  Make sure to sign up for their email list and follow them on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. All the summer show dates are listed on the home page.


Booked Shows

July 3 Tunnel Vision | Hazmatt @ OC Tavern | San Clemente, CA | 8pm | Friday

July 9 Tunnel Vision @ ? Mammoth, CA Set | TBD | Thursday

July 10 Tunnel Vision @ ? Mammoth, Ca| TBD | Friday

July 16 Tunnel Vision @ The Reggae Bar |  San Antonio, TX | 8:00PM TBD | Thursday

July 22 Tunnel Vision @ Cabanas | Cape May, NJ | | 8:00PM TBD | Wednesday

July 24 Tunnel Vision @ Ott”s Tavern | Medford Lakes, NJ |  7:00 – 11:00PM | Friday

July 25 Tunnel Vision | LUA @ Harpers Pub |  Clemonton, NJ | TBD | Saturday

July 29 Tunnel Vision @ Aztec |  Sea Side Heights, NJ | TBD | Wednesday

July 30 Tunnel Vision | Cheezy & Crackers @ Hot Fish Club | Murrells Inlet, SC | TBD |  Thursday

July 31 Tunnel Vision | Cheezy & Crackers @ World of Beer |  Columbia, SC | TBD | Friday

August 1 Tunnel Vision | Cheezy & the Crackers @ Lynch’s Irish Pub | Jacksonville Beach, FL | TBD | Sat.

August 2 Tunnel Vision | Cheezy & the Crackers @ Jazid | Miami Beach, FL | TBD | Sunday

August 3 Tunnel Vision | Cheezy & the Crackers @ Lucky’s Tavern | Fort Lauderdale, FL | TBD | Monday

August 7 Tunnel Vision @ Ott”s Tavern | Medford Lakes, NJ |  7:00 – 11:00PM | Friday

August 8 Tunnel Vision @ Cabanas | Cape May, NJ | | 8:00PM TBD | Saturday

August 12 Tunnel Vision @ Aztec |  Sea Side Heights, NJ | TBD | Wednesday

August 14 Tunnel Vision @ Antigua Tiki Bar |  Hammonton NJ |  Set time 7:00 – 11:00PM | Friday

August 15 Tunnel Vision @ Le Gran Fromage |  Atlantic City NJ |  TBD | Saturday

August 16 Tunnel Vision @ Cabanas | Cape May, NJ | | 8:00PM TBD | Sunday

August 29 Tunnel Vision @ The Reggae Bar |  San Antonio, TX | 8:00PM TBD

September 6 Tunnel Vision @@ Stadium Brewery Co. | Aliso Viejo, CA | 4:00PM | Sunday

September 19 Tunnel Vision @ Surf City Days HBC  | Huntington Beach CA | TBD

September 27 Tunnel Vision  @ HBC Community Day | Huntington Beach CA | TBD

October 17 Tunnel Vision @ San Clemente Octoberfest | San Clemente CA | TBD


What We Need & What You Get

Basically we need money to upgrade one of our vehicle to a road worthy tour van. We also need gas money to cover the fuel to get to all the shows above. And money for food would be helpful too. So consider your donation more a trade, you give us something and we give you something back.

Here is the Break down in more detail:

    • Donation & Sticker

      We will send you a Tunnel Vision 4-Color Sticker so you can show your support of the band, this is more of a donation with a small thank you.

    • Autographed Photo

      We will mail you an 8"X10" photo of the band with all 5 band members signatures in black sharpie on the photo.

    • Digital Download of Album

      We will send you a link to download the new Self-Titled Debut Album Tunnel Vision which is rolling out in June. Tunnel Vision had the pleasure of recording the album at the Slightly Stoopid Studios in San Diego, California. The album features 15 original songs written by Tunnel Vision.

    • Hard Copy of Album

      We will send you a hard copy of the new Self-Titled Debut Album Tunnel Vision which is rolling out in June. Tunnel Vision had the pleasure of recording the album at the Slightly Stoopid Studios in San Diego, California. The album features 15 original songs written by Tunnel Vision.

    • Tunnel Vision T-Shirt

      We will send you a Tunnel Vision Tshirt. In your desired size. Tees are Black with a 4 color logo on the front see the gallery for a photo of the shirt.

    • Signed Copy of CD

      We will send you a hard copy of the Self-Titled Debut Album Tunnel Vision which is rolling out in June. Each band member will autograph the CD. Tunnel Vision had the pleasure of recording the album at the Slightly Stoopid Studios in San Diego, California. The album features 15 original songs written by Tunnel Vision.

    • T-Shirt & CD

      We will send you a hard copy of the CD the new Self-Titled Debut Album Tunnel Vision which is rolling out in June and a our Tunnel Vision Band T-shirt. Tunnel Vision had the pleasure of recording the album at the Slightly Stoopid Studios in San Diego, California. The album features 15 original songs written by Tunnel Vision.

    • Surf or Skate Session

      If you live in South Orange County or North San Diego County get a Surf or Skate session with two members of Tunnel Vision for 1 hr.

    • Tunnel Vision Skate Deck

      • An Awesome Custom Wood Skate Deck with the TV Logo in your choice of width.  No Trucks or wheels just the deck.

    • Live Studio Session with TunnelVision

      Have a live studio session with Tunnel Vision at their studio in San Clemente. You must get to the studio by your own means. You will have a four hour session with 4-5 members of the band and get a digital recording of the session to remember the awesome experience by.

    • Private Show or Event

      You will get a 2 hour show or performance at your public or private venue, with all 5 members of TunnelVision. If venue is outside of the Orange County or San Diego County area you must provide transportation and room & board for the band.

    • If we reach our entire goal the boys will have transportation, gas & food money to get to all their summer shows.  If you're interested in having the TunnelVision at another venue near you hit us up via email and we will do our  best to get there.

The Impact

Tunnel Vision is excited to get out on the road and bring their music and energy to a venue near you. 
  • TunnelVision is debuting their new album and want to share their sound with  all their fans across the country. 
  • The boys did a mini east tour last year and are anxious to get back out there and see everyone. And surf some east coast waves too.

Risks & Challenges

We are young surfers and musicians living is Southern California making low wages surviving in the daily grind.

  • Were hoping to get our music out there and spread the Tunnel Vision Love. 
  • We already have a ton of shows booked as you can see above and we are hoping to add more where we can.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand if you can't afford to contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
story_txt:
We are Tunnel Vision

Last year Tunnel Vision did a did a mini East Coast tour sidelining with surfboard 
shaper Matt Biolos, and Mike Reola of the Lost crew.  The boys are currently doing  this Indie GoGo Campaign to raise funds for their Self-Titled  Album Debut & Summer Tour. The band already has a long list of dates and venues booked see below. 
Tunnel Vision is quickly becoming Southern California’s  favorite new
 Surf, Reggae, Ska band. The band is comprised of five San Clemente 
musicians who grew up with instruments in their hands and skateboards 
and surfboards under their feet. Tunnel Vision originally formed as a 
three-piece band, with Hayden Hanson as the lead singer and guitarist, 
Jacob Hernandez on bass, and Tanner Payan on drums and additional 
vocals. The three have been long time friends, who grew up in South San 
Clemente’s Trestles neighborhood surfing waves and riding concrete 
bowls.
Growing up in SoCal, the band was heavily influenced by the Punk 
Rock, Reggae and Ska Music of  bands like Sublime, Slightly Stoopid, 
NoFX, Rancid and Mad Caddies. The boys have all worked in the surf 
industry for years, starting out in retail for Rip Curl and moving on to
 manufacturing surfboards for Lost Enterprises.
Tunnel Vision recently increased the band from a three-piece to a 
five-piece by adding Doug Alani and Matt Risley. Matt Risely  & Doug
 both met the guys through their connections with Lost’s retail store 
Catalyst. Matt comes down from his mountain cabin with his wolf in tow 
and plays keyboards with the band.  While Doug brings saxophone to the 
sound of Tunnel Vision.The boys recently connected with Miles, Kyle 
& Dela of Slightly Stoopid.  Slightly Stoopid took the boys under 
their wing and let them record the rest of their album at the Slightly 
Stoopid Studios in San Diego. The boys were also picked up by Whiskey Barrel Records through the help of their Manager Anthony Levato. The Self titled album is rolling 
out in July 2015.You can hear some of Tunnel Vision’s music now on the website under 
The Music Tab.  Make sure to sign up for their email list and follow 
them on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. All the summer show dates are listed on 
the home page. 
   Booked Shows

story:
Welcome to My IndieGogo 

Hi Everybody!

I’m Jane Frank, and I’m here to talk to you about why you should support my debut album, The Big Squeeze. I’ve been writing songs for about 14 years now. I bought my first guitar and started writing songs, and since then, I’ve really grown as an artist. I picked up keyboard a few years ago, and now write multiple parts and harmonies for songs, and play with a full backing band.

I’ve been involved in the Bay Area music scene here in Berkeley, Oakland, and San Francisco for five years. In 2016, I released my debut The Good and Bad ep, produced by Tommy P. of Harlow’s Monkey’s, who is the same producer of my album, at 11th Avenue Studios in San Francisco. He’s a good friend of mine, super talented, and I’m very happy to be working with him again. We have lain down rough tracks for 11 songs for what’s going to be my first full length album. The record is set to be released in June. 

I have all kinds of influences from the 50’s to the present such as Buddy Holly, Weezer, Rilo Kiley, Blondie (thanks, Mom!), and Ingrid Michaelson. I’m a big 80s fan, big 90s alternative and r&b fan, and I think all of it’s in there, and that Tommy and I did a good job of bringing all these influences together, and that all the songs are very different.

How You Can Help

The main costs to finish the album are going to be mixing, mastering, and design, manufacturing, and distribution. Vinyl is expensive, but I love records, so I really wanted to make my record available on vinyl for people who want to have it. The more pre-orders I sell, the more I can spend on mixing and mastering the album, which is important. The more contributions I get will also make a difference surrounding how many initial CDs and records I can order. 

If you can’t donate, the best thing to do to help is to just share this. Tell people about me and my album and what I’m trying to do, and share the link to this campaign.

What’s In It For You?

Lots of perks! I will be doing everything from releasing the title track,  “The Big Squeeze,” as a digital single in advance of the album release, stickers, records, CDs, and mp3s. I really love to do lettering and doodling, so I will do a hand-drawn lyric book just for you as one of the rewards. Another reward is I will cover a song of your choosing on video. I am also offering a reward of your choice of an original short story or poem, since writing is another passion of mine, and long before I wrote music I was always a writer. I will also be writing thank-you cards, and you will have a chance to receive a shout out at my record release show on Facebook Live, as well as be mentioned for your contribution in the liner notes.

Where Else Would the Funding Go?

In addition to the design, mixing, mastering, and manufacturing of the album, another thing the funding can make possible is a tour. I’m from Houston, and last year I organized a concert series to help people I knew, and some people I didn’t know, who were severely impacted by Hurricane Harvey. We raised more than $5,000 for ten families. (You can learn more about that here.) I will be doing a show in Houston in July, and would love to do a Texas tour with stops in Austin, Dallas, and San Antonio while I am there! I would also like to tour the Bay Area, the West Coast, and the Northeast, anywhere from D.C. to New York! You can help make it happen!

Risks

There are no risks involved regarding your contribution to this project. I have set a flexible goal, because I'm going to release this record no matter what. That said, your pre-release contribution is going to help me tremendously. It will make a difference in everything from the final product in terms of the quality of the mixing and mastering to how much I can pay the design and layout people to how many CDs and vinyl records I can pay to be manufactured up front; and whether I can have t-shirts made and how many of those I can order up front; and whether I can afford to play a few shows in the Bay Area and pay people to back me; to whether I can do a Texas tour this summer and play for my friends and family in Houston, Austin, and Dallas-Ft. Worth, and San Antonio. If you would like to see me succeed, and if you would like to have a copy of my record, the best time to support me is now.

My Intention

I want to emphasize that I love what music can do for people’s lives. My intention is to help people. A lot of my songs are either fun, pop/rock songs to give people a good time, or express something I really think about that I think might help somebody else.

THANK YOU!

I really hope you enjoy my music, and will check it out, and please support me. I thank you very much for watching/reading! To everyone who has supported me along the way in any form or fashion, from the purchase of my first guitar until now, I'll always be grateful.

Xoxo!

Jane

story:
BORN INTO STRANGE TIMES

We are a four-piece rock band from London. We sit in the awkward middle point between post-hardcore, math rock, and indie*. We’ve been compared to the likes of At The Drive-in, Minus the Bear and Everything Everything.

After years of touring the UK, and life occasionally getting in the way, we have FINALLY finished work on our debut album. It is the culmination of years of work and we couldn’t be prouder of the result. We can’t wait for you all to hear this thing.

We’ve spent all the blood**, sweat***, and money**** we have on this product. We need your help with the final stages of the release. So we are coming cap in hand to you.

Please don’t judge us too harshly for it. It’ll all be worth it in the end (we promise).

A CURSE FROM YEARS GONE BY

We are seeking to raise around £2,000 to:

  1. Fund a run of 12” vinyl with lovely packaging - £1,200 (the more we raise the more we can press!)
  2. Fund a small marketing campaign for the record - £800

Any extra money we raise will go towards expanding the marketing campaign, doing a longer run of vinyl or producing more cool stuff for all of you.

We don’t want something for nothing. In return for your support we are offering a special discount to pre-orders of the vinyl and merch bundles, as well as unique items and experiences.

If you pledge anything at all, we will love you forever.

If you can’t pledge anything, then please spread the word to anyone you think might be interested. If you do, we will still love you*****

Thank you so much for your support and for helping us make this dream real!

Love – DATP

-----

*Yes, it is possible to have a mid-point between three things. It’s called triangulation******, which coincidently rhymes with “strangulation”.

**Metaphorical

***Literal

****All too literal

*****For about six months. Once the initial wave of infatuation wears off we’ll probably decide that it would be better for the both of us if we were just friends.

******I am informed that I have misused “triangulation”, it is in fact the process by which the source of a signal is identified by comparing the direction it arrives from three points. It still rhymes with “strangulation”.

story:
Short Summary

After getting together to hang out and jam, the members of All My Sons quickly decided to put together a band that marries elements of blues, rock, and your dad's old collection of 1970's records. A handful of live shows and a BUNCH of incredible opportunities later, we're ready to put some of our original music out into the world.

What We Need & What You Get

Turns out, recording an album in New York can be expensive. Luckily for us, we've been able to raise some funds through boking live shows. Unluckily for us, we still have some more to raise. The main components of the campaigns are as follows:

  • Fundraising goal of $2,500.
  • Exclusive perks from All My Sons with each campaign contribution, including album pre-sale, exclusive merch, and access to the studio. 
  • Updates from the band concerning the recording and making of our debut album. 

Risks & Challenges

We aim to record this album towards the end of October, however, due to the ever-changing nature of New York real estate, this could potentially be pushed back by a few weeks. We, as a band, promise to be transparent about our progress, and are so excited to get this album out to you all.
