story:
The ancient Greek Lyre of the 5th century B.C. exists again after 2500 years!!!

 

For the first time in the world, Michalis Georgiou from the island of Cyprus reconstructs the ancient Greek lyre of Apollo and makes it available to the public. Musicians, researchers, music schools, universities, museums, collectors and fans of ancient Greek civilization, can now enjoy the sound of this magical instrument resurrected from classical antiquity.

The lyre as reconstructed by Mr. Georgiou, is a perfect replica of an eight-string lyre of the 5th century B.C. Respecting the international regulations for the protection of various species, Mr. Georgiou does not use animal parts in the process of the reconstruction of ancient Greek lyre. The turtle shells used for these instruments are exact copies of an original turtle shell, made of  specific chemical mixtures of resins, providing the same quality of sound, resonance and color as the original turtle shell. The string holder is made from the same chemical mixture. The other parts of the instrument are made of solid wood. The strings are of PVC plastic. These strings are more durable than the gut strings used by ancient Greeks and provide the same quality of sound as gut strings. The instrument has also a leather strap for holding purposes and a plectrum made of hard wood.

The ancient Greek lyre can be characterized as a “friendly musical instrument” for any one. It doesn’t need to know about music or playing musical instruments. Just plug the strings of the lyre for a few minutes and feel calm. The unique sound of this instrument enriched with many harmonic resonances will guide your soul to meditation. The ancient Greek physician Asclepius healed his patients with the sounds of the lyre.

The reconstruction and availability of ancient Greek lyre to the public, is an attempt concerning the vision of the revival of ancient Greek music and musical instruments from the classical antiquity. The existence of ancient Greek lyre, an educational instrument for the youngsters in ancient Greece, aims to enrich the knowledge of ancient Greek musical educational system and bring awareness to musical educational programs  in our times as well.

Orpheus, son of Apollo, plays his lyre, as shown on a vase painting of the Greek Classical antiquity.

The major stories about Orpheus are centered on his ability to charm all living beings and even stones with his music.

 

A “friendly musical instrument” for any one

A “friendly musical instrument”. It's sound can guide your soul to meditation.

 

Ancient Greek music can sound again

The ancient Greek Lyre is alive again after 2500 years. All fans of ancient Greek civilization can now enjoy its magical sound and travel in the golden time of harmony. 

 

"Hey Jude" by The Beatles accompanied by the ancient Greek lyre

A valuable musical instrument for museums, composers, musicians (especially for those who interested for experimental musical instruments), sound production studios and film makers.

 

Details and photos about perks

IMPORTANT! 

Your donations can be provided from PayPal accounts in any currency. PayPal will inform you about the exchange rate of your currency to Australian dollars (AUD) prior to the donation.

 

 

1) Featured perk - "Thank you" card, DVD Lyre

 

DVD presenting the history and the reconstruction of the ancient Greek lyre by Mr. Georgiou.

 

2) "Thank You" Card, Logo on clay

Logo of maker on clay.

 

3) "Thank You" card, Demo DVD

Demo DVD with the “Terpandros” ensemble of ancient Greek musical instruments presenting music from the antiquity, from Medieval times, folk music and contemporary Greek music.

 

4) "Thank you" card, DVD Kithara

DVD presenting the history and the reconstruction of Apollo’s Kithara by Mr. Georgiou.

 

5) "Thank you"card, clay ceistron

Replica of clay ceistron, a percussion instrument of the 5th century B.C.,  found in the island of Crete.

 

6) "Thank You" card, book

A book titled "Quest of the resonance of universe" published in Greek and English languages, presenting the 30 year research by Mr. Georgiou in the reconstruction of ancient Greek musical instruments. Sound samples of the instruments in a CD included in the book.

 

 

7) "Thank you" card, 3 DVDs

       a) A demo DVD with the “Terpandros” ensemble of ancient Greek musical instruments presenting music from the antiquity, from Medieval times, folk music and contemporary Greek music.
       b) A DVD presenting the history and the reconstruction of the ancient Greek lyre.
       c) A DVD presenting the history and the reconstruction of Apollo’s Kithara.

 

    

 

8) Ultimate Perk (All Included)

      a) Personal "Thank You" card, 
      b) Logo on clay, 
      c) DVD with the “Terpandros” ensemble, 
      d) DVD presenting the reconstruction of the ancient Greek lyre, 
      e) DVD presenting the reconstruction of Apollo’s Kithara,
      f) A replica of a clay ceistron of the 5th century B.C., 
      g) A book titled "Quest of the resonance of universe" published in Greek and English languages, presenting the 30 year research by Michalis Georgiou in reconstruction of ancient Greek musical instruments.
story_txt: The ancient Greek Lyre of the 5th century B.C. exists again after 2500 years!!! For the first time in the world, Michalis Georgiou from the island of Cyprus reconstructs the ancient Greek lyre of Apollo and makes it available to the public. Musicians, researchers, music schools, universities, museums, collectors and fans of ancient Greek civilization, can now enjoy the sound of this magical instrument resurrected from classical antiquity.The lyre as reconstructed by Mr. Georgiou, is a perfect replica of an eight-string lyre of the 5th century B.C. Respecting the international regulations for the protection of various species, Mr. Georgiou does not use animal parts in the process of the reconstruction of ancient Greek lyre. The turtle shells used for these instruments are exact copies of an original turtle shell, made of  specific chemical mixtures of resins, providing the same quality of sound, resonance and color as the original turtle shell. The string holder is made from the same chemical mixture. The other parts of the instrument are made of solid wood. The strings are of PVC plastic. These strings are more durable than the gut strings used by ancient Greeks and provide the same quality of sound as gut strings. The instrument has also a leather strap for holding purposes and a plectrum made of hard wood.The ancient Greek lyre can be characterized as a “friendly musical instrument” for any one. It doesn’t need to know about music or playing musical instruments. Just plug the strings of the lyre for a few minutes and feel calm. The unique sound of this instrument enriched with many harmonic resonances will guide your soul to meditation. The ancient Greek physician Asclepius healed his patients with the sounds of the lyre.The reconstruction and availability of ancient Greek lyre to the public, is an attempt concerning the vision of the revival of ancient Greek music and musical instruments from the classical antiquity. The existence of ancient Greek lyre, an educational instrument for the youngsters in ancient Greece, aims to enrich the knowledge of ancient Greek musical educational system and bring awareness to musical educational programs  in our times as well.Orpheus, son of Apollo, plays his lyre, as shown on a vase painting of the Greek Classical antiquity.The major stories about Orpheus are centered on his ability to charm all living beings and even stones with his music. A “friendly musical instrument” for any oneA “friendly musical instrument”. It's sound can guide your soul to meditation. Ancient Greek music can sound againThe ancient Greek Lyre is alive again after 2500 years. All fans of ancient Greek civilization can now enjoy its magical sound and travel in the golden time of harmony.  "Hey Jude" by The Beatles accompanied by the ancient Greek lyreA valuable musical instrument for museums, composers, musicians (especially for those who interested for experimental musical instruments), sound production studios and film makers. Details and photos about perksIMPORTANT! Your donations can be provided from PayPal accounts in any currency. PayPal will inform you about the exchange rate of your currency to Australian dollars (AUD) prior to the donation.  1) Featured perk - "Thank you" card, DVD Lyre DVD presenting the history and the reconstruction of the ancient Greek lyre by Mr. Georgiou. 2) "Thank You" Card, Logo on clayLogo of maker on clay. 3) "Thank You" card, Demo DVDDemo DVD with the “Terpandros” ensemble of ancient Greek musical instruments presenting music from the antiquity, from Medieval times, folk music and contemporary Greek music. 4) "Thank you" card, DVD KitharaDVD presenting the history and the reconstruction of Apollo’s Kithara by Mr. Georgiou. 5) "Thank you"card, clay ceistronReplica of clay ceistron, a percussion instrument of the 5th century B.C.,  found in the island of Crete. 6) "Thank You" card, bookA book titled "Quest of the resonance of universe" published in Greek and English languages, presenting the 30 year research by Mr. Georgiou in the reconstruction of ancient Greek musical instruments. Sound samples of the instruments in a CD included in the book.  7) "Thank you" card, 3 DVDs       a) A demo DVD with the “Terpandros” ensemble of ancient Greek musical instruments presenting music from the antiquity, from Medieval times, folk music and contemporary Greek music.       b) A DVD presenting the history and the reconstruction of the ancient Greek lyre.       c) A DVD presenting the history and the reconstruction of Apollo’s Kithara.      8) Ultimate Perk (All Included)      a) Personal "Thank You" card,       b) Logo on clay,       c) DVD with the “Terpandros” ensemble,       d) DVD presenting the reconstruction of the ancient Greek lyre,       e) DVD presenting the reconstruction of Apollo’s Kithara,      f) A replica of a clay ceistron of the 5th century B.C.,       g) A book titled "Quest of the resonance of universe" published in Greek and English languages, presenting the 30 year research by Michalis Georgiou in reconstruction of ancient Greek musical instruments.

story:
Why Support?

There is something restless inside of me trying to get out. It comes out in pieces. Tiny, sometimes unnoticeable pieces. I'm 25 with a lot of life to live and a lot of work to put in to get it all out. I believe chasing a dream of putting out a full-length studio album and visual album will shed some light on why this restlessness is in me. I think theres a good chance that creating is what I'm supposed to be doing. Maybe I just need a reason to fully believe in this. I made a promise to myself that I would take the risks necessary to come to life this year. That's what I'm doing.

This is about community. mutuality. respect. supporting music in Boston. supporting a message in hopes of it becoming a movement. This is supporting my passion and my dream in hopes that it benefits you the same. 

What I Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I'm raising $5 ,000 to help with the creation of the audio and visual albums. The rest of the uncovered costs will come out of my pockets, from merch, and from miracles.
  • Based on what you donate, you can receive #SayHerName t-shirts, Roxbury State of Mind apparel, free admission to the album release party, and a copy of the finished product to your e-mail before it is officially released. 

The Impact

I expect that if I put my heart and every drop of sweat I have into this project, that you will see the potential you saw in me maximized. You will have a project that we built together; something that will last; something that is a reflection of US. I hope it inspires people, challenges people, makes you upset. I just want you to feel something because of the work we put into it. 

Also, I plan to use the funds to PAY Boston-based artists to help me put together this project. It is incredibly hard to do the work of creating art in our city without having to give something up. My hope is to make something that is collaborative in this way so we can all eat. 

Risks & Challenges

Me. Funds.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute financially doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Help me get the word out and share this campaign with other people.
  • What is your art? How can we collaborate?

story:
Short Summary

The Camden Renaissance is here. Building on several high-profile projects like

the Nipper and Victor buildings, Adventure Aquarium, Cooper Hospital and Rutgers and Rowan Universities, the city is now ready for a major restaurant and entertainment venue.  The Camden Jazz Club will help anchor and expand the ongoing renaissance.

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $10 million to purchase/build a home for the Camden Jazz Club and to fund initial operations until revenues cover costs.  As a contributor, you will receive a Jazz Club Membership that will entitle you to: access to exclusive events; discounts on tickets, food and drink; presale tickets for special events and much more. 

The Impact

This project is important to the City of Camden which is in full recovery and renaissance.  The Club will fully engage with the community through music and education programs. We are currently in discussions with key community partners to shore up their support. 

Risk & Challenges 

Opening a jazz club in Camden offers a lot of benefits like affordability but there are obvious drawbacks.  Security will be a number one priority for the Club. It will also engage with the community to ensure full support from local resident, employers and other businesses.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread the word about this campaign.  We are also looking for partners to help us make this project a reality.

story:
Short Summary

Hi. My name is Marc Mullins and I've been writing and performing Christian music since the late 1970s when I first entered the pastoral ministry. For the past 36 years people have been asking when I was going to record an album of my original music. You've heard the saying, "Better late than never." Well... that saying has finally come true for me as I begin my first professional recording project.

I've hired the services of Upshot Studios to record, mix and master a full-length music CD that will feature 10-13 of my most favored and requested songs. This project is a fully professional endeavor and the result will be a music album that will bless and uplift people in their own life journeys. There's not a specific release date yet, but I'm aiming to get the record out in the Spring of 2016. The album will be available in a standard CD edition as well as a digital version.

What We Need & What You Get

Although I've already committed some of my own financial resources to this project, I'm seeking an additional $10,000 to cover other costs associated with recording, mixing and mastering this music CD. This amount will also help pay for the studio musicians who will join me in the making of this album and for the cost of the perks and postage.

In order to help me raise the necessary funds to complete this recording project I've decided to invite people like you to join me in this venture. There are several benefits and distinct advantages for you when you partner with me in this campaign. Your early support will grant you access to exclusive items and experiences not available anywhere else.

First, contributors will receive perks that are only available through this Indiegogo campaign. Your partnership in this project is especially important to me and I want to provide you with some tangible expression of my gratitude. Therefore, you will find a variety of perk awards on this page that you can receive depending on the level of your support contribution.

Additionally, since many of the awards include a digital copy of the album, you can get a digital copy sent to you in advance of the date that the music CD is available for distribution. This means that you will be among the first to actually receive and hear the music in its professionally mastered form.

Furthermore, by coming back to this site you will see behind-the-scenes footage of this project from beginning to end in the studio and more. Using high definition video equipment, I will take you with me to experience the fascinating process of making a music album from start to finish. It will be as though you're right there with the band and me in the studio. And I assure you that this is one journey you'll appreciate for a long time to come.

Finally, you'll get to experience with me the making of my first-ever music video. One of the songs on the album will be selected and featured in a full-length music video that is sure to bless you and others. And just think, it will be as though you're right there with me when you watch video clips that show the making of this music video in action. I'm more than excited to take you along with me on this journey!

The Impact

My friend, Jacque Talboy, said it best when interviewed by UpShot Studio for the making of this music album. She said, "I would love to have copies of Marc's songs to pop into my car, or share with my friends or my family, or a loved one who just needs a lift."

I assure you... Jacque knows what she's talking about. Her husband, Rob, was a professional studio musician in Los Angeles for many years and a member of my praise and worship band more recently. And Jacque served as our praise band's sound technician. Her ear for good music is quite remarkable. So when she says my music is good, you can trust her word for it. And when she says that people will be blessed when they listen to this album, that's as good as any iron-clad guarantee!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? Don't worry! You can still help. Spread the word about this campaign and my new album on your Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, blog, or whatever your preferred method of social media is. You can use the Indiegogo share tools located near the top left of this page to help me get the word out about this campaign.

Plus, your prayers will help, too. I know that this music CD will bless people, enrich their lives and draw them closer to God as they listen to the songs, whether at home, in the car, at work or wherever.

story:
Senseless' debut record & The Living On Land Tour.

My first tour to promote my first album, Living On Land.

My name is Jacob Engle and I make music. Hip-Hop music to be more specific. From an early age I became a student of the culture, beginning with the Def Jux/ Rhymesayers era and learning in reverse from there. As nontraditional as it may seem, it feels like it is about that time to create a journey of our own and would love nothing more than for us to be on this ride together.

The Breakdown.

No one has done this alone, and unfortunately love can't pay the bills but...

  • After traveling consistently for so long we do hope that love of art will translate to (just enough) money for pockets, in turn continuing toward the collective goal of making music and hitting the road with it.
  • In order to get to this plain of stability, we must humble ourselves in asking for a small favor in good faith.

The Impact

We like it when people are comfortable in their own skin.

  • Traveling city-to-city feels like a chance to show surrounding areas of piece of what Columbus has to offer.
  • Living On Land feels very well-received on a local level from the shows to an article in our local paper, Columbus Alive. That being said, for starters, we would love to see what would come from the rest of the Midwest.
  • Help us achieve our goal and we get to be like, "Oh yeah, those are the awesome people that totally donated to our crowd funding campaign. They kick @$$."

Risks & Challenges

This is what we love, but that doesn't mean it is going to be easy. More often than not, people believe that tour is just one big party. We can enjoy ourselves but it isn't just fun and games.

  • Resilience describes best to me the experience of an independent tour - especially the first few times around the block.
  • We are prepared for the worst while we hope for the best, grateful for any help we may be fortunate enough to receive along the way.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that pockets can be tight, trust me. If you are unable to donate monetarily but feel that you want to help in some way, shape, or form, here are a couple of things that can still help tremendously:

  • Spread the word about Living On Land and the tour that is to be in a city near you ideally this spring, and/or
  • If you've got an extra couch or warm meal with open door and heart, we would love to come hang out for the night to share stories, relax, and enjoy the company!

And that's all there is to it.

Love you. ;D


-also, thanks to Carlos Roa of @RoaStudios for designing the artwork for the Living On Land shirts and for being a part of the beginning of the video for our IndieGoGo campaign.

story:
Debut Solo Album Internal Affairs Is Due This April


It's been a long time in the making, I've been chipping away at it for about a year. The Recent death of my Idol David Bowie was a catalyst to get me to finish it, It is my first full-length vocal CD. It is very Bowie influenced. It's my hope that you'll recognize this and love the album.


Funding 

Studio cost is expensive , fortunately I have my own studio where I can Track mix and master. I'm trying to stick to a budget .
I will need $75 to set up digital distribution 
I will need about $ 500 for CD and Graphic Arts 
I will Need approx $ 500 for promo videos and promotion

The Impact

Internal Affairs is an album I'm very proud of. Musically it is a mix of Modern Rock and electronic pop. I'm very excited and proud as I played all the instruments, and I am handling the mixing and mastering . I have only one other person involved in the album singing background and lead on 1 song .

Risks & Challenges

Artists are very sensitive I know, I have released over 20 albums with my Arctic Zone Project and the band Claire On A Dare, as well as a few other things. The risks are pretty easy to understand, with streaming most people do not buy a lot of music and let's face it the market is over saturated. I'm not famous and I don't have a real following as a solo artist. I'm making music for the therapeutic value. I can live with not being a star and not making money , however I do not wish to lose money, which is my reason for this campaign.

Other Ways You Can Help

Support My Band Claire On A Dare by seeing a show and buying a CD .

Support The Arctic Zone by buying a CD on Itunes , 

In General support local artists, Bands live and die by the support that they receive from people.

story:
The Sound.

We realize that suggesting that we're creating an EP that transcends musical genres is a bold statement. We've given you just a taste of what that will be like through the score to our Kickstarter video that you just watched. We co-wrote the score for this short, and we're excited to be combining band (rhythm section), choir, and orchestra in a fresh way on each of our tunes.

And, even more specifically: here's the demo of "Every Word", and "Lo, He Cometh", two of the new songs that will be featured on our album.

https://soundcloud.com/slowly-in-type-music/every-word-full-demo

https://soundcloud.com/slowly-in-type-music/lo-he-cometh-short-demo

Timeless Texts.

New Melodies. 

Colorful Orchestrations.

We are embarking on a journey to create something that has never been done quite like this. Through the combined efforts of over 150 musicians, we are bringing texts to life that proclaim the Gospel through a musical palate that transcends genres. Every note and rest is carefully arranged to dramatically magnify the text. We believe that the church is at a strategic musical crossroads in which the divides between genre, demographic, and preference continue to grow, and if not addressed will cause the rift to remain, or styles to simply be phased out in their entirety. We believe that this album, by God's grace, is the first of our offerings towards bridging the gap. 

We believe that the most compelling music in the world should be coming from within the Church. Bach and his Christian contemporaries achieved this, not only through aesthetic appeal or commercial acclaim, but through excellence in craft and execution that continues to transcend boundaries of intellect, age, or style. We hold fast to this heritage and aim for such excellence.

The recording serves as the keystone to Slowly in Type's other resources (including scores and parts) for utilization in the church. The album is a potent resource for music departments and congregations alike. We also plan to make “stems” (isolated tracks) for each song available to supplement any church's ensemble (of varying sizes and ability) to help realize the songs in their fullest context. 

The Budget.

48% - 60 piece orchestra, 80 voice choir, 6 piece rhythm section 
38% - Recording Studios, Engineers, Mixing, Mastering, Orchestration, Music Preparation, Producer 
9% - Crowdfunding Fees 
5% - Copyrights, Duplication, Shipping

Making an album is costly when Choir, Orchestra, and Band are involved. We’ve optimized the budget without compromising on the essential elements.

Who We Are. 

Ryan Foglesong is a worship leader at Grace Baptist Church in Santa Clarita CA, a songwriter and bass player for the band Enfield, and an adjunct faculty member at The Master’s College. Since 2011, he has helped arrange songs for and play bass on several Sovereign Grace albums including “From Age to Age,” and “Grace Has Come.” He also teaches seminars at Worship God, an annual national conference for church musicians.

Ryan is a gifted lyricist and melodist and ensures that the pieces we produce are singable, accessible, and original. 

Grant Fonda is an award-winning composer and orchestrator in the Film Industry and the concert world. He holds degrees in Music Composition from The Master's College, The University of Missouri-Columbia, and The University of Southern California (USC). Grant has extensive experience writing for and leading groups of all mediums from across the United States, and has worked as a composer and orchestrator on a myriad of projects in the Film Industry. He has collaborated with several Oscar and Grammy nominated composers, and has extensive experience leading music in churches of varying sizes and styles. 

Grant applies his dramatic sensibilities and orchestration chops to each tune from Slowly in Type to make sure that the arrangements dramatically and musically support the text through charts that are simultaneously accessible and exacting of a high standard of musicianship from each player.

Scott Frankfurt is our Grammy-nominated Producer for the project. Scott has collaborated with recording artists including Whitney Houston, Barbara Streisand, Sergio Mendes, Yo-Yo Ma, and Jeremy Lubbock.  He has been instrumental in bringing the records of Enfield to life, and brings invaluable studio savvy, artistry, industry wisdom, and creativity to this album. You can read more about Scott and his studio here. 

Follow us! 

Check us out on the Web: www.slowlyintype.com
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/slowlyintype
Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/slowlyintype
Soundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/slowly-in-type-music/

Thanks for your support!

Risks and challenges

The biggest challenge that we face on this project is realizing the funds for an orchestra. As we mentioned above, recording the orchestra is the largest expense for the album, but we are committed to reach for the dynamics, authenticity and grandeur that only a live orchestra can bring.
story_txt:
The Sound.We realize that suggesting that we're creating an EP that transcends musical genres is a bold statement. We've given you just a taste of what that will be like through the score to our Kickstarter video that you just watched. We co-wrote the score for this short, and we're excited to be combining band (rhythm section), choir, and orchestra in a fresh way on each of our tunes.
And, even more specifically: here's the demo of "Every Word", and "Lo, He Cometh", two of the new songs that will be featured on our album.
https://soundcloud.com/slowly-in-type-music/every-word-full-demo
https://soundcloud.com/slowly-in-type-music/lo-he-cometh-short-demo



Timeless Texts.

New Melodies. 
Colorful Orchestrations.
We are embarking on a journey to create something that has never been done quite like this. Through the combined efforts of over 150 musicians, we are bringing texts to life that proclaim the Gospel through a musical palate that transcends genres. Every note and rest is carefully arranged to dramatically magnify the text. We believe that the church is at a strategic musical crossroads in which the divides between genre, demographic, and preference continue to grow, and if not addressed will cause the rift to remain, or styles to simply be phased out in their entirety. We believe that this album, by God's grace, is the first of our offerings towards bridging the gap. 
We believe that the most compelling music in the world should be coming from within the Church. Bach and his Christian contemporaries achieved this, not only through aesthetic appeal or commercial acclaim, but through excellence in craft and execution that continues to transcend boundaries of intellect, age, or style. We hold fast to this heritage and aim for such excellence.
The recording serves as the keystone to Slowly in Type's other resources (including scores and parts) for utilization in the church. The album is a potent resource for music departments and congregations alike. We also plan to make “stems” (isolated tracks) for each song available to supplement any church's ensemble (of varying sizes and ability) to help realize the songs in their fullest context. 
The Budget.
48% - 60 piece orchestra, 80 voice choir, 6 piece rhythm section 38% - Recording Studios, Engineers, Mixing, Mastering, Orchestration, Music Preparation, Producer 9% - Crowdfunding Fees 5% - Copyrights, Duplication, Shipping

Who We Are. 
Ryan Foglesong is a worship leader at Grace Baptist Church in Santa Clarita CA, a songwriter and bass player for the band Enfield, and an adjunct faculty member at The Master’s College. Since 2011, he has helped arrange songs for and play bass on several Sovereign Grace albums including “From Age to Age,” and “Grace Has Come.” He also teaches seminars at Worship God, an annual national conference for church musicians.
Ryan is a gifted lyricist and melodist and ensures that the pieces we produce are singable, accessible, and original. 

Ryan leading worship with Enfield at the Resolved Conference...and here's a link to an arrangement of "Holy, Holy, Holy" by Ryan. 

Grant Fonda is an award-winning composer and orchestrator in the Film Industry and the concert world. He holds degrees in Music Composition from The Master's College, The University of Missouri-Columbia, and The University of Southern California (USC). Grant has extensive experience writing for and leading groups of all mediums from across the United States, and has worked as a composer and orchestrator on a myriad of projects in the Film Industry. He has collaborated with several Oscar and Grammy nominated composers, and has extensive experience leading music in churches of varying sizes and styles. 
Grant applies his dramatic sensibilities and orchestration chops to each tune from Slowly in Type to make sure that the arrangements dramatically and musically support the text through charts that are simultaneously accessible and exacting of a high standard of musicianship from each player.

Grant leading a 65 piece orchestra at the 20th Century Fox Newman Scoring Stage (Los Angeles) Click HERE to hear the recording from that session (all work composed and orchestrated by Grant).


Grant leading a large orchestra at the Eastwood Scoring Stage, Warner Brothers Studios, Burbank

Scott Frankfurt is our Grammy-nominated Producer for the project. Scott has collaborated with recording artists including Whitney Houston, Barbara Streisand, Sergio Mendes, Yo-Yo Ma, and Jeremy Lubbock.  He has been instrumental in bringing the records of Enfield to life, and brings invaluable studio savvy, artistry, industry wisdom, and creativity to this album. You can read more about Scott and his studio here. 

"Slowly In Type is committed to doing this right and swinging for the fences. I couldn’t imagine two finer men for the purpose - that’s why I’m involved, and urge you to consider the same." - Scott Frankfurt

Follow us! 
Check us out on the Web: www.slowlyintype.comFacebook: https://www.facebook.com/slowlyintypeTwitter: http://www.twitter.com/slowlyintypeSoundcloud: https://soundcloud.com/slowly-in-type-music/
Thanks for your support!


Risks and challenges
The biggest challenge that we face on this project is realizing the funds for an orchestra. As we mentioned above, recording the orchestra is the largest expense for the album, but we are committed to reach for the dynamics, authenticity and grandeur that only a live orchestra can bring.

story:
"Bring You Home"

We are insanely excited to be able to finally get this BRAND NEW LP out to you all! This has been a couple of years in the making and we can't thank you all enough for your continued support!

We are also excited to be partnering with the wonderful Day Old Blues Records for this release. James at DOB has believed in us from day one and continues to be a driving force in our musical community.

Pre-Ordering:

Everyone who pre-orders the album is actually helping the over all pressing of the record, which is why we want to not only give you the vinyl, but also throw in a couple of extras.

Your Pre-Order Will Include:

 * 10 song LP
 * A CD copy of the album (pre-order only)
 * A digital download link for a brand new song from the upcoming album, which means you get to hear a new song before anyone else, PLUS you'll get a second song we've never released (pre-order only)
 * A fold out dual sided poster which will feature all of the lyrics from the album

Don't have the funds to pre-order right now? THAT'S OKAY! Please help us by sharing this page with your friends and family and your social networks! That really does make a world of difference for us!

    We really cannot continue making music without you and we cannot express how much we appreciate each and every one of you who keep us afloat. Thank you. We can't wait to share what's next.

    **Mid-July is expected release date.

story:
Short Summary

We are The Opskamatrists, a Ska-Reggae-Punk band from Idaho Falls, ID. We have been at this SKA thing for 20 years now and want to celebrate 20 years of skanking with you. Over the last 20 years we have had over 20 different musicians join and play in the band and they are one of the reasons why we have been able to keep this thing alive and kicking for so long. The other big reason is you - the fans!

This is why we need your help! We are putting on a show to celebrate the last 20 years of The Opskamatrists and the people who have contributed to the music. Most of those musicians who have been in the band have moved on in life to start careers and families in different parts of the USA. We want to bring as many of those members back for this show as possible, and they will need plane tickets or gas money to get to Idaho Falls to participate. YOU CAN HELP GET THEM HERE BY CONTRIBUTING TO THIS CAMPAIGN!

 

What We Need & What You Get

All we need is a little help from you and this will be the greatest show we have ever played. The money you contribute will be used to help your favorite former Opskamatrist make it to the show to play the songs they helped write while in the band (they will be coming by plane, car, boat and even on foot!). 

In exchange for your contribution we have some SPECIAL EDITION swag! 20 year logo t-shirts, vintage re-boot hats, stickers, and buttons and even a new live album, which will be released in conjunction with the event! You will also be able to buy your ticket to the show right here with your contribution and have it mailed to your front door. This swag is so cool! You don't want to miss out!

 

The Impact

SKA is NOT dead! It is still alive and kicking and that is all because of amazing people like you! By contributing you are screaming to the world that you are a SKA FAN!! and you Support Your Local SKA Band. Let's keep Ska and The Opskamatrists around for many more years to come!! Contribute what you can now! Thank You!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't make it to the show (we will miss you), please contribute to this campaign! We need everyone's help to make this work. 

Please spread the word with everyone you know. The whole world needs SKA and The Opskamatrists! so use your mad social media skills to spread the good word of SKA and The Opskamatrists to the world!

story:
Short Summary

Bushwick Book Club is going on its first international three-city tour (NYC/London/Malmo) with new songs inspired by London writer, Julia Gray's new novel, LITTLE LIAR.  Lusterlit is shepherding these events, and also visiting radio stations in the UK with their new 7" single inspired by Dame Darcy's MEAT CAKE BIBLE!  Lusterlit is the literary art-rock duo, born out of Bushwick Book Club.  Now, Charlie and Susan are bringing Bushwick Book Club to places it has never been--like London!  

What We Need & What You Get

  • This is going for travel costs and production - plane fare, car rental, promotion, accommodations and documentation of the shows (photographers, videographers, video and audio editing)  
  • We'll send you a note from an airport napkin from every airport we hit in our travels, and a setlist written on a bar napkin from some place outside of London.  Plus, the new Lusterlit 7" inspired by Dame Darcy's MEAT CAKE BIBLE, pressed at Brooklyn vinyl pressing plant, BrooklynPhono.   You'll get access to our preparation of new songs, Lusterlit objects of choice and ANSWERS!

The Impact

  • We're connecting artists, musicians and authors across continents. 
  • It's a culture-fest.  It's a smorgasbord of all the tastiest reasons to be alive - music, art, performance, food and literature, shared between people in time spent together, and also as documented, recorded work that can be visited and re-enjoyed later -- live albums of the shows, youtube and our BBC podcast produced by Lusterlit. 
  • Lusterlit just helped launch Bushwick Book Club Oakland this Labor Day weekend. Lusterlit also brought Bushwick Book Club to Portland, Oregon in 2016, funded by a successful Indiegogo campaign that year.  In addition to the monthly Bushwick Book Club literature-inspired shows, Lusterlit has also been actively producing  Bushwick Book Club podcasts available on iTunes and SoundCloud.  They also keep connected with the other active BBC chapters in Seattle, Los Angeles, Greenville, SC and Malmo Sweden. 
  • Bushwick Book Club and Lusterlit will keep making new songs about books and keep facilitating authors and artists to connect around the world. Things can look dark sometimes, but if you still believe that art can reach across time and distance to connect and energize people, you can experience that in a very real way by helping us with your support.  We're admittedly obsessive people.  We work tirelessly to further creativity through Lusterlit and Bushwick Book Club and songs about books.  We love to make things happen, and you can share in the thrill of this.  Your support is incredibly valuable.  So take a moment to visualize, to remember and acknowledge the joy you take in making something new.  Take a moment to dream.

story:
Short Summary

Hi, my name is Katie Hightower and for as long as I can remember, I've loved music. It has been an integral part of my life, getting me through some of my most difficult moments. And now, I've decided to pursue a lifelong dream and finish my own album. I began the album late this summer, however, I am switching jobs in 7 days and losing access to a computer powerful enough to record my own music. And I need your help: 

  • To Buy a Suitable Computer for my Home Studio and purchase the necessary software
  • To Pay for Professional Production Fees, Videography and Photography fees
  • To Pay for Advertisement and Distribution Fees

It would mean everything to me to make this happen. I never dreamed that I would be in a position to share my music with the world and with your help, I can. 

What I Need & What You Get

Here's what you get: 

  • 10$- A personalized thank you card, mailed to your house to express my gratitude for your contribution
  • 15$- A complimentary digital copy of my album and above
  • 25$- Acknowledgement credit in the album liner and all of the above
  • 100$ -  I'll write you your own song and record it and all of the above
  • Fully Fund the project and you'll get all of the above and a private concert for any event that you throw 
  • If I don't make my goal, the funds will still go toward the equipment and the production fees and the album will be put on hold until I can afford the necessary equipment.

Risks & Challenges

There is no guarantee that this album will even be worth listening to when it's done, but I'm willing to take that risk. 

  • I make music for people who love to listen to music, plain and simple. I'm not Bon Iver or Bob Dylan, I just wanna make your toes tap and put a smile on your face. 
  • I'm so confident that I'm funding 70% of the project on my own. That's 7500 dollars of production fees that I'll be shouldering because I want my music to be out in the world. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that sometimes you just can't contribute and that's okay but if you could share this post and talk to other people about my music, it would mean so much. 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Ain't Nobody got time for dat!

Don't have time to read EVERYTHING below?
No problemo, here's the cliffnotes :)

I'm Kris Bradley, a Nashville based singer/songwriter/producer from Los Angeles and I'm heading into the studio to record my new single "Sad Songs and Cigarettes".  I'm working with an incredibly talented producer and cannot WAIT to release this song!

In order for this to happen there are 3 things I'd love for you to do right now.

1.   Pick your reward

2.  Contribute

3.  Help spread the word!

Your support means the world to me!  From the bottom of my heart, thank you thank you!

Cheers,

Kris Bradley

 

So where's this money going and what do you get?

All funds go towards studio time at the world famous Sound Kitchen, mixing and mastering, videographer, photoshoot, web design, distribution, download cards, fees to indie gogo, and social media marketing.  If the goal is passed, even MORE will go into social media marketing.  In today's music industry, more money should go into the marketing than making the record, ain't that some shhhhh ? 

Who's Kris Bradley?

I'm a full time singer/songwriter/producer living and chasing the dream here in Nashville.  Whether I'm working on my own songs, producing/developing other artists, performing live, or working on tracks, or doing vocal session work, I am pedal to the metal trying to get my music heard and establish myself in the industry.

My love don't cost a thang...

If you're not able to contribute financially to my campaign, no worries!  I totally get it.

I would be most grateful if you could share my video or campaign through your social media, to your friends, family etc.  You never know who might wanna help this dream come true!

Once again, thank you thank you!  Your support means the world to me!

story:
What Even Is This? 

Adrien and Lizbet have been making music together for the last 9 years, almost 7 of which they've been married. We're so excited to share our journey as we produce and release our first album!

What We Need & What You Get

We have a goal of $8000. This covers CD production ($3000), pressing albums ($375+), and Tees ($500). The rest of it will go towards the CD release show so that we can pay our musicians and Cinderblock Studio. 

Every bit of support we raise will help so much! We've been scrimping and saving to pull together the money for these projects, but musicians don't always make a lot of money so we're reaching out to our community to help make this happen!

As a thank you for your support, you'll get perks from us, things like digital releases, physical albums, custom artwork, and tickets to our release show!

Why The Last City? 

We don't claim to be the greatest musicians or the best songwriters, but we love our music and we're proud of what we've made! We think you'll like what you hear. If you want to get an idea of our music and how we sound, visit our YouTube (youtube.com/thelastcityband). 

We want to foster curiosity with our music community by curating cross cultural experiences at our shows that encourage people to have conversations with people that might be outside their normal circles. Having a well produced album and content that we can use to bring people into our community will give us a platform that we can share from and create better community with! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not able to contribute financially, we'd still love for you to be a part of this process! Please take a moment to share this campaign with others! Everything helps! Thank you so much for your time and your contributions!
story_txt:
What Even Is This? 
Adrien and Lizbet have been making music together for the last 9 years, almost 7 of which they've been married. We're so excited to share our journey as we produce and release our first album!

What We Need & What You Get
We have a goal of $8000. This covers CD production ($3000), pressing albums ($375+), and Tees ($500). The rest of it will go towards the CD release show so that we can pay our musicians and Cinderblock Studio. 
Every bit of support we raise will help so much! We've been scrimping and saving to pull together the money for these projects, but musicians don't always make a lot of money so we're reaching out to our community to help make this happen!
As a thank you for your support, you'll get perks from us, things like digital releases, physical albums, custom artwork, and tickets to our release show!

Why The Last City? 
We don't claim to be the greatest musicians or the best songwriters, but we love our music and we're proud of what we've made! We think you'll like what you hear. If you want to get an idea of our music and how we sound, visit our YouTube (youtube.com/thelastcityband). 
We want to foster curiosity with our music community by curating cross cultural experiences at our shows that encourage people to have conversations with people that might be outside their normal circles. Having a well produced album and content that we can use to bring people into our community will give us a platform that we can share from and create better community with! 
Other Ways You Can Help
If you're not able to contribute financially, we'd still love for you to be a part of this process! Please take a moment to share this campaign with others! Everything helps! Thank you so much for your time and your contributions!

story:
Join the Ride from Maine to Macon

Let’s say a big thank you to this incredible band for all the good vibes they’ve given us over the years by working together- through the strength of many, to get the Eat a Peach Tribute Guitar to the Allman Brothers' Big House Museum in Macon Georgia. With ABB manager Bert Holman and Museum director Richard Brent, we’re seizing the moment to make this crowdfunding campaign a success.

Here's what Big House Museum director Richard Brent says- " I have played this guitar and I am here to tell you that it plays and sounds every bit as good as it looks! We would be honored to have this at The Big House Museum for fans from all over to play and enjoy."

All levels of support are gladly welcomed and genuinely appreciated. Donation perks include market totes, museum memberships, special edition t-shirts, artwork, and a special one-of-a-kind tattoo. Donors at every level will have their name on a plaque to be displayed with the guitar at The Big House Museum.

I made the Eat a Peach tribute guitar from start to finish using skills learned when I worked for a small guitar company in Connecticut in the early 1980's.  The body features my marquetry rendition of the Allman Brothers' epic Eat a Peach album's inside cover design originally created by Flournoy Holmes and David Powell of Wonder Graphics.

The design is hand cut using wood veneers from many tree species. Once the cut veneers are glued onto the guitar and sanded smooth, I create lines and shading with a knife-tipped woodburning pen. On the Eat a Peach design, I tried my best to faithfully re-create all the marks of the original artwork. 

The most frequently asked question I get about the Eat a Peach guitar is "How long did it take you to make?" One answer is 59 years- my whole life. My folks had a shop in the basement and tools in the garage. A popular family question was always "What are you making?" I still use techniques that my dad taught me when I was very young.

Alongside this was the everpresent music in our house. Great music from Dylan and the Beatles on the turntable, my older brother's rock band practicing in the basement shaking the rafters. My early years as a guitar player included listening and learning the Allman Brothers albums. Highlights from my woodworking career include making two guitar designs for the Gibson Custom Shop's then running Visual Artist Program and creating marquetry for Hinckley Yachts.

How long to make the Eat a Peach guitar? Over 100 hours went into the marquetry design- from creating the working patterns to that final sanding before the finish goes on. I make my guitars in batches of three. Starting with planks of mahogany all the way to the point of plugging them in is a period of several months. I'm meticulous and want every inch of all my guitars to be just perfect.

The win/win/win 

When the crowdfund is over and the dust has settled, the Allman Brothers' Big House Museum will be the owner of the Eat a Peach tribute guitar. They will use the instrument to display and to play, and this was important to me. From the time I first plugged this guitar in it was clear that it was not a wall hanger, and that it belonged down South in Allman Brother country. The very act of promoting this campaign is also a way to get the word out about the Museum and it is my hope that those of you who contribute will also enjoy a visit there. It's an incredible place!

This campaign's purpose is to have funders provide the purchase price of the guitar and cover expenses for a trip for two to Macon Georgia so that I can present this guitar to the museum in a meaningful way. A bigger manufacturer of guitars can afford to give a guitar away, but that is not the case for my one-man shop. A finished guitar must be sold to provide capital to fund the next builds.

Speaking for myself, I've donated to several crowdfunding campaigns before and have found it to be fun. I liked chipping in early and keeping track of the campaign to see how it unfolds and ultimately to see if it succeeds. I've also enjoyed getting the perks offered.

In my campaign, I am really thankful that some very talented people have created or will create special artwork specific to the guitar and the greater subject of music. I'm especially grateful to Peter "Psychodelik Pete" Nogas, Michael Pierce, and Kevin Stiles for their creative efforts. I'm really excited to offer these perks and will introduce more cool offers as the campaign progresses.

Words of Support 

Richard Brent, Director of the Allman Brothers' Big House Museum-

 " I have played this guitar and I am here to tell you that it plays and sounds every bit as good as it looks! We would be honored to have this at The Big House Museum for fans from all over to play and enjoy."

 

 Silas Kopf, this country's leading marquetry artist and author of "A Marquetry Odyssey:     Historical Objects and Personal Work"-

"Do you like the Allman Brothers? 
Do you like marquetry? 
My friend Jim Macdonald likes both. He makes guitars and he plays guitars. And is a marquetry master. He has put these two loves together and made a one-of-a-kind instrument that he would like to see go to Macon, Georgia, the home of the Allman Brothers. 
Today I put on my Best of the Allman Brothers album, cranked up the volume, and when I got home I made a pledge to the crowd-sourcing effort. 
Perhaps you'll think about joining me?"

 

Sandy Blue Sky-

" I support this fundraiser to get the Eat a Peach tribute guitar to the Allman Brothers Museum. The Big House is where the ABB rehearsed "Blue Sky" and it was there during the rehearsals that I spoke with Duane in the kitchen for the last time. Thank you Jim Macdonald for all the years and patience for creating this beautiful guitar and tribute to the ABB and EAT A PEACH!!!"

 

Michael Pierce, Artist and creator of the very cool Maine to Macon Poster offered here-

"All you Macon music Allman Brothers and Sisters get on the bus and help bring this beautiful handmade Eat a Peach guitar to The Allman Brothers Band Museum at The Big House."

 

A friend and client's thoughts-

"The Allman Brothers were a huge influence on my generation here in the UK. Their music and musical ability were renowned and part of that great American tradition . Their reputation and exposure was even more enhanced by their relationship with Clapton. Fabulous musicians and great tunes."

 

Peter "Psychodelik Pete" Nogas, Artist and creator of the great guitar on truck T-shirt design

Meeting Brother Jim and his beautiful creation "Eat A Peach Tribute Guitar" was a special treat this February!

I have seen posts of this guitar a few years back and admired the skilled craftsmanship.

 I don't play guitar, but I appreciate those who do! To see a guitar transformed into a beautiful canvas that also plays beautifully is a real treat!

As an artist, I can tell you that this is a beautiful tribute piece to the legacy of the Allman Brothers Band and the "Eat A Peach Album" Album rock art at it's best!

A must see up close and in person. Jim Macdonald has created a beautiful monster.

Glad to have been able to hold, help raise awareness of, and help to find its way home in

Macon Georgia. 

PsychodelikPete

 

Skoots Lyndon- the letter that started this adventure!

"James, I just wanted to tell you how much I am impressed with your work/art/woodworking/luthier skills. I keep checking out your creations, but the Eat a Peach tribute was my introduction to your art. I was, and still am, without sufficient words. This particular guitar holds a special place. Our brother Twiggs was the original tour manager for the ABB. As Butch Trucks said he was the first member of the ABB since he is the one sent to Muscle Shoals to get Duane out of his contract with Rick Hall. He and Duane became each other's biggest fans. After Duane's passing Gregg gave Twiggs Duane's tobacco for that very reason. Twiggs kept the guitar and planned on giving it to Duane's daughter Galadrielle when she got old enough to be responsible for it. Unfortunately, Twiggs died in 1979. We three remaining brothers became stewards of the Burst until I, as per Twiggs' wish, handed it off to Galadrielle's mother at Duane's gravesite. Up until that time the Lyndon brothers had made sure it got played. Twiggs was the only guitarist in our family and not exactly the best at it. He and I had both worked for the Dixie Dregs so we allowed Steve Morse to play it on the road and in the studio. As with Duane, Steve and Twiggs became huge fans of each other. In 1996 I began working (my first time as one) as his guitar tech with Deep Purple and stayed with him for 9 years until I had had my fill of touring. Every time the photo of your Eat a Peach tribute guitar shows up I am reminded of time spent with Twiggs, Duane, and Steve. Thank you for such a lovely tribute to one of the best bands ever, in my opinion. Keep up your amazing playable art. You touch more people than you know James."

 

Help this campaign succeed- Contributing is the most direct thing you can do. Equally important is to help spread the news. "Sharing" with your friends is a powerful way you can help. 

Thanks for your support!

James Macdonald

story:
The Smith Sessions Presents: Bitches Brew

  • Bitches Brew is a concert series that started in Edinburgh by Emma Smith. We are now taking this to Toronto n April 28th at 19:30 at the Canadian Music Centre.

    The 4 bandleaders are:
  • Emma Smith, Edinburgh
  • Anh Phung, Toronto
  • Magdelys Savigne with OKAN, Toronto
  • Aline Homzy with Aline's étoile magique, Toronto
     
  • The intention of this project is to contribute to the normalization of women in leadership roles, in the context of jazz and improvised music. From Emma Smith’s website, Bitches Brew is: “… a night of music written / improvised and performed by some of the best female instrumentalists around. Flying in the face of reports that all-female bands are often seen by bookers and agents as novelty acts..." We will present an evening of eclectic music showcasing each leaders' rich musical voyage.
     
  • Your contributions will go directly to the musicians to pay for their artist fees which include performance fees, printing music fees, rehearsal fees, etc.
  • All of the money received is going to the musicians. We need $1800 to pay everyone fairly.

The Impact of your contribution

Being a creative musician in a city like Toronto is not easy. With a housing crisis, minimum wage increases and everything in between, artists are falling through the cracks and frankly, many are moving out of the city center. We need to keep creative people in the hub and show them they can thrive! Your support is a small step in doing this: providing a paid opportunity for these women to showcase their creative endeavors.

  • This project is truly an outstanding addition to Toronto's musical calendar.
     
  • This is our first time presenting this project in Toronto

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • One of the best ways you can help artists is to support them at their live shows, buy CDs/records directly from them and purchasing any merch they have. Another way you can help us here is by sharing this crowdsourcing page to everyone you know.
  • There are many helpful share-tools on this page to help you share it with your friends, family and colleagues.

There are many helpful share-tools on this page to help you share it with your friends, family and colleagues.

story:
“Threads of genius are present in everyone but only become visible when something creative is attempted…” William Blake

Family, Friends, Supporters:

I’m thrilled to share with you that I’m about to release not only 1 but 2 new albums in completely different genres of music Classical Guitar and Cinematic/Ambient. The release of these albums has been a deep journey of personal transformation for me, and my goal is to share not only my music with more of the world, but to help educate and inspire the next generation through hands-on experience of music creation.

While recording this Winter, I saw the movie Liyana about kids in Africa telling stories to heal and this threaded me into a desire to volunteer and facilitate music education in countries I’ve planned to travel to this year - Colombia, South Africa, Ethiopia, Ghana, and Southeast Asia.

But this also reawakened my desire to speak to kids in high schools and young adults in colleges with Keynote Concerts to inspire and help evoke their own creative genius.

As a coach and mentor, I realize the earlier we can tap into that spark of creative magic, the healthier and more empowered we become.

I remember when that little voice got louder and louder at the age of 16 that if I didn’t start learning to play guitar then, I might never learn. And I had only 2 years of very basic music education in Catholic grade school. Without supporting music and art education in early school, we neglect the imagination that seeks to erupt from the next generation, ready to share their gifts to help us all evolve together.

In 2017, while traveling through Europe, I experienced two powerful losses, my journal and my guitar, within two days that profoundly reoriented me towards my creative pursuits. 

After some time in deep contemplation in the mountains following this, I realized that a huge chunk of my soul had not been realized. I was hiking and listening to all of these songs I had channeled on guitar and wondering how these songs—which felt like abandoned children—could sound if properly recorded. Instead of trying to record myself, synchronicity helped me find a great engineer in Denver who has helped expand and enhance these songs with layers of percussion, bass, leads, and wonderful studio production.

The release for this album is planned for mid-May as part of my 40th birthday celebration as a full ritual with my CelestiOwl prayerformance accompanied by other dancers and aerial artists. I will then be sharing my music on tour this Summer in Europe and Colombia, and then Africa and Asia in Fall and Winter.

What I Need and What you Receive for your Generous Support

  • Studio Recording - $1200

  • Mixing and Mastering - $1000

  • Digital Distribution Costs - $300

  • Travel Abroad Costs - To Be Determined

  • UNIQUE PERKS!!

    • As an Astrologer and Life and Business Coach for 12 years, a unique perk with a larger contribution is individual, couples', or family Consultations or Written Reports

    • These can be Astrology, AstroLocality, Numerology, or the Human Design System

  • If we don't reach the full goal, funds will support the cost of studio time and production.
  • Any additional funds over the goal will be applied towards the travel costs for my music education and documentation abroad, as well as Remastering of my 3 previous studio albums: Theophany, Behold Beloved, and Haunt, so they can be released for digital distribution.

Further Impact - Music Education

My bigger vision includes working with a few different organizations in various countries to help with their music education programs. But also, my goal is to study the indigenous instruments and help foster appreciation for the traditions, especially in places where these sounds, and the cultures as a whole, are being swallowed up by the seductive appeal of competitive, consumerist ideals from the West. I will document any of this process of education and learning traditional instruments and create a film about this process.

Organziations include:

-Musical Ambassadors for Peace

-Playing for Change

If I don’t work directly with these organizations, I will be donating a portion of your support to them.  If you can't support me directly, please spread the word about these organizations, as well as my campaign, to your social networks.

In the future, I hope to speak to more young people and work with others to bring Ecstatic Dance and other music / dance education back into schools as a dominant part of the curriculum. Together, let's sing this dream into Being.

"A Human Being is a body wrapped around a Soul carrying a Dream" - Michael Meade

What Folks are Saying

“I don't think you know this so I will tell you here and now, I met my life partner while emerging through your music set at Rhythm Sanctuary. We now have a baby together. It is my experience of your music that unveiled me to him, and him to me…I dare you to receive our deepest appreciation for you and your gifts of vibrational orchestration.” - Laura Gilman

"VerDarLuz is a blessing to any community that is lucky enough to share time with him. The polyrhythmic layers and passion he brings to both his guitar and DJ offerings is matched in his speaking, his astrological readings, and his life coaching. The positive, synergistic effect he has on the communities he serves fosters emotional transformation through direct transmission, leaving audiences empowered and inspired. In Denver we are blessed a thousand-fold for the many ways he shows up in dedication to local and global evolution.”

Ahva Lenay, Rhythm Sanctuary Ecstatic Dance Ritual Midwife ARISE Music Festival Coordinator

If I don’t work directly with these organizations, I will be donating a portion of your support to them.  If you can't support me directly, please spread the word about these organizations, as well as my campaign, to your social networks.
In the future, I hope to speak to more young people and work with others to bring Ecstatic Dance and other music / dance education back into schools as a dominant part of the curriculum. Together, let's sing this dream into Being.
"A Human Being is a body wrapped around a Soul carrying a Dream" - Michael Meade

What Folks are Saying
“I don't think you know this so I will tell you here and now, I met my life partner while emerging through your music set at Rhythm Sanctuary. We now have a baby together. It is my experience of your music that unveiled me to him, and him to me…I dare you to receive our deepest appreciation for you and your gifts of vibrational orchestration.” - Laura Gilman
"VerDarLuz is a blessing to any community that is lucky enough to share time with him. The polyrhythmic layers and passion he brings to both his guitar and DJ offerings is matched in his speaking, his astrological readings, and his life coaching. The positive, synergistic effect he has on the communities he serves fosters emotional transformation through direct transmission, leaving audiences empowered and inspired. In Denver we are blessed a thousand-fold for the many ways he shows up in dedication to local and global evolution.”
Ahva Lenay, Rhythm Sanctuary Ecstatic Dance Ritual Midwife ARISE Music Festival Coordinator

story:
I am so excited to be back in the studio working on my next album: Reasons.

But first things first. I always get asked: what kind of music do you play?  I'm never sure how to answer that. So I'll let this review of one of our shows speak for me. “Grace's Morrison's music is somewhere between a rock and a hard place. It slides into the cracks and crevices of things that get overlooked. She is folk. She is pop. She’s unbelievably masterful behind the wheel of a guitar. Morrison’s vocal storytelling can make you cry; it can make you sing.”

So that's me. "between a rock and a hard place" :)

What we've done and where we are

After raising funds for my first EP (Redemption) through collecting cans (5 cents at a time) and then funding my first full length album (I'm the Apple) through bar gigs, I'm starting over again.  But this time we are aiming higher. It's not just about getting an album finished. We are going to promote the album with some amazing visual artists, we are going to tour to support the album and we are going to promote the album relentlessly. 

Here's the cool part, I've lined up the very best resources to work on this project. Jon Evans is producing the album. Jon has worked with the best female singer-songwriters of his generation including Tori Amos, Paula Cole, and Sarah McLachlan. 

Bryan Dos Reis is slated to help me with the visual presentation. Bryan is the man! He has worked with the likes of Jason Mraz, Guster, and Passenger. Pretty amazing, right? Check out Bryan's work...I'm lucky to have the opportunity to work with him. 

If you want to hear the kind of music that will be on the album check out the title track:

Let's do this together

Your support means everything to me. I don't take it lightly. Every ticket you buy is appreciated. Every CD purchase and every Facebook like make a difference. I've been singing since I was a teenager and this is only my second full length album. There's a reason for that. I only want to give you my very best. Every time you tell a friend to check out my music I want them to want to hear more; to want to watch a video; to want to see me live.

What you get

I tried to come up with some unique perks.

  • I'd love to come play a house concert for you! 
  • Let's write a song together!
  • How about handwritten lyrics to your favorite song?
  • I'll be your personal jukebox...you tell me the song and we will cover it and send you a video!

Where will your money go?

Your money will go directly to helping me offset the costs of not only making this album and putting out into the world.  Those costs include:

  • $15,000 Recording: session artists, studio costs, and mixing (I want the songs to sound amazing!)
  • $2,500 Multi-media: performance videos, photos, etc. (I want the songs to look amazing!)
  • $3,000 Touring: travel expenses and festival applications (I want to sing with you!)
  • $1,000 PR push: promotion, marketing, mailing (I want to build the community!)

Risks and challenges

The music industry is a fickle and strange place in 2018. There is so much competition. And, let's be honest I am not a great salesperson! But I am getting better. This is step one :). I can also tell you this: I have surrounded myself with like-minded hard working people. 

But, I literally and figuratively can't do it without you.

This feels different than any other musical project I have ever worked on.  This record is everything to me, and it would mean the world if you would help me make it.

Other ways you can help

If you want to help but you can't financially swing it, please know that I completely understand.

Here's how you can help OTHER than with your money:

1. Share this link on all your social media accounts.  (Do it once a week, do it once a day, I just need you to tell our story to your friends.)

2. Start Following us online at Facebook, Twitter, and Youtube! 

3. Post a personal request to your closest of friends to help us! (If it comes from you, they might give me a listen, and I promise that if you vouch for me musically, your people won't be disappointed.)

And as always my friends are there to play with me live!

story:
Short Summary

Here are some things you should know about "A Drama with Dragons" and its team.

  • My name is Nicole Crilly and I am the producer of this cabaret. This is my senior capstone project. As an Entertainment & Arts Management student, I wanted to learn first-hand what producing a show would entail.
  • I have experience in administration and development. I worked as a development intern at MCC Theater in New York City in 2017 and I am a member of the Association of Performing Arts Professionals.
  • I wanted to create an opportunity for Drexel songwriters to perform their own work live.
  • I also wanted to create an opportunity for other Drexel students to gain hands-on experience by working on the administrative team for this project.
  • Your donations will help make this show a reality for me, the songwriters, and the administrative team.

What We Need

Your donations will help pay for:

  • Venue Supervisors
  • Sound Technicians
  • Lighting Technicians
  • Ringers
  • Rehearsal Space Rental Fees
  • Lighting and Sound Equipment
  • Transportation
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Here is what your donation will do:

  • Create an opportunity for up-and-coming artists to produce new work and perform it live.
  • Help carve out a space for young people of various backgrounds to tell their own stories.
  • Provide an opportunity for students to apply the skills they've learned in the classroom to the real world.
  • Allow artists to do what they do best - make art

Risks & Challenges

Here are some of the challenges we face:

  • All of us are young. We are learning. That's what this project is all about - learning how to be artists and managers.
  • We are also learning how to fundraise. As is common in the arts industry, we must rely on donated revenue to make this show a reality. This is a great opportunity for the arts managers on our team to learn about fundraising and development.
  • Most of us are students and some of us (especially the alumni) have jobs. Our education and our careers are a fulltime commitment. This project represents a passion for a lot of us and I want to make it as easy as possible for my team to pursue their passions without sacrificing their education or their careers. Your donation will make that a much easier process.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute - and that's okay! If you are one of those people, that doesn't mean you can't help

  • Spread the word about this project.
  • Share this campaign on social media!
  • Tell your friends, especially if they're interested in music/theatre and/or have a large following on social media

Thank you for your support!

Nicole Crilly
Producer and Executive Director

story:
What are we doing here? 

  • Why did we think this was a good idea? 
  • What can anybody hope to accomplish in 2017?
  • Regardless, we need your help so that we may release this art into the world. 
  • We recorded seven unique compositions and eight improvised interludes to create a diverse yet unified album to reflect the bombastic but thoughtful nature of this band.
  • The Octopod is my composition baby and I am actually very proud of this record and incredibly excited for you to hear it, and throwing in what you can here will make this possible!

BRASS TACKS

We need 'round about $3500 doll hairs. Here's why:

  • Recording (by the amazing Michael Briggs of Civil Audio)
  • Mixing/Mastering (same)
  • CD Reproduction 
  • Album Artwork (by the super talented Cameron Cox)
  • Album Font/Design (by the awesome Meg Gallagher)
  • Promo Videos (by the hometown hero Bokyung Choi)
  • Interlude Animations (by the elusive Conner Eisenmenger)
  • IndieGoGo Fees
  • Slush Fund for Taco Lobbying (self-explanatory)

But Why?

  • This is music we are incredibly proud of and we think you, the consumer of musics, will really enjoy it.
  • We are self-releasing this album in order to acquaint ourselves with what all really goes in to creating a record, and how to best go about it.
  • You know you love Conner's interludes.

Also Look At Our Useful and Fancy Rewards

Such as...

  • Scores to individual tunes
  • Extra videos and early release of materials
  • Extra secret content
  • HQ downloads of interlude animations and other videos
  • Other silly things

Anyway...

Album release shows on 

01.09.17 – Austin, TX – Beerland

01.10.17 – Denton, TX – Dan's Silverleaf

Thanks so much for your consideration!

story:
Short Summary

Hey guys! We are North American Pharaohs, an Alternative/Indie band from San Antonio, Texas. We first want to thank everyone for all the support you have given us so far and thank you for visiting our funding page.  Here is what our page is all about:

  • We are currently working on our debut full-length album.
  • We have some great perks for you as a thank you for your support.
  • All your support will go towards our studio time and release expenses.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are aiming to raise $5,400 over the next 60 days
  • We have some great perks including a physical signed copy of our EP and album, Digital Album Download, original hand-written lyrics, cover song of your choice, album liner note credit, and much more. 
  • Take a listen to our debut EP 'Is This What You Want' https://open.spotify.com/artist/1tGHZQTK8miyC4S...

The Impact

Your contribution will go towards recording our debut full-lenght album. With your donation you choose from our list of perks. This album is going to be the base we will use in order to reach more people and share our music with them. Your contribution will be greatly appreciated. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can make a contribution, Awesome! But here some other ways you can help:

  • Please share this with all your family and friends on your social media pages. 
  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Spotify, Youtube, and all other major platforms to keep up to date with the progress on our album and more.

THANK YOU SO MUCH!
